name: Find kødbenet
description:
From the box:
Who has the best memory and is the first to collect three bones?

name: Snyd
description: A card game where the object is to cheat/bluff the other players into thinking you don't have the cards they need. The trick is not to get caught.

name: Permis de conduire
description: A game designed to help French people pass their driving school. You move around a track and answer questions on the laws of driving in France.

name: FAST Boxing
description:
From the publisher's website:

FAST Boxing is a round by round game in which fighter’s will perform uncannily close their real life abilities. In FAST Boxing, fighters are rated for scoring ability, punching power, endurance, defense, ability to absorb punishment, ability to be knocked down or knocked out, and even how their reputation as a fighter affects the judges.

FAST Boxing features all of the nuances of professional boxing that you see in real life bouts. Quick KO’s, TKO’s, close decisions, will all occur on your tabletop with real life accuracy with FAST Boxing. As in real life boxing, ANYTHING can happen, but you won’t see the flash KO’s and huge upsets with regularity in FAST Boxing, like you do with other boxing games.

name: The New Lone Ranger Game
description: This Parker Brothers game is different from the 1938 release with the same name. The 1956 version is a simple track game in which players play the parts of the Lone Ranger and Tonto. The board depicts the Wild West including trails and hideouts for outlaws. On your turn, you roll the dice and either move the Lone Ranger piece the amount shown on the white die, or the Tonto piece the amount shown on the colored die (all players move the same two pieces). If you land on a Star space next to a hideout, you spin the "Six Shooter" spinner to see if you score a hit. If you did, you turn over the disk on the hideout. If it has a bandit's name, you keep the disc and will score the points shown on it. If, however, the disc reads "Ambush", then the piece that was ambushed is captured and placed on the hideout space. A captured piece is released and returned to the Sheriff's Office if a player rolls doubles. When all the disks have been turned over, the game ends and the player with the highest point total wins.
categories: American West, Movies / TV / Radio theme
publishers: Parker Brothers, Peter Pan Playthings, West 11 Designs

name: Kykkelimø
description: In this game the players are on a farm, trying to be the first player to get a complete set of animals: a sheep, a cow, a horse, a cock, a dog and a cat. The animal counters (each with a picture of one of these animals) are mixed and placed face down in the middle of the game board. Each player chooses a pawn and puts it on the start square.

name: Rødhette
description: This game is based on the Grimm fairy tale featuring Little Red Riding Hood. Each player picks a character, which, unlike most other childrens games, have different goals: Little Red Riding Hood must get to grandmas house without being caught by the wolf. The wolf must try and catch Little Red Riding Hood and at the same time watch out for the hunter. The hunter wins the game if he manage to shoot the wolf.

name: Butt Out
description:
From the publishers website:
Will the grumpy goat BUTT your climbers off the mountain before they reach the top? BUTT OUT is a brilliant action game for kids, chock full of thrills, excitement and all-out fun.

name: Æblejagten
description: Ælblejagten (English for Apple hunt) is a game were the players try to pick as many apples as soon as they are ripe. Whoever picks the most wins.

name: Maniac Mouse
description:
This children's dexterity game features a plastic motorized mouse. To start, each player is given a mouse catcher "paw"
(plastic hook). The mouse is placed on the floor in a wide-open area and a piece of "cheese" is firmly inserted into its mouth. One player pushes its tail to the "on" position and it begins to scurry about in erratic circles. As soon as it has turned one full circle, all players quickly try to hook the loop in its tail using their mouse catcher "paws". The first player to catch it lifts it off the floor and collects the piece of cheese in its mouth. But be careful! If it touches you while moving, you must give up a piece of cheese. The first player to collect four pieces of cheese wins.

Similar to Maus voraus!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Electronic

name: Ditto!
description: Pre-schoolers will love this fun-filled "matching" game. The leader draws a card and identifies the picture on the card. The player with the matching picture on his board calls "ditto!" The one who called "ditto" takes the card and places it on his playing board. The first one to cover all his pictures is the winner. For two to six players, Ages 3 - 6.

name: Recipe for Romance
description: This is a bubble bath game for couples to play. Players try to match pairs of "ingredients" cards. When they do they must follow the romantic instructions of the cards. Players continue searching for matches until all "ingredients" are found. Then player with the least amount of matches must draw a (real) bubble bath and soap down the winner.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Adventure, Card Game, Exploration, Mature / Adult, Memory

name: No Sweat
description:
A game that combines rolling dice and exercise.

From the website:

Game Objectives...

Objective 1 - To be the first person to completely shade in the entire body pad by rolling those parts with the white dice: which means you’re totally fit to enter the track and field competition.

Objective 2 - To collect enough cash to pay your way onto the game board (track and field events).

Objective 3 - To be the first person around the track and cross the "Finish Line" to collect the Gold Medal.

Throw the dice. The numbers thrown will correspond to a body part on the figure illustrated on the player's game pad. The referee pays the player the amount of money indicated on the body part. The player then shades in that body part and the dice are passed to the next player.

When a player rolls doubles, the player must choose to either perform an exercise or, in an attempt to avoid exercising, pull a Chance Card.

Etc...

name: Samsonite Baseball Game
description: Another game offering from the luggage company, Samsonite. In this work, a custom card deck drives the baseball action between the two players. Runners advance and score as per standard baseball rules.

name: Spellstones
description:
Spellstones combines the strategy of a card-based spellcasting duel with the hand-eye coordination of a real-time action game. The result is a fast-paced puzzle game requiring quick thinking and even quicker fingers! Players manipulate sixteen stone tiles to form the patterns (Runes) needed to cast spells at their opponents. Will your Fireball best your opponent's Heat Shield? It all depends on who can build his Runes the fastest.

Consists of a rulebook, 32 "stone" tiles (cut from a stone-like flooring material and hand-painted; this game was most definitely a basement production by the designer), and two complete sets of spell cards (DTP quality). Rated for ages 10-adult. Each set supports 2 players, so you can add more sets for multi-player battles. The game comes with 22 spell cards for each player for use in a 2-player game, and 16 more for each player that are designed for multi-player use only.

name: Baby Boomer
description:
DTP effort from 1989, can be played solo. Baby has a gun at the end of the hallway. Try to get Mom, Dad, or Officer Bill down the hallway before baby (actions determined by die rolls) bumps them off. I think this is an attempt at black humor, but it's kind of disturbing, and pretty random.

From the back of the rules:

"OH NO!
Too late you realize your toddler has found your fully loaded Krup 9000, 16 shot, Near Silenced, Semi Auto pistol.
Sitting at the end of the hall baby is playing with a lethal weapon.

Baby is about to have a lot of fun.
The dog was the first victim.

Will you be next?

BABY BOOMER is a solo or group board game that keeps everybody on their toes as they race down the hall to disarm the toddler. Six sided dice, and Diapers not included."
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation, Square Grid, Variable Set-up
publishers: Tri Tac Games LLC (Tri Tac Talents)

name: Third Great War
description:
This is a Japanese wargame set during the NATO vs. Warsaw pact dust up that is World war three.

5wg-25

name: Hot Spots
description:
From the instructions: "The object of the game is to keep your political conflict going while every other player has ended his conflict. There is only one winner. This person wins because his political conflict is still in existence, and the money, planes, and soldiers that go with is will boom his economy. When the conflict ends, the soldiers, planes, and most of the money usually end also. Whoever ends his conflict loses the game."

Role and move game where players try to escalate political conflict by landing on the right squares and collecting cards granted by landing on the correct squares.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Fire
description:
The object of this game is to be in possession of the greatest amount of Heavenly Gain when the word "FIRE" is shouted. As the player improves his position, he may "trans-mint" his Earthly Barter, "Wood, Hay and Stubble", which burns up completely when "FIRE" is announced, into Heavenly Gain, "Gold, Silver and Precious Stones", which is imperishable.

(quoted from the introduction to the rules)

Players dig through a pile of alphabet tiles to spell out short answers to Bible-related questions, e.g. an acceptable answer to "A person who turned into a Pillar of Salt" would be MRS. LOT. If you get an "Upon the Foundation" card, you have to spell out a word of "some specific meaning and significance in connection with the Foundation provided for our Salvation", e.g. BLOOD, DEATH, or CROSS.
categories: Party Game, Religious, Trivia, Word Game

name: Topping the Charts
description:
The object of the game is to be the first player to sell a million records and be awarded a gold record. To accomplish this your band will have to play the nightclub circuit to earn money for the recording studio fee. When you succeed in cutting an album, you take your bad on the promotional tour to build sales. During this time you will also have to make a music video.

Game includes game board, gold record token, 10 red discs, 6 playing pieces, 1 6-sided die, game board, score pad, play money, stack of "Turn of Events" cards, and instructions

name: Americard U.S.A.
description: AMERICARD U.S.A. is a compendium of five quizzes using flash cards, each of which contain a silhouette of each state and quiz questions, and a blank map of the United States.
publishers: International Learing Corporation, WFF 'N PROOF Games

name: Join 5 Turn
description: Join 5 Turn is an abstract strategy game for people ages 4 and up. It is basically a new twist on an old game. The old game being Connect Four - or in this case, five. each player has 13 tiles either red or blue and they try to get four or five in a row depending on the variation being played (there are three included with the game) the twist is that the board is mounted on an angled post and every time you place a tile you rotate the board a quarter turn. this causes the tiles to shift and adds a new strategy element to an old game

name: Elliot Moose Card Game
description:
From the box: At first glance, a lot of cards look alike. But if you look carefully you can see the differences. On some cards Elliot is holding a book. On others, his shirt has a moon instead of a star!

While playing the fast action games, children practice early observation and discrimination skills, essential elements in everyday reasoning.

Can you see what's different?

Ages 3 and up

name: The Bicycle Game
description: The Bicycle Game was one of several board games published in the 1890s about that exciting new sport, bicycling. The board depicts an oval shaped racetrack divided into spaces. The object of the game is to win the race.

name: Fan-Tel
description: This vintage "fan that tells your fortune" game includes 48 fan-blade shaped fortune telling sticks packaged in a cardboard tube.

name: The Elsie Game
description: This vintage game involves rolling dice and moving tokens that represent cows along a set of winding paths. It is based on Elsie the Cow, which is a well known old mascot of the Borden Dairy Company. The goal of the game is to get the cows into the barn, which is located in the center of the board.

name: Little Orphan Annie
description: The Little Orphan Annie Game is vintage game based on the famous comic strip character. It includes a circular patterned board, four dice and two shakers, and little cardboard pieces with wooden bases that represent the characters from the strip. The first player to reach the center of the board is the winner.

name: Tintin et Milou vers la lune
description: Based on the famous comic by Hergé in this game you follow Tintin and his friends on their journey to the moon.

name: King Zor: The Dinosaur Game
description:
From Erik Arneson at About.com:

"Produced by Ideal in 1962, this game is based on the toy of the same name. It came with four cavemen to represent the players (green, yellow, red, blue), 16 dinosaurs (four each in the same colors), a variety of dinosaur eggs, two decks of cards, a spinner, and the game board. The board was illustrated with about two dozen dinosaurs, plus various geological features."
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Prehistoric

name: Full Metal Conquête
description:
Published in Backstab magazine n°43 (March/May 2003 - FC Publications [Asmodée / Halloween Concept]) as an homage to the original and very rare game Full Metal Planète.

10 years after the mineral gold rush from the Full Metal Planète game, the spacecrafts are returning to the mother planet only to reach it after a nuclear war that devastated the Earth. Instead of joining forces, the 2 groups continue their rivalry in trying to save the remaining survivor who are hidden in bunkers.

Full Metal Conquête allows 2 players to try to save survivors on a devastated Earth.

There is no change in the rules. Water was replaced by radioactivity, but everything works the same with different names.

Map is 13 x 30 hexes.

All the game (i.e. rules, counters, map) is on the central poster of the magazine. Counter must be glued on cardboard and cut.

The game is produced in French.

name: TaleSpin: Flying Aces & Air Show
description:
This is actually two separate decks of 20 cards each, used to play (minor) variations of a couple of children's card games with a light TaleSpin theme.

Air Show, played with the cards depicting characters from the show, is a Memory-type game. The cards are dealt, face down, in a 4-by-5 rectangle. Players take turns flipping two cards face up; if they match, the player keeps the pair and goes again, otherwise the cards are flipped face down and the turn passes to the next player. One minor rule that I don't remember from the original Memory game is that, once a pair is removed, the holes that are thus formed are immediately filled by shifting cards to the right.

Flying Aces, played with the cards depicting the airplanes, is a variant of War. Each player is given a stack of cards; everyone places their top card face up in the center of the table, and if exactly one player plays a Sea Duck, they win all the cards; otherwise, it's a tie, and everyone goes again.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Jack & Jane in an Aeroplane
description: The game box contains only the game board and 1 bone die (according to the instructions, counters were not supplied as the players were expected to provide their "Aeroplanes" with lead, paper figures or counters). Printed in Bavaria by the British games manufacturer "Spears" before WWI, it's one of the many clones of the older "The Game of Goose". The mechanic is fair simple, with the players alternating rolling the die and advancing their counters, ending by chance on some bonus or malus spaces and resolving the special effects before passing the turn to the next player. The game ends as the winning player reaches the winning post (50).
categories: Aviation / Flight, Children's Game, Dice, Racing
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Monster Tank
description:
Part of their sports and adventure series, this is a simple tactical game on modern tank battles.

Published by Ad Technos in Japanese.

name: The Nuclear Energy Game
description:
"Own, Operate, or Meltdown Your Own Plant."

The Nuclear Energy game is one of several to come out in the wake of the incident at Three Mile Island. Players attempt to acquire operating licenses for nuclear power plants, which serve as a source of income. Similarly, they try to avoid meltdowns or other mishaps at those same plants. Licensed sites serve as a source of income from other players who land on them as well as producing contract fees in their own right. After a pre-determined amount of time (the designer suggests 90 minutes), players tally assets and the person with the highest total wins.

There are humorous touches in both the instructions and on the game board, ranging from the disclaimer that any small errors "were incorporated intentionally in order to confuse the foreign intelligence community," to a sign pointing away from the power plant marked "fallout shelter" and another pointing straight down marked "China". The back page gives a line-item account of the actual events at Three Mile Island leading to the release of radioactive gas.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: IQ Squared
description:
Move round the board and answer bronze, silver or gold IQ questions for 1, 2 or 3 points. Collect points to move to another circuit on the board, and then to the center. A bit like trivial pursuit but with IQ questions.

It has the makings of a great game, but lacks something which keeps your attention. Have rarely played it to the finish.
categories: Math, Number, Puzzle, Trivia, Word Game

name: R.A.G.
description:
"Welcome to the world of publishing: As a publisher of the Weekly Rag, thousands of readers look to you for news and gossip. Your tabloid is seeking to have the best stories in the business. Deal the cards and write some headlines!"

Self-published game consisting of 96 word cards, a few blank cards and a couple of quick-reference cards. Each word card has 4 different words on it along with either a positive sign ( + ) or a negative sign ( - ). Words are articles, nouns, verbs, adjectives or adverbs. Different symbols correspond to the different parts of speech.

Everyone is dealt 10 cards face down (your personal pile) and players then draw 3 of those cards to form a hand. Remaining cards form a draw pile. On your turn, you may start a headline with a noun or article card, add a card to your headline (following normal sentence structure), add a card to someone else's headline (if you have a headline of your own started) or pass (and draw a card from the draw pile). If you use a card from your hand, you draw a card from your personal pile. Headlines must start with a noun or article and must contain at least 2 nouns and 1 verb. The headline is completed and set aside when the second noun is placed.

The round continues until a player runs out of cards from both their personal pile and their hand. Each player then scores their completed headlines. Incomplete headlines do not score any points. Subtract the number of negative cards from the number of positive cards in the headline. If the result is positive, this is your score. If the result is negative, take the absolute value as your score (e.g. you get 4 points for a score of -4).

The first player to reach a score of 10 wins the game. However, "The primary purpose of RAG is to be entertaining. Many of the headlines will be funny. Some of them will be VERY funny! Enjoy the game and laugh a lot. Laughing is good for you!"

name: On the Road to Abha
description: On the Road to Abha is a game designed to increase awareness of the sites of historical, cultural, and natural interest in Saudi Arabia. It offers rules for two games, both of which are very simple. The first is a standard "roll-and-move" race from Riyadh to Abha. The second is a collection game, where players attempt to pick up the most coffee pot tokens along the way.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Hero's Realms
description:
This is a Japanese tactical fantasy game published by Tsukuda hobbies.

This reminds me of Melee where the players play pre generated characters and fight them with each other or monsters ala arena style combat.

name: Beat the Warden
description:
The object of the game is to get all your four cars safely parked in a meter bay. This game dates from the 1960s, when metered parking was relatively new in the UK.

The board shows a network of one- and two-way roads and a number of parking bays. Using numbers rolled on 2 dice the players must move each of their cars from the starting garage to a bay. Exact moves only, and no reversing! There are some traffic lights on the board which at times allow or deny access along certain roads.

The player's turn consists of move one or two cars, then take a card. The cards are:

Parking meter - collect 4 of these
Warden - immediately pay £1 for each parked car
Tame Warden - retain and use to counteract a Warden
Speeding - immediately pay a £2 fine
Traffic Lights - change the lights
Bank - retain until able to stop outside a Bank, then collect £5

Players can bump another parked car out of a bay, unless the owner has a Meter card for each car parked.

name: De Vlucht van de Uiver
description:
From the box:
"A tense game for 3 to 6 players where tactics, daring and entrepreneurship determine the result.
Go on a flight from Schiphol (main airport of Amsterdam, NL) to Melbourne (AU) experiencing all events that come and go with such a trip.
This game is published to commemorate the flight of the historical "Uiver" in 1984 in a single limited edition."

name: Lernabenteuer Tiere unserer Welt
description:
In Tiere unserer Welt (translated to Animals of our World), children learn 30 different animals, where they live and which group they belong to. Much more information is provided by Zoo director "Animalfriend" in the accompanying booklet - that is, that whales aren't fish, they're mammals, what a mammal is, and where they live.

—description from Spielbox

name: Lernabenteuer Papier & Co., Was gehört wohin?
description:
Papier & Co., Was gehort wohin? (translated to Paper & Co., What goes where?) deals with our garbage and how it is separated. Through play, children learn what goes into which barrel, what makes up our garbage, and what happens to it after it is thrown away.

—description from Spielbox

name: Wieso? Weshalb? Warum? Mein Indianerspiel
description:
A description of the game from Spielenet:

Discover - Question - Understand. A knowledge game.

When did Indians smoke the peace pipe? What's a tomahawk? This tile-laying game is fun and explains to children that life as a Native Indian was like. By placing the tiles correctly, the overall picture emerges. In the process, not only points but also information is collected. Two variants are also included.

name: Over the Edge Football
description:
Over the Edge Football is a tabletop game. Remember playing paper football in school? Well, now you have an electronic triangular unit that simulates the football.

You still push it back and forth over the table, but the unit keeps score, times the quarters, and even has voice and stadium sounds.

When you turn the unit on, lights will let you know who has possession of the 'ball'. To score a touchdown, the unit has sensors underneath that will register when it goes over (but does not fall off) the edge of the table. Each side has four downs to score a point before a turnover occurs. It also has a special setting for field goal attempts.

name: Spellarama
description:
Cool letter card game you can print-off for free...Works with sound cards + charts...The card game uses sounding, hearing, seeing, memorizing, hands-on and creative thinking...

Discover the POWER OF PLAY
categories: Card Game, Educational, Memory, Party Game, Word Game

name: Huckleberry Hound Western Game
description: Huckleberry Hound roll and move game
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Table Top Raceway
description:
Table Top Raceway is a simulation of
Big Time Stock Car Racing!
No two laps are the same!
Use Tactics Like
Drafting & Sling shoting!

Just like racing a real automobile, you will control your car's speed and tactics. There are no dice to roll nor spinners to spin, you will control your car by using a Performance Indicator for the car. The Performance Indicator will show the car's current speed, acceleration, braking and cornering abilities. You will be "in the drivers seat" and will accelerate your car, race down the straights and attack each corner, within the limits allowed by the Performance Indicator. As you move your car around the Table Top Raceway you will change lanes, maneuver for position with your competition and plan how to take each corner. Sound interesting? It is!!!

Come along with us. The Races Are About To Begin!!!

to learn more visit: www.tabletopraceway.com
categories: Action / Dexterity, Collectible Components, Party Game, Racing, Sports, Transportation
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Point to Point Movement, Simulation

name: Family Cricket
description:
The game is ideally played by two players each of whom is the captain of a team.
Captain throws die to determine who bats first.

The fielding captain shuffles the bowling card deck and places it face down on the table. The fielding captain sets his field by placing one man in the shaded area for the wicketkeeper, one man in the shaded area of board for the bowler and his remaining men in nine different selected positions on the field. (The fielding captain may reset his field at any time between bowls)
The batting captain places one batsman at the wicket. Each time the batting team loses a wicket, the captain of the team surrenders one of his remaining ten counters (representing his batsmen) to the opposition captain. When the last of these ten counters has been lost the innings is closed.

Play begins with the fielding captain turning over the top card of the bowling deck. This action represents one bowl. The card tells where the bowler has aimed.
Hitting the ball: batter spins both spinners and then throws two dice to determine how he hits the ball.

name: Memory Spin & Match
description: This memory game uses a plastic case covered with doors. A picture wheel is inserted into the case and is spun with a lever. On your turn, you open two of the doors and show the pictures revealed to all the players. If the two pictures match, you open two more doors and so on. If the pictures don't match, you close all the doors and pass the case to the next player. The first player that opens all the doors on a single turn wins.

name: May I? Memory Game
description: In this memory game, you must ask permission from the other players to advance across the board. Each player takes 2 picture cards from the deck and places them face down on the table. The pictures on the cards (skateboard, hot dog etc.) show the spaces on the board owned by that player. On your turn, you begin advancing your pawn one space at a time along the track. You must get permission to enter a space owned by another player by saying "May I" and the name of the player that owns the space. If you do not ask permission, the owner says "Stop!", reveals the picture card and turns it face down again. You say nothing on an unowned space. You may continue moving as long as you don't make a mistake, so as more and more cards are revealed, players can travel further and further along the track during a turn. The first player to reach the finish space wins. For a more challenging game, players may draw 3, 4 or 5 cards.

name: Dolly and Daniel Whale Game
description:
Package description:
Dolly & Daniel, the two frisky little whales, usually play with the Eskimos on the icebergs of the Arctic Ocean. However, once every year, they travel to the Antarctic to visit their friends, the penguins. As they move along, they meet some friendly "spouting" whales, who help them. They also encounter some polar bears, who delay them, and 'the' angry angler who sends them back.
The girl players are "Dolly" whales and the boys are "Danny" whales.
The object of the game is to be the first whale to reach the Antarctic.

name: Kreuzweise
description:
From a translation of the rules:

Kreuzweise was designed to play at home or when away. It is compact and the optimized material chosen for the high quality playing cards is thin, flexible and easy to clean. Where ever you play Kreuzweise, enjoy!

Basically, it's a tile-laying puzzle game where points are scored based upon the number of matching edges.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Mickey Go-Along Games
description: This children's card game, with a Mickey Mouse travel theme, is actually four games-in-one. In the first game, players draw an outfit card and then simultaneously grab clothing cards off the table, racing to be the first to find all four articles of their characters outfit. The second game is a simple memory game where players turn over face down clothing cards trying to (once again) complete their characters outfit. In the third game, players add an item to Mickey's suitcase and must then repeat every item (in order of the ever growing sequence) that has already been packed. The forth game is a simple rummy variant in which players try to collect all four pieces of clothing for any outfit by drawing cards from the deck or asking opponents for a specific type of card.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: The Yearbook Game
description:
Ages 10 - 16

Manufacturer's Summary:
"The game created for girls, by girls" The questions and activities all revolve around your friends, your teachers and your classmates.

Teen and pre-teen girls love to gossip about EVERYTHING. Now, there's a game designed to encourage fast-paced, fun and non-threatening conversation that helps girls know more about themselves and each other. Your girls will love it!!

name: Perchance
description:
This Canadian offering is a hybrid of card lottery and poker, played with a large scoring board and nine differently-colored decks of cards (one for each player, plus a "dealer" deck).

The games is played in rounds, where the dealer plays a number of cards face-up, and one face-down. Players decide whether the round will be lottery-style (person with the most matches to the dealer's hand wins), or poker-style (bidding on your hand plus cards from the dealer's hand).

As an added bonus, the game promises to (and I quote from the box): "...help you and your friends lighten and brighten gloomy days, warm up cold ones and cool off hot ones."

name: Road Scholar
description:
A roll & move game to teach Spanish. Ages 8 and up.

From the back of the game box: Pack up your knowledge, memory, and luck and get ready to roll on a Road Scholar Spanish journey. From the START at the airport to the END at the Ancient Ruins, you'll have great fun learning an amazing amount of Spanish as you navigate the perilous twists and turns of the road.

Components: game board, English instructions, 300 word and phrase cards, Two 60-minute audio cassettes, playing pieces, colored die.

Game instructions are provided in English.

Publisher's web site: http://www.pentonoverseas.com/road-scholar.htm

name: Drake
description: There is a gadget that slides discs of differing size down one side, simulating a waterfall. On the discs are cubes of different colors which represent different points. If you cause these cubes to fall off during your turn, they will belong to the player before you. So this is a mix of dexterity and push your luck game.

name: Mickey Pop-Along Shape Games
description: This children's pizza game, with a Mickey Mouse theme, is actually 4 games-in-one. In the first game, you pop the popper die and find the pizza that matches the shape popped. You "deliver" the pizza to the character whose hands are shown on the card. The player who delivers the last pizza wins. Game #2 is a memory game. You pop the popper and turn over a pizza card. If it matches the shape and color of the pizza you popped, you take the character card that ordered that pizza. The player with the most character cards at the end wins. Game #3 is a typical memory game where players try to get the most matching pairs. Game #4 is an advanced version of Game #1.
categories: Children's Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Mickey The Balancing Baker
description: This game features a Mickey Mouse dressed like a baker. He stands on a wobbly base and holds an empty tray in each hand. All players take an equal number of pie pieces from the supply. On your turn, you place one of your pies on either of Mickey's trays. If you place it without having it, or any other pie already on the tray(s) fall off, your turn is over. If the pie falls, or knocks off any of the pies already on Mickey's trays, you must take the fallen pies and add them to your supply. The first player to get rid of all of his or her pies wins.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Mighty Morphin Power Rangers Audio Game
description: This is actually 2 games that use an audio cassette to direct the game play. Game #2 (Side B on the tape) is a more complex version of Game #1 (Side A on the tape). To start each player takes a board that depicts all 5 Teen Heroes. The tape will tell you when to draw cards and when to battle. The object is to cover your Heroes with their Power Ranger counterpart cards. A Rita Repulsa card may be played on an opponent to make him or her lose a turn. A Putty card is immediately discarded (thus wasting a draw). A Space Alien card may be placed on an opponents Power Ranger card forcing that player to play another Ranger card on that space. A Megazord card defeats a Space Alien and/or prevents further attacks on that space. The first player to morph all the Teen Heroes on his or her game board into the corresponding Power Rangers wins.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Mighty Mouse Game
description:
This is a simple track game based on the Mighty Mouse comics. On your turn you roll the die and advance the number of spaces indicated. If your roll would land you on an opponent's pawn, you move backwards instead. If you land on a hazard space, you are stuck, and must spend your next turn(s) moving the Mighty Mouse piece to your space. When Mighty Mouse reaches your space, he releases you and any other player caught in a hazard. The first player to reach the Finish space by exact count wins. If your roll would take you past Finish, you move backwards instead.

This is seemingly a different game from Terrytoons Mighty Mouse Game

name: Hunting In The Wilds
description: Roll and move board game involving Wildlife Hunting. Very attractive board with three revolving sections. Nice period colors on the box illustration. Game includes cards representing animals and tokens representing the hunters

name: Hawkeye and the Last of the Mohicans
description: Strange shooting game with stand up sections with six Mohicans riding horses. The object to knock over the figures with a rubber suction cup dart gun.
categories: Action / Dexterity, American West, Party Game

name: Milk & Cookies
description: This children's memory game features an electronic plastic cow and 4 milk glasses. On your turn, you take a cookie from the cookie jar and dunk it into one of the glasses. If you hear a "Boing!", the glass is empty so put the cookie back. If you hear a "Mmmooo", you found the milk that goes with that cookie - keep it and put it on your plate (the "Mmmooo" moves to another glass). If you hear a "Mmmooo" and the cowbell, you may trade plates with another player. The player with the most cookies on his or her plate when the cookie jar is empty is the winner.

name: Jungle Shooting
description: Early Chad Valley game with six target animals and box that opens up into a shooting gallery. The complete game is includes wire frame spring gun that fires wooden missiles. Nice lithography inside and out.

name: Millionaire
description: In this game players try to spell the word "Millionaire". Each player is dealt 7 letter cards. To start, you begin by laying down the letter "M" and any other letters (in sequence) that you can. If you cannot make a play, you draw a card instead. The other players also add letters to the word (if possible) on their turns. When the word "Millionaire" is spelled out, the player having the fewest cards left in his or her hand scores points equal to all the cards left in the opponent's hands. The first player to score 75 points is the winner. Rules for playing "Card Anagrams" are also included.

name: ArtDeck
description:
[FROM THE RULES]

The game of modern masters: Impressionism to Surrealism.

ARTDECK is a game that offers art lovers and game players aesthetic pleasure and an exciting way to learn about modern art. Play the game as directed, play other games of your own, or just enjoy the images on the cards. ARTDECK will enrich your leisure hours.

name: Drhombix
description:
A 3-D strategic games with rhombic dodecahedrons to build a pyramid.
Each piece piece has 6 white sides and six black sides.
The contents are 30 plastic pieces, 2 playing grounds (triangular and square), and instructions.
The main game (Cuckoo) is to place your piece at the top of the pyramid. You can prevent your opponent from reaching that goal through clever piece placement.

Variants include Zebra and Ant rules.

name: The Enchanting Village
description:
This game's subtitle, 'A playful introduction to the people and cultures of Africa' is perhaps overstating things. This game consists of rolling and moving around the board collecting things that are supposed to tell us about Africa (coconuts, tree, necklace, fish, mask, drum, hut...). Each player has a board with pictures of 9 of the 16 objects to be collected and rolls the die to move around the board and fill up her or his board. The only further 'complication' is that there are some arrow squares on the board, some pointing clockwise, some anticlockwise. It would appear that landing on these squares can change the direction the player is going in. Landing on any other square gets one of the objects, if its one the player needs.

This is intended as a child's first game. My copy is missing the rulebook, but it isn't hard to surmise the basic rules.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: August der Augenfalter
description: August the Butterfly is a symmetry learning game for young children Ages 4 and up

name: Mouseketeer Game
description: This game, based on the Mickey Mouse Club, uses a 3-D cardboard Mouseketeer Club House as a game board. Each player uses a peg to climb up one side of the house. On your turn, you spin the spinner and "climb" the number of spaces indicated. When you reach the Mickey Mouse space at the top, you spin again. If you spin one of the numbers shown under Mickey, you take a scoring disc off the roof of the clubhouse and return your peg to the starting position where you'll start your next turn. After the last disc has been removed from the roof the game ends. The player whose discs add up to the highest score wins.

name: Mr. Potato Head Find Me
description: This game features an electronic talking Mr. Potato Head that gives the players clues. Fifteen cards showing Mr. Potato Head in various outfits are placed face-up on the table. Each card has a unique combination of 3 special items that no other card contains. On your turn, you press a Special Part button (such as mustache or glasses) and Mr. Potato Head will tell you if the picture he's thinking of contains that item. If it doesn't, you turn all the pictures that have that item face down. If it does, you turn all the pictures that don't have that item face down. If you select a correct item, you may also guess at the picture by pressing 3 Special Part buttons for the unique parts that are in the one you think is correct. If you guess right, you win.

name: Space Pirate Captain Harlock
description: This is a Japanese tactical board game set in the anime world of Captain Harlock and Galaxy Express 999.

name: Passing Time
description:
This is an educational item, with ten different games included:

1. The Lotto Game
2. The Chronology Game
3. Self-Correction Game
4. A Game of Association
5. A Game of Patience
6. The Memory Game
7. the Series Game
8. Invention Game
9. The Clock Game
10. The Dominoes Time Game

In addition to the rules, it includes a book, 24 cards, and a cardboard clock which are used in the various games. The cards are half black, half white and have a picture of a clock in one half and a different time written in numerals on the other half. Haven't tried the games with my little one, but the components are quite nice.

name: Positive Negative
description:
From the box:
"60 cards with colored shapes on a see through background. Different parts of each card are colored in such a way that when the right cards are held together they make a solid image that cannot be seen through. Sometimes two cards are needed, sometimes 3, 4 or 5. The game is especially suited to help develop the faculties of concentration, observation and combination. Adults will find fascinating entertainment as the game provides ample scope for tactics."

For 3 to 6 players, also possible for 1 player.

name: 18IB
description: 18IB is 18xx set on the Iberian peninsula. Two sets of rules are available: a basic version which is simpler than 1830: Railways & Robber Barons and an expanded version which is more historical and includes different gauges.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Stock Holding, Tile Placement

name: Bulls, Bears N' Bellies: Commodity Futures Trading Game
description:
This is a bookshelf-style game of commodity futures trading.

The authors describe it thusly: "The game is devised to be fun, educational, and fast paced. It is developed in such a way that the uninitiated trader who knows nothing about the factors that affect prices of commodity futures contracts can learn, in a very basic way, about these factors by studying the information and the accompanying price changes on the cards."

name: There Oughta Be a Law
description:
In There Oughta Be A Law, each player is a Senator in a committee, trying to make the most money by voting for bills various special interest groups support.

There are two types of cards: bills and events. Bills can be played as amendments to an existing bill. Events modify interest groups positions on bills or alter a players options for play. Each bill lists the interest groups' positions on bills. Players can add hidden amendments to prevent other players from gaining interest group support.

The player with the most money received from interest groups at the end of the game wins.

Published by Sacred Cow Games, 2000.

name: Sculptionary
description: Pictionary with clay. One team member sculpts with clay, the other team members guess what it is, with a one minute time limit. Successes allow a die roll and another turn, failure passes control to the next team. The categories are "Easy", "Medium", "Hard", and "All Sculpt".

name: Breath of Faith
description: DTP forerunner of Operation Badr that West End published in 1984, remains the best Golan war game.

name: The Plains of Khuzestan: The Iran-Iraq War
description: A tactical game on the early part of the Iran-Iraq war. There are two scenarios: the initial Iraqi attack and the Iranian counterattack (which lasts just three turns).

name: Locust: Soviet Invasion of Iran
description:
This is a wargame on a hypothetical invasion of Iran by the Soviet Union in the 80s.

Contents included three 10"x16" maps and approximately 250 counters.

name: Strike For the Suez
description: A Perry Moore alternate reality DTP wargame on a hypothetical German invasion of Syria from Turkey during World War 2.

name: The Berenstain Bears: Join the Team
description:
This game contains 48 cards (12 4-card sets) with pictures of the Berenstain Bears playing various sports like baseball, ice skating and golf. Three games may be played...

The Winning Team: Four cards are dealt to each player and face-up on the table. On your turn, if you can match a card from your hand to a card on the table, you take both cards and place them face-up in a pile in front of you. If you can match a card to the top card on an opponent's pile, you may take the player's entire pile of cards. When no more plays can be made, the player with the most cards wins.

Sport Snap: The deck is dealt out evenly among the players. All players simultaneously turn over their top card. If no cards match, turn over another card. If two or more cards match, the first player to call out a correct matching sport wins all stacks with that card on top. If you make a wrong call, you must give 1 card to each opponent. The player that wins all the cards wins the game.

Spoons: Spoons are placed in the center of the table (one less than the number of players). Each player gets 4 cards. The dealer draws a card and either keeps it or passes it to the next player who also can either keep it or pass it etc. As soon as you have a complete set of 4 cards, take a spoon. All players then grab for the remaining spoons. The player who doesn't get one receives a letter - first an "S", followed by a "P", "O", "O", and finally an "N". When one player has spelled out SPOON the game ends and the player with the least number of letters wins.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Novel-based

name: Energie 21
description:
The goal of Energie 21 - Mit Energie in die Zukunft (Energy 21 - With Energy into the Future) is to produce as much energy as possible from renewable resources. Each player starts with a county that produces energy from coal, oil and nuclear plants including complete with factories, office buildings, residential areas and stores. All of these consume energy that has to be supplied. In the game it is not only important to plan and build carefully, but also work together with other players to realize large projects more effective through cooperation. Players can trade and haggle with power plants, victory points or leftover energy, but beware of the environmental assessment.
The game was designed for a German government agency to raise awareness of renewable energy planning on a communal level.

name: G.I. Joe Marine Paratroop Game
description: Players attempt to make six jumps in order to gather the most Combat Jump Cards. While the game uses a spinner instead of a die, the mechanism is purely "roll-and-move".

name: Ali Baba and the Forty Thieves
description: Players compete at completing the adventures of Ali Baba. Players must collect a Prize from each of the Adventure areas. Each prize symbolizes one of Ali Baba's adventures in the actual tale. The first player to land by exact count on the Finish space with all four Prizes is the winner and is awarded the "Wedding of Ali Baba and Morgianna" token.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Leave It To Beaver Money Maker Game
description: Race across the board trying to earn money along the way. Players earn money by drawing cards that can give them a profit or a loss, as well as landing on fixed value spaces. The player to reach the "home" space with the most money wins.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Girls' Nite Out: The Party Game for Women
description:
From the manufacturer:

Girls Night Out: The Party Game for Women is perfect for when the gals get together. This Sassi Games product is a hilarious game of conversation that gets all of those long-forgotten stories out. The game includes appetizer recipes, 10 funky cocktail recipes (for a charades game), scenario cards that prompt you to tell a story, score sheets, and hot pink pencils!!

name: Jack Sprat
description: National Games Inc #5014. Children's Nursery Rhyme game from the 1950's. Players take turns rolling the dice then moving their pawn on the illustrated playing board following the instructions on the spaces that contain a rhyme.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Climb the Needle
description: Climb the Needle is "the space age game of the Seattle World's Fair 1962". The gameboard is a graphic of the Seattle Space Needle. Gameplay involves rolling 2 d6, moving the player pawn the lower of the two die rolls. Rolling doubles allows the player to make an additional roll and landing on another player's space requires the player occupying the space to move back 5 spaces.

name: Cryptic Mandala
description: This game was created to encourage players to find their own hidden spiritual self and to illuminate our understanding of ourselves in relationship to others and to the universe. The first section of the game involves questions of a Physical, Mental, and Spiritual nature. Further play reveals Insight questions, which elicit unexpected answers, and ultimately challenge each player to overcome self-deception and gain true insight. In answering the questions, players discover personal revelations which facilitate positive change and give rise to new visions for the future.

name: Sesame Street Picture Hunt
description: In this children's matching game players race to match all the cards of their color to items on their boards. Each player receives 2 boards depicting a Sesame Street scene with lots of characters and items. The item cards are mixed and placed face down within easy reach of both players. At the count of 3, each player simultaneously turns over a card. If the card's color is the same as the player's boards the player looks for the location of the item, shouts "I found it!" once discovered, and places it in a card space on the board's top. Players return cards that belong to an opponent. The first player to fill all eight card spaces on both of his or her game boards wins.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Poor Jenny
description:
A simple game, a little like Snakes and Ladders. Not politically correct now. You race your coloured (and named!) donkey up the game board from 1 to 100. The board portrays a donkey being chased by a stereo-typed Black Maid.

No skill whatever required, progress is purely random. Slightly notable for the dice; there are four, each of which has the name of 2 of the donkeys twice and two of them once, so each donkey name occurs 6 times over the four dice.

name: Pillage
description:
Pillage! A game where you must pillage jewels from neighboring castles and make it back to your own before the other knights do. You can be sent back to your castle without any jewels if you get caught or jousted with and lose.
There are many paths you can take but some could be blocked. The cool thing is that you have 2 knights to control so if one is at a road block or staying back to defend your castle, the other knight can continue the pillaging.
There are 2 dice involved: A specialty one and a regular 6 sided. The closer to 4 players you have, the more interesting it gets with so many knight wandering around.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Adventure, Dice, Fantasy, Medieval
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Triton II
description:
Set in an imaginary galaxy, the game pits the Triton Empire against the Megan Confederation. The basis for the conflict revolves around the shortage of a mineral called "galactium" used to power the propulsion systems of starships and vehicles. The Triton empire has invaded the mining planet Abarathascan (renamed Triton II after the invasion by the Tritons) to gain control of the galactium supply. The Megan Confederation will have none of that and hence the invasion of Triton.

The game is played on 3 separate 8-1/2" x 11" hex maps depicting the main mining centers of Triton II. Basic wargame mechanics such as Zones of control, Combat results tables, Terrain Effects Tables, describe the basic gameplay. Both sides use transport ships to move ground units between maps. Production points are alloted at the beginning of gameplay, used by each side to purchase their forces. All space craft movement over the planet surface is conducted in a simultaneous plot mechanism. Bases on the planet surface can be used to repair damaged craft or vehicles. Victory conditions are determined by the scenario and involve accumulating victory points obtained by occupying the planets resource centers.

name: Empire
description:
Buy, sell and trade famous companies as you try to cash in on good advertising or favorable publicity by avoiding pitfalls like anti-trust, recession or taxes. Empire allows constant bargaining with other players and decision making that will have you second guessing yourself most of the time.

The final object of the game is to have the most money when the tax revolt occurs at the end of the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding

name: Neighborhood Hike
description:
Objective: To collect five neighborhood place cards depicting places shown on a neighborhood map.

How to play: Each player selects a neighborhood map card and holds it in his or her hand. The remaining map cards are set aside.

The dealer shuffles the neighborhood place cards and deals five cards face-down to each player. The remaining cards in the deck are placed face-down in a pile. The dealer draws the top card and lays it face-up to begin the discard pile.

The first player picks up a card from either the deck or the discard pile. If the card matches an item on his or her neighborhood map card, the player keeps the card and discards an unwanted card. If the card does not match, the player places it face-up on the discard pile.

Players take turns picking up and discarding cards. When all cards have been drawn from the deck, the discard pile is reshuffled to start a new pile.

The first player to collect five of the places displayed on his or her neighborhood map card wins the game!
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Cosmic Critters:  Consonant Blends
description:
A phonics game! Consonant blends. Help the critters make a word!

"It's a game of making words. Just match the critters to their ships! Play alone or with up to 4 players. Includes 4 game boards, 40 playing cards, and simple directions.

It's easy! It's fun! It builds important phonic skills.

name: Mapping the Town
description: "Mapping the Town is a simple, fun game that introduces the concept of map reading. Understanding the relationships of numbers and letters, logical thinking and attention to detail are skills players will develop during play. One side of the board can be played as a simple lotto game of matching picture cards to identical but smaller pictures on the board. The flip side of the board is also a lotto game that requires matching the grid coordinate on the card to the grid references on the board."
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: The Time-Life Library of Curious & Unusual Facts
description:
From the Rules page and Category Card:

OBJECT OF THE GAME:

To be the first player to collect all five game tokens (one from each of the four categories plus a "Wild Card") by correctly answering the Time-Life Curious & Unusual Facts trivia questions.

CATEGORY DESCRIPTIONS:


Feats and Wisdom of the Ancients
Mysteries of the Human Body
Forces of Nature
Vanishings


GAME COMPONENTS:

Game board, two dice, 169 trivia question cards with tray (x 4 Categories = 676 Questions in Total), six plastic playing pawns, 30 game tokens (six of each design), one category description card.

name: Spinette
description: This early Milton Bradley game used a top which you spin in order to try and score points into different holes on the playing board.

name: A Question of Pop
description:
A Question of Pop is the board game of the highly successful UK BBC television series hosted by Jamie Theakston.

Promises to keep your family and friends entertained for hours as they remember everything from the music they listened to many years ago through to more modern music featuring rounds such as A Side/B Side and Name the Year.

The mechanics include dice based movement and time limited question answering using an egg timer.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music, Trivia

name: Le Dé En Folie
description:
Capturing game in which the goal is to be the last player with pieces remaining. Pieces move orthogonally only, changing direction after each step. Capture is by replacement.

Contents:
- 1 board
- 12 pieces
- 1 die

name: Big Breakfast Vital Statistics
description:
"Big Breakfast Vital Statistics" is a card based trivia game with a difference. It is based on the "Stats and Facts" feature of UK Channel 4's Big Breakfast TV show presented by Johnny Vaughan and Denise Van Outen

The game has very obscure trivia questions such as "that only 28 per cent of pet stick insects are call Sticky but 42 per cent are called George" or that "40 blind people are registered to drive cars in Palermo."

The aim is not to get the answers right, but to be closest to the correct answer.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Game of Catch
description:
The Game of Catch which was produced in Toronto, Ontario, Canada in th 1970s by the Arrco Playing Card Company.

Included in the flap-top box are instructions and information for parents in both English and French. The box is 9.2cm long x 6.cm wide x 1.5cm thick

Card backs contain drawings of sea creatures. The front of each of the 32 cards in the deck (8.9cm long x 5.8cm wide) contain drawings of fish, walrus, lobsters, crabs, whales, etc.. The name of each sea creature is printed on the bottom of each card. Colored dots related to the play of the game are in the corners of cards.

This game is currently part of the collection of the Games Museum at the University of Waterloo, in Waterloo Canada.

name: Sir Hinkle Funny-Duster, the Comical Game
description:
The game is played with a deck of 20 cards divided into four FAMILIES; The Funnyduster Family, The Butler's Family, The Huntsman's Family, and the Gardener's Family. With 5 cards to each family, there are cards for the father, wife, son, daughter and the family symbol.

Cards are shuffled and dealt evenly to all players. Each player in turn freely asks any player for a specific card, if that player has the card asked for, the player must give that card to the person asking. Play continues for the asking player until the person asked does not have the card asked for and the turn goes to the next player.

Once a set of Family cards is collected it is laid on the table and retired from play (scoring no points for the player). The object is to be the player that lays down the last Family set

A twist in the mechanics of the game adds fun to the gameplay. Anytime a card is given to a player, the receiver must say "Thank You", if the receiver fails to do so, the first person to say "Duster" receives all of the cards from the person that neglected to say "Thank You". The person receiving the cards must in turn say "Thank You" or is subject to the same "Duster" rule.

The person that did not say "Thank You" and lost all of their cards can not be spoken to. They do not get any additional cards, but if someone speaks to this person, then the first person (any player) to say "Duster" receives the cards of the person that spoke to the person with no cards (and again, "Thank You" must follow receipt of the cards or the "Duster" rule applies again)

name: Sign It!
description:
From the game website:

Sign It! the board game is an interactive new way of learning and practicing American Sign Language (ASL). It is designed to be fun and educational.

Sign It! was born out of necessity. The creator is a 50 year old cabinet maker with a progressive hearing loss. While taking ASL classes, he searched in vain for a teaching tool to help him and his wife practice ASL and increase their vocabularies, and subsequently developed Sign It! to fill this need.

The Sign it! board game which includes a board a rule booklet and markers for six players, provides instruction for learning 824 signs. The game also comes with a copy of "Signing Illustrated" :The complete learning Guide, a 258 page illustrated and indexed reference book.

Sign It! contains a set of cards (which cover more than eight categories), a rule booklet, one die and markers for six players.

The game is setup reminiscent of Trivial Pursuit, with color coded squares.Each person gets a token (I was the elephant) then rolls the die. As expected,what ever the number you rolled...that's the number of spaces you moved. The color of the square is the color you look at on the card. Then you sign that word.

Colors are categories such as feelings, communication, locations, and more.On the card next to the words are page numbers for the accompanying book where you can find the appropriate sign. The game can be purchased with the reference book, "Signing Illustrated" by Mickey Flodin, which includes well drawn illustration, clear directions and even little reminder hints to help you remember new signs.

name: Always Play Fair!
description:
From the publisher's website:

Pick your favorite Packy PlayFair game piece, spin the wheel and see what the cards have in store! Each card teaches a valuable lesson in sportsmanship and fair play. Read the game card and if Packy does the right thing you move ahead - a slip up will send you back! If you spin and land on a space that matches your Packy game piece you spin again! But be alert as you move around the board - there are twists and turns that will either help you toward the finish line or hold you back! You pick the best course to follow.

Be the first person to move around and collect all the letters of PLAY FAIR and win the game!

Winner of the Creative Child Magazine Seal of Excellence 2004

name: Birthday Gamesake
description:
Birthday Gamesake™ is a way to annually celebrate a child’s birthday or to honor a milestone birthday — 13th to 95th. Add cards annually to a child’s Gamesake™ and it becomes a dairy of their life.

It’s easy and fun to create! Before or during the birthday celebration, family and friends record their favorite memories of the birthday honoree on the enclosed gift cards. The board can also be personalized for the birthday honoree by labeling destinations and creating new ones.

It’s unique to play! Birthday Gamesake™ follows the life of the birthday honoree from birth (bassinet) to the cake. The personally created gift cards (recorded by friends and family) move the players through the board. The first player to reach the cake wins!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Christmas Gamesake
description:
Paraphrased from publisher's website:

Christmas Gamesake™ is designed to be played every holiday and before long you’ll have a diary of your family’s greatest memories!

It’s easy and to create! During the holiday season, create the Gamesake™ by filling out favorite memories from the year (or years past) on the enclosed gift cards. If you have young children, record oral stories and document special family achievements. Personalize your board by labeling important locations in your family’s life.

It’s unique to play! Follow Santa’s journey around your world and the first player to land exactly on the North Pole wins. Laugh at the memories on the personally created gift cards as players move along the board path.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Memory, Party Game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Memory, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Squadron Commander 3600
description:
From the game's site:
SCALE: Tactical. Time and distance scales unstated. Each model represents an individual spacecraft.
PERIOD: "3600 A.D., a time when fragmented human empires first come into contact with an alien menace (the Vallarri)."

"This game is a space fighter boardgame for which custom miniatures are available. Players can design their own fighters or use pre-designed plans. Weapons include lasers, cannons and missiles; defenses are armor and shields. Fighters move in an order determined by their tactics and the pilot's skill level, and firing can take place during movement. Damage results in critical hits, which limit or eliminate ship systems or wear the starcraft down until structure failure occurs. Rules allow players to form squadrons, then fight a series of individual battles or a linked campaign. Background material (optional) details six human empires and one alien power."

The Game's Components consists of the following:
'56'-page rulebook (includes record forms)
'4'-(four) 11" x 17" mapsheets (black with hexgrid)
'2'-(two) countersheets (counters must be cut out)
The game includes a rule book with rules for both Basic and Standard games. Two full-color countersheets are included along with a hex-map so that you can start playing immediately. Dice are not included. Three 6-sided dice and one 10-sided die are required for the Basic game, while the Standard game requires one 4-sided die, three 6-sided dice, one 8-sided die, one 10-sided die and one 12-sided die.
The rulebook contains 21 pre-designed fighters, each associated with one or more of the political entities of the 37th century. Although an official set of miniatures is available, these rules are suitable for use with any space fighter models of appropriate size.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Role Playing

name: Movie Mystery: Raiders of the Tomb of Death
description:
Components:

Screenplay Award Statue, 10 sided 'Decider', Directors Audio CD, 10 Cue Cards, 10 Contracts / Invitations, 1 Hosts' Party Planner, 10 Character Profile Cards, 10 Identity Badges, 10 Screenplay Nominations Cards, 10 Envelopes, 10 Pencils, Instructions

Publisher's Description:

"It’s 1924. A train is traveling through Egypt towards the ancient city of Khartoum. Among the passengers are a bunch of adventurers who, though strangers, find themselves in the same hot and cramped compartment of the dusty train. A conversation is struck and an uneasy association is made as they realize they’re all heading for the same place -the ancient site of THE TOMB OF RAMITIN. Perhaps they all have the same secret aim -to bring back the famed diamond which, according to legend, is hidden in the vault. BUT several mysterious deaths have occurred at the site and the place is now known as the..THE TOMB OF DEATH!

The players are the Adventurers. They will act out SEVEN SCENES, working from instructions given by the DIRECTOR (on the audio CD). They arrive on set 'in character', each with their own secret identity (sealed instructions sent out by the host(s) with the invitations). The evening culminates in THE SCREEN PLAY AWARD CEREMONY a magnificent affair where players are judged in three categories; On their abilities to ACT, to IDENTIFY CHARACTER TRAITS IN OTHERS and to DISCOVER THE SECRET.

The winner will keep the prestigious SCREEN PLAY AWARD STATUE."

Brief Notes:

This is one of a series of "Movie Mystery" games, which work well at parties with people who enjoy mysteries and a little bit of play-acting. Role-playing gamers can easily take to this as well.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Adventure, Exploration, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Murder/Mystery, Party Game, Travel

name: Movie Mystery: The Sinking of the S.S Titania
description:
Components:

Contents: Screenplay Award Statue, 10 sided 'Decider', Directors Audio CD, 10 Cue Cards, 10 Contracts / Invitations, 1 Hosts' Party Planner, 10 Character Profile Cards, 10 Identity Badges, 10 Screenplay Nominations Cards, 10 Envelopes, 10 Pencils, Instructions

Publisher's Description:

"It’s 1912, the new age of travel. You are young(ish), attractive, fashionable and are captivated by the idea of travel to far off places, with the opportunities for adventure, romance and love. You have a ticket for the maiden voyage of the S.S. Titania sailing from Southampton to New York. Once on board you find yourself in the company of people like yourself with similar expectations. At the Captains’ table, in the casino and in the luxurious bars and lounges, the adventure and romance unfolds as you interact with your new found friends -though one of them is not all he (or she) seems. Then tragedy strikes, all hell breaks loose and all must face the awful reality of what they said could never happen...
THE SINKING OF THE S.S. TITANIA

The players are the passengers. They will act out SEVEN SCENES, working from instructions given by the DIRECTOR (on the audio CD). They arrive on set 'in character', each with their own secret identity (sealed instructions sent out by the host(s) with the invitations). The evening culminates in THE SCREEN PLAY AWARD CEREMONY a magnificent affair where players are judged in three categories; On their abilities to ACT, to IDENTIFY CHARACTER TRAITS IN OTHERS and to DISCOVER THE SECRET.

The winner will keep the prestigious SCREEN PLAY AWARD STATUE."

Brief Notes:

This is one of a series of "Movie Mystery" games, that can be a great party game among people who like mysteries and a little play-acting. Role-playing gamers can easily enjoy this as well.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Adventure, Deduction, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Murder/Mystery, Party Game

name: Movie Mystery: The Blood of Dracenstein's Castle
description:
Components:

Screenplay Award Statue, 10 sided 'Decider', Directors Audio CD, 10 Cue Cards, 10 Contracts / Invitations, 1 Hosts' Party Planner, 10 Character Profile Cards, 10 Identity Badges, 10 Screenplay Nominations Cards, 10 Envelopes, 10 Pencils, Instructions

Publisher's Description:

"It’s the year 1858. In a small, isolated village inside a forest in deepest, darkest Transylvania stands a small medieval tavern where our story begins. It’s through an encounter here that you and other like-minded travelers of fortune manage to get jobs at the castle on the hill belonging to Count Dracenstein. But soon, things start to get a little strange and you and your fellow workers are exposed to a host of horrifying situations. You realize, perhaps too late, the true intentions of the Count and soon discover the real secret of..THE BLOOD OF DRACENSTEINS’ CASTLE

The players are the Workers. They will act out SEVEN SCENES, working from instructions given by the DIRECTOR (on the audio CD). They arrive on set 'in character', each with their own secret identity (sealed instructions sent out by the host(s) with the invitations). The evening culminates in THE SCREEN PLAY AWARD CEREMONY a magnificent affair where players are judged in three categories; On their abilities to ACT, to IDENTIFY CHARACTER TRAITS IN OTHERS and to DISCOVER THE SECRET.

The winner will keep the prestigious SCREEN PLAY AWARD STATUE. "

Brief Notes:

This is one of a series of "Movie Mystery" games, which work well at parties with people who enjoy mysteries and a little bit of play-acting. Role-playing gamers can easily take to this as well.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Adventure, Deduction, Horror, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Murder/Mystery, Party Game

name: Engineer
description: Players use a spinner to determine the movement of their engine in attempting to navigate across the rail yard and hook up with their set of cars.

name: Leetown and Elkhorn Tavern
description:
A detailed microgame covering the American Civil War battles of Leetown and Elkhorn Tavern.

The link below points to the Countermoves Microgame Design site. The game was an entry in the Microgame Design Contest 2002.
categories: American Civil War, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Hidden Movement, Line of Sight, Movement Points, Paper-and-Pencil, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Strange Behavior
description:
Strange Behavior / Ages 10 and up

There are 2 to 4 teams with 2 people on each team. They take a piece and 3 color-matching tokens. Each team starts off in a different corner. There are a few path ways: one that goes all the way around the board and 2 pathways that intersect the board in the middle. There are 3 stacks of cards: description, noun, and action. Each card has 2 different words to choose from.

One players draws a card from each stack, picks 1 word from each card and then has to act the 3 word phrase out without using words, just noises and movements (ie. crazy monkey swimming...) For each correct word guessed in 30 seconds, you get to move your piece toward another corner in order to collect a token from the corner.

If another player "runs into you" they send you back to the last corner you achieved a token from. The first team to get a token from each corner and make it back to their home wins.

name: Finanzmanager
description:
From the designer's webpage:

"Multiply your savings with intelligent applications.
Try some of the many applications like construction, actions, banks and founds to make money with money.
But take care: the economy development are not so simple. Politics, war and economical factors make the choices really hard.
Who make 1.000.000,00 first wins the game."

name: Sharbriggan
description: Chess-like strategy game played on a 9x9 grid in which dice determine which pieces can be moved on each turn.

name: Count N Slide
description: The object of the game is to be the first player to complete all three slides. A player may do this either by climbing to the top of a ladder and sliding down to the next ladder or by landing exactly on one of the short cut spaces and sliding down to the next ladder.

name: Coloroulette
description:
Coloroulette is described as a "competitive colour matching game for all the family, based upon famous works of art".
Each player is given an art card, each of which shows a colour representation of a famous painting. These range from Old Masters to Modern Art. There are 84 "colourstrokes", which are small rectangles of card, each showing a daub of a particular colour. Each player receives seven coloustrokes at random and the object of the game is to collect or swap colourstrokes in order to obtain the set of seven colourstrokes which are the principal colours apparent in that player's art card. This is harder than it might seem - there are, for example, quite a few very similar shades of white.
This game is principally designed to test a player's ability to match colours, but there is some luck introduced in the use of a spinner which can alternatively enable a player to win or lose colourstrokes.

name: Travel  with Woody Woodpecker
description: Spin and move childrens game which has the unusual feature of having the board have a circular rotating area which causes the track of the game to change during the game. The object is to fly around the world landing in 5 different countries to win.

name: One-on-One Hoops
description:
Uses cards and dice to simulate a game of basketball.

A game that simulates the real game of basketball. From the tip-off to the final shot. Roll the dice to put up a shot. Cards are played to affect the odds of hitting the shot. You are the coach, and you control the cards and strategy for your team. You are also the players. Slam dunk, pull down offensive rebounds, steal the ball. Block shots, grab loose balls, hit clutch threes. How you play your cards and if you can hit your shots makes each game different.

name: Windsurfin game
description: This is a Japanese Windsurfing Game from Ad Technos as part of their sports and leisure section.

name: Animal Trap
description: Simple spin and move game featuring 12 realistic looking animals, 2 natives, 1 hunter, 2 rifles a spinner, a board & insert (cages) for animals.

name: S.A.B.O.T.
description:
S.A.B.O.T. stands for Simple Armored Battle in Oversized Terrain. It's a fast-moving futuristic land battle, meant to be played on a big game map. Each player spends his/her build points on various vehicles and soldiers, sets them up on map tiles from my M8 Map System, and fights until his/her foe has been wiped off the face of the earth.

This game's movement and combat rules are set up for large-scale battlefields with dozens of vehicles and soldiers. Ever want to fill a ping-pong table with game maps? This is your game. Got a door-sized folding table for game day? Play with a wide front and a shallow battlefield. Better yet, make a big square table from two folding tables. You can play this game on a small map, but it won't be as much fun.

S.A.B.O.T. is a complete game, with counters, markers, and maps. All you supply is a couple of d10's
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Sark
description:
Components:

54 Letter Cards
A pad of Sark Squares (blank 5×5 grids)

Description:

A referee (or the players themselves) pulls letter cards one at a time from a randomized deck. As each letter is pulled, players must place the letter on their own "Sark square" or 5×5 grid (hidden from other players). After all 25 grid squares are filled, players score points based on how many 3, 4, or 5 letter words they made reading across or down.

3 letter words score 3 pts., 4 letter words score 5 pts., and 5 letter words score 7 pts.

name: Orbital Battle
description:
Orbital Battle is a wargame set in space. Two rival empires fight for control of the eight planets in a solar system, using land, air, and space units. What sets this game apart from similar wargames is that the planets move in their orbits, changing the game map every turn.

This two-player game comes with counters and map sheets. All you provide is a six-sided die, and pencils and paper for some very simple record-keeping.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board

name: Corporate
description:
Straightforward card game of office politics with a humorous tone. This is a hand-produced game with hand-cut, black-and-white, laminated cards that come in a plastic trading card box adorned with a black-and-white cover label.

From the rules intro:

There was a time on this great planet of ours that wars were fought between nations and/or political factions for ideals, territory, money, or power. Although the goals remain the same, wars are no longer fought by people in uniform. Today's wars are fought by the groups that hold the real power in today's society. Political factions are puppets to these entities, armies and military might are under their control. These entities are referred to by a name that belies the fact that they have more power than any nation on the planet: the Corporation. The foot soldiers who slog forward daily to do battle on myriad fronts are no longer called privates, cadets or seamen.
