Move your miniature metal instrument along a path of piano keys to the note specified by a card. If correct, collect "sharp" or "flat" cards. Win by completing a set of each.

name: Blackout Tic Tac Toe
description:
Nine tiles with X's and O's on the faces are placed in a square. A player flips them to his sign in accordance with numbers or jokers, turned from a deck. Continue until a number already flipped shows. Score for three in a row. Flipping all squares to the same symbol scores big.

Essentially copied from Sid Sackson's "Gamut of Games", 2nd edition, page 218 (Dover version). Not quite enough detail to recreate the game.

name: Pyramids & Polar Bears
description:
According to Sid Sackson's "A Gamut of Games":

Similar to Blackout Tic Tac Toe, except that there are sixteen triangular tiles with the titled objects on their faces. Score for various geometric shapes. In advanced version, tiles can be moved from their starting position.

name: Ramblin Rhomboids
description:
According to Sid Sackson's "A Gamut of Games":

Similar to Blackout Tic Tac Toe, except that there are sixteen rhombus-shaped tiles with different colors on their faces. Score for various geometric shapes. In advanced version, tiles can be moved from their starting position.

name: Throb!
description:
According to Sid Sackson's "A Gamut of Games":

"Thrills" take the place of dollars as the currency. Mainly they are used to buy pieces of a broken heart. Confrontations occur, where thrills are won by the proper matching of passion, anger, caution, and guilt cards.

name: City Go: America!
description: This family game allows kids and adults to discover the major cities of the United States. The centerpiece is a fantasy map of America, filled with over 100 unique illustrations of landmarks, buildings, museums, bridges, performing arts venues and icons of America’s great states and cities, all jumbled up. The goal is to travel through this land to rescue ABC Sam, the lost City GO dog, by putting the pieces of the fantasy country back together on the Accurate Map. Along the way players are challenged to sing songs, dance, illustrate, challenge their friends and pick their brains.
mechanics: Acting, Roll / Spin and Move, Singing

name: Crossword Domino
description:
From the instructions:

This interesting new game besides combining dominoes with crossword puzzles adds a joker feature.

Besides being entertaining this fascinating new game will improve your vocabulary and spelling.

'Crossword Domino like dominoes requires the players to take a group of units thrown together by chance and transform them into order and context. Crossword Domino requires that we link together letters and words as is done in a crossword puzzle.

This game allows the players many possibilities of devising problems to be solved and making rules to suit the particular group of players.

name: Monster Maker Wars Gaiden
description:
More complete title:
"Monster Maker Wars Gaiden: The Double-Headed Lion".

Boardgame included with RPG Gamer #6. Originally in Japanese, but an English translation is available.

Plays very similarly to Lord of the Rings: the Confrontation (which plays like Stratego with cards and abilities).

The Royalist player attempts to get Vishnus, the successor to the throne, to Lion's Head Castle. The Republic player attempts to stop this.

Characters are kept concealed from your opponent, and when two are on the same space, combat ensues. You play a card, whose value is added to your character's combat value, and the highest total wins (and the opponent is removed). Lots of characters have special abilities as well.

name: Ian Botham's Sporting Challenge
description:
IAN BOTHAM'S SPORTING CHALLENGE is a sports trivia game carrying the name of a former England Cricketer.

Play is conducted on a hexagonal board with each side representing the home venue of each of the players. The venues represent six different UK sporting venues (Wembley, Lord's, Wimbeldon, Silverstone, St. Andrews and Newmarket) though the venues themselves have no direct significance to the game.

Starting at their home venue players roll the dice and move the appropriate number of spaces in the clockwise direction marked on the board.

On each colored space landed on a question is answered corresponding to the color of that space:
Purple = Grounds and Venues (GV)
Red = Clubs, Competitions and trophies (CCT)
Yellow = Personalities (P)
Blue = Records, Facts and Feats (RFF)
Mauve = Mixed Bag (MB)

A correctly answered question allows the player to throw and move again - if not, the turn ends and play passes to the next player.

If the coloured space also depicts a trophy then a correctly answered question will earn part of a two part trophy (first time round the trophy itself and then the lid). The various bits of the trophy are placed in that player's home venue on the appropriately coloured square. The aim is to amass one trophy and lid for each of the five categories of questions.

Alternatively a playing piece may land on a space marked with a C meaning it is a Challenge position - there are two types of these:
On a white "C" a player may challenge for one of the "unlidded" trophies in that particular home venue (i.e. a trophy already won by another player). If choosing to challenge for a trophy a player may elect to answer a question himself (in order to "steal" the trophy) or challenge his opponent to do so (in order to retain the trophy).
On a striped "C" a player may challenge for a trophy base on either of the adjacent venues, or elect to answer a question in any category for which a trophy base or lid is required.

The winner is the first player who collects in his/her home venue, five complete trophies.

name: Defend Your Capital
description: DEFEND YOUR CAPITAL is an Investment and Money Management Game produced by designer Joseph Pascal in 1976.

name: Turnio
description:
From the rules:

"Albert's and Boris's job is tiling bathrooms. Albert likes tiles which form circles, Boris instead prefers squares. Whenever they worked together they spent more time arguing than working. One time, two palettes of tiles were destroyed (one forming circles and one with squares), so something had to change. Since that day, Albert and Boris use only tiles which can be used to form circles and squares as well and they play 'Turnio' while they work."

Turnio is a tactical game for two players Ages 10 and up. The chips show on two or four corners quarters of circles or squares. Each player chooses one of these symbols. The players try to place or turn the chips in a way that completes their symbols. Two quarters of the same symbol placed side by side are called a pair. Quarters which touch only at the corner, i.e. which are placed diagonally are by definition not a pair. For each pair completed, the player gains one point. That means a half of a symbol is worth one point, three-quarters two points and a complete symbol gives four points. The player who has collected more points at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Journey Through Switzerland: Télésiège
description: Journey through Switzerland: Télésiège is a Swiss-made game of traveling to ski resorts in Switzerland. Your objective is to see a number of Swiss resorts before anyone else.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Regal 8 Innvesting
description: REGAL 8 INNVESTING REGAL 8 INN/late 1970s-1980s? This is a game of building your own motel chain, produced by Regal 8 Inns.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Central Bank
description: CENTRAL BANK by RIGHT-ON MFG. CO/1974 This game comes in a cloth bag and requires a deck of regular playing cards which is not included in the game. It is a gambling game with several different bets on each hand: the first bet is for the first two cards to be the same color, the second is basically Acey-Deucey, etc.

name: Five Sides
description: Five sides is a throw back to your early days of playing games. When all you had was a pen, some paper, and time to kill during study hall. Players take turns dividing a box with a single line, trying to make five sided shapes. There is also a way to score bonus points. A surprisingly simple game that will have you thinking twice before you draw that next line.

name: Elm Hills Golf
description: Roll the die to make your approach, chip onto the green, and sink your putt. Watch out for the sand trap! Elm Hills Golf includes rules for "low ball" and "low aggregate" team play as well.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: Mercy! The Hospital Game
description: Biting satirical game of escaping 'Agony Memorial Hospital'

name: Guess Who's Gone to Surgery
description: This is a small press hospital board game. The cover states "The hospital board game where you make the rounds".

name: Jahrhundert-Spiel
description:
Jahrhundert-Spiel(translates to "Century-Game") is a simple trivia game about the 20th century.

The game has about 30-35 question cards for each decade of the 20th century, each listing 4 questions. The game master, who doesn't participate in the game, takes a card for each decade and reads out one of the questions. The first player to answer gets a chip for that decade. The first player to answer a question for every decade wins the game. The last two chips a player needs may be replaced with joker chips, which he can earn by answering questions about decades for which he already has a chip. A player may not earn more than 2 joker chips.

name: Oscar: 100 Jahre Hollywood
description:
Oscar - 100 Jahre Hollywood is a simple movie trivia game from the late 80s.

Up to 5 players answer questions from 5 categories (Classics & Celebrities, Western & Crime stories, Oscar winners & Famous scenes, Science Fiction & Fantasy & Horror, Comedy & Animation). Each correct answer allows you to draw a cardboard tile depicting part of the Oscar statuette. You may keep the tile if it is the next one you need, building the statuette from it's base upwards. The first one to complete his Oscar wins.

name: Wild Bill Hickok's the Cavalry and the Indians Game
description:
One person plays the Indians and the other the Cavalry. The gameboard has a fort which houses the 12 cavalry markers while on the opposite side of the board an Indian village houses the 12 Indians. A one-way path winds around the board, with the Indians moving in one direction, while the cavalry move in the opposite, which means they'll come head to head in a short while.

The Indians player leads off, spinning the spinner, which has values of 0 to 10; the player moves his first marker accordingly. The cavalry player follows in suit. On the next Indian spin, the player moves the Indian marker already in play and adds a new one from the village, each moving the distance the spinner indicates. Play continues on with each player soon moving several of his markers on each turn.

Each marker counts for 10 men, and there are several spaces scattered across the board which, when landed upon, indicate you must lose 10 men. Essentially, that marker is removed from the game, not to return. Also, when a player lands on an opponent's marker, he captures that piece and moves into his fort or village. Additionally, a few spaces allow a player to raid his opponent's fort or village and re-capture his captured markers.

Eventually, through such attrition, one player will find he has no markers left out on the trail. At that point, if he is holding some of his opponent's markers captive, he may trade his captives for his own markers, place them in his respective fort or village, and move them into play as normal. If, however, a player has no markers on the trail, and no captives in his fort or village, he loses the game, giving his opponent the victory. Thus, the markers have no end destination and may move round and round the board, victory coming only when the opponent has lost all of his markers.

name: The Ann Arbor Game
description: A high-end trivia board game featuring questions about Ann Arbor and the University of Michigan. The board is a conceptual map of Ann Arbor with over 100 board locations. Move around the board, enter the locations, and answer questions in one of 6 categories. Correct answers earn a colored glass gem. Collect all six colored gems to win.

name: The Battle of the Atoms
description: The Battle of the Atoms is a game about atomic warfare set it the 20th century. TBOTA is a game where the players deploy their units not letting the other player see them and then they try to destroy their enemies base by blowing it up with a Hydrogen Bomb.

name: The Darling Buds of May Game
description:
The DARLING BUDS OF MAY Game is based on the novel by H. E. Bates and the Yorkshire Television TV Series of the same name.

"Pop Larkin has inherited a fortune from a long lost uncle in Africa. The Uncle discovered diamonds in Kimberley around the turn of the (20th) Century. Pop is his only surviving relative.

He leaves Pop Larkin £100,000 in cash which Pop naturally hides all over the farm yard, paddock, woods and fields. The tax office get to hear that there's money about and suspect Pop of a major fiddle!

The hunt for the money begins. The Larkins need to find the money before the Tax Inspector. Mr Charlton needs to find the money to prove his case agaisnt the Larkins and the Brigadier and Edith Pilchester certainly need the money!

The chase is on: Backwards...Forwards, Up and Down, a lovely romp around the Kent countryside where the sun shines and almost everything and everyone is "Perfick"!

The player who can avoid the hazards, answer questions, use a little "savvy" and collect most of the windfalls is the winner."

A simple roll and move trivia game with money being earned for the successful answering of questions. There are four types of questions:-

- 500+ questions on The Darling Buds of May and other novels by H. E. Bates based on the Larkin Family, and about life in the 1950s... these questions carry values from £250 to £1,000.
- 500+ questions on General Knowledge...these questions carry values from £50 to £250.
- 500+ questions on Junior General Knowledge (for younger players)...these questions carry values from £250 to £1,000.
- 130 Red Herring questions which have only True/False answers, but which players must attempt to answer, and which bring good or bad luck dependent on whether the answer is correct or not.

As soon as the first player reaches the finish the game is over and each player counts his money. The player with the most money wins.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Trivia

name: Los Angeles Rams Trivia Game
description: Box full of cards with - you guessed it, LA Rams trivia questions.

name: 19th Hole
description: This is a "shut-the-box" type game with a golf theme in a small box.

name: Malta Storm: The Battle for the Central Mediterranean Sea Dec. 1941 – Aug. 1942
description: Small alt-history wargame on the Axis invasion of Malta. 1 rule pamphlet, 2 small maps.

name: Nine Lives
description: This is a checkers-type variation with all black-and-white graphics. The discs have cats on them.

name: Star Authors
description: Set came in a wood box, about 5-1/4" x 6". Includes a small rules pamphlet, 36 cards with portraits of famous authors and 36 cards with titles of books. The cards are nicely printed in black & white, with sepia tones on the portraits.

name: Fudge
description:
From the manufacturer:

Using three eight-sided dice, players add and/or subtract numbers to produce a total that helps them make a piece of fudge (three in a row). Make two pieces of fudge for a batch to win the game. Children must use their best problem-solving skills in this fun strategy game of addition and subtraction!
categories: Abstract Strategy, Children's Game, Dice, Math

name: Jelly Beans
description:
From the manufacturer:

JELLY BEANS, our introductory game for young children, uses counting, number recognition, and very simple addition and subtraction in a progression of skills. The child and the adult opponent compete to be the first to fill-in all of the holes numbered 1 through 12 on their individual number line. JELLY BEANS introduces children to math in a way that says, "Numbers are Fun!"
categories: Abstract Strategy, Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Math

name: Enviro-Quest
description:
ENVIRO-QUEST is an environment-based trivia board game.

Players progress around a board answering questions or undertaking other actions dependent on where the playing piece lands. Scoring counters are won or lost by successfully or incorrectly answering questions.

"Power" cards are gained by landing on certain squares. These allow a player to move a particular number of spaces(i.e. a power card of value 5 allows you to move 5 spaces) - this is in lieu of actually rolling the dice.

The game is won when a player has collected 20 scoring counters and completed moving around the track to the finish (the Globe).

name: Envir-o-mania
description:
Another low print run indie game, interesting for the pairs of white gloves players were made to wear while playing.

Make it through the perilous toxic wasteland of a landscape and reach the pollution-free "Safe Haven."

Typical roll and move game, complete with trying-to-be-clever cards which dramatically stress the demise of the planet.

name: Abrekodibru
description:
From the designer's website:

Wizards used to gather regularly to create new magic spells. But there was always a moron in the assembly to wreck the collective work. As a punishment he was given a Hairy Toad. The culprit was then really embarrassed cause this creature eats like 4 cows and has strictly no use for a Wizard.

In spite of these light hitches, the gatherings were productive. Were invented there, among other things, this game and the famous spell Abracadabra.

Abrekodibru is a card game inspired from the traditional Cheat Game. Players are wizards trying to make up some new magic spells. The more players involved, the more the games are fun!

This is a game for all ages, but remains strictly reserved to the uninitiated to the magic tricks.

Each card has a magic syllable from the famous one 'Abrakadabra'. Players use the cards to compose new incantations, following an order that must be respected otherwise the magic power of the spell is broken.

Each time a player makes a mistake the incantation is set aside and the clumsy one is given a 'Hairy Toad' token. The goal is to finish the game with as little Toads as possible in your custody.

name: Le Grand Jeu des Schtroumpfs
description:
A different game is printed on each side of the board. The look like easy dice rolling games for kids Ages 5 - 10.

"Schtroumpfs" are what Smurfs are called in France - the game is based on the Smurf comics and/or cartoon shows.
categories: Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Fabullo
description: Fabullo is a game without winners and losers. Your child will tell a story based upon characters met by Carotin the rabbit. The only important point is that the story must be comprehensible.

name: The Hermit Game
description:
The Hermit Game is a boardgame for 2-4 players Ages 8 and up. Players struggle to lose their house,car, and all of their money and become full-fledged hermits. The first hermit to reach the top of hermit mountain wins the game.

The game contains a colored gameboard, complete instructions, 2 standard dice, 1 (1-3) die, 28 markers, and scoreboard. The game is a strategy game for children and adults.

name: Quick-Quiz
description:
The game master reads a question from the card to the player to the left, and if he knows the answer he receives a point. If he doesn't know the correct answer everybody else can answer the question. The quickest one receives one point. Now the next player reads a question to the player to the left, etc. The first player to 25 points wins.

The game is a tie-in for the wissen.de website. It comes in 6 different packs of themed questions.

name: Double Trouble / The Calendar Game
description:
Double Trouble and The Calendar Game were a pair of health education and promotion board games sold together in one box. The games featured the theme of healthy lifestyle habits tacked on to familiar board game formats.

Double Trouble, for four players, had a ludo-like format with each player having only one playing piece, but traveling around the board to try to gain four 'health habit' counters (eat right, exercise regularly, don't smoke, control stress) before racing for home. The twist to the game was that whenever any player rolled doubles, all players made a grab for one of the little bean bags (of which there was always one less than the number of players) on the board. The player who did not manage to grab a bean bag was sent back to his/her start.

The Calendar Game was a conventional 'go-round-the-board' dice-roll-and-move game where players tried to gain 'health points' by picking up 'health cards'. Up to six players could play.

name: Tactician Simulated Sailing
description: Tactician Simulated Sailing is a fairly simple game that tries to simulate a yacht race. There are a couple of scenarios for solitaire play also. Six plastic yachts sail around the course area marked on the board. In the center of the board is placed a spinner that shows how far the yachts may move in a given direction. The trick is that the spinner is magnetized so the wind will only vary 45º from the mean wind direction for the game. A good way to simulate wind direction over the period of a yacht race. The board is dark blue and the course is marked on in darker lines with dots to show where the yachts may move. There are also currents and shallows to be navigated.

name: Quiz Keno
description:
Quiz Keno is an early trivia/knowledge game mixed in with the luck of Keno (lotto). One person, who can can also choose to be a player, takes the part of "Questioner" and reads the questions and keep tracks of cards and answers. The "Questioner" changes at the end of each game.

The players in the game each get an answer card which is set up like a Keno card. Each of these cards have 5 headings (same on all cards): Artists/Authors, Headliners, Military Men, Statesmen, and Famous Women. When a quiz card is drawn and the question asked, a player having the correct answer on his/her card marks the spot with a mini poker chip. The first player to get a straight row of chips (vertical, horizontal, or diagonally) wins the game. The "Questioner" reviews the answers to make sure all answers were correct. Cards can be exchanged between players before a new game begins.

There are 75 Cards with 2 questions (A&B) on each card. The backside of the card contains one answer which is correct for both A&B questions. This yields a total of 150 different questions. The 12 Keno/Answer cards are different from each other.

Simple, straight-forward game mechanics, but the game rules state that modifications to game can be made by player consensus.

name: Woody Woodpecker Game
description:
Woody Woodpecker is giving away nickels to his pals... But they must win them before they can claim them.

The object of the game is to be the first player to move all six nickels from the 'start' end of the board to the opposite or 'finish' end.

Basic 'spin the spinner' & move game.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection
publishers: John Sands Pty Ltd, Milton Bradley

name: Political Roulette
description:
POLITICAL ROULETTE is a roll and move board game about winning a General Election in the UK.

Players represent one of four political parties, with players completing circuits of an outer ring of the board (the Campaign Trail) as directed by the roll of a die, acting in accordance with the squares upon which their playing piece lands.

Players try to establish a majority in the opinion polls of the fifteen areas shown on the map in the central part of the board. To gain a majority players need votes. Votes are obtained or lost in a variety of ways:
- by throwing the die
- votes added by holding the TV Charisma Vote
- a vote subtracted by being in "Bad Press"
- votes added or subtracted by the instructions of some of the Policy Cards.

Once a player controls 8 of the 15 regions he may call a General Election, and if he wins it he wins the game.

name: Election: The Game for President
description:
"This board game simulates the steps usually followed in actively pursuing and achieving a career related to public service and political life. Career development begins at the local level and progresses through key positions in city, county, state, and federal offices on an individual basis. In the Presidential election, opposing teams compete to win the majority of 270 electoral votes to achieve election of President or Vice-President."

Age or grade: Elementary - adult.

Materials: Board, career score wheel, game tokens, opportunity cards, forms.

name: Election U.S.A.
description:
"In a board game based upon the electoral college system, players advance or gain electoral votes by their ability and knowledge to correctly answer questions on the United States Constitution. The object is to win the election by being the first candidate to obtain 270 electoral votes. A spinner is used to determine which of five categories of questions will be answered: general, executive, judicial, legislative."

Age or grade: Junior high school, high school.

Materials: Game board, spinner, player accessories.

name: West Bank Gamer's Game
description:
Greg Schloesser, founder of the Westbank Gamers, has moved to the mountains of Tennessee. Now, all of his friends in the Westbank Gamers are racing to be the first to visit him at his new home. However, before they can visit, they must first race across the United States in search of chips, cookies and sodas. This way, they won't arrive empty-handed!

This game was the brain-child of several members of the Westbank Gamers group. It has mechanics that are similar to Ticket to Ride, but includes an abundance of event cards. Plus, everything is custom-tailored to the Westbank Gamers, its members, and various experiences through the years.

Players must collect various sets of cards in order to complete routes between major U.S. cities. The cards depict the faces of five Westbank Gamers stalwarts: Lenny Leo, John Moore, Jim Fairchild, Michael Aucoin and Jerry Maus. Each time a new city is reached, an event card is drawn. The cards tell the story of infamous occurrences during the Westbank Gamers history, and cause a wide variety of events to occur.

Victory goes to the player who collects the needed cards, manages his hand properly, and survives the chaos of the events.

The production quality is outstanding, thanks to the talents of Jim "Dr. Z" Fairchild.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection

name: Take A Taxi
description:
Take a Taxi is a game of luck and strategy, but mostly luck. Each player "owns" passengers and runs a taxi. The goal is to pick up as many of the other player's passengers as possible, delivering them to their destinations, collecting money and avoiding fines.

All players begin with $150.00 and 4 Passenger Pawns (same color as their taxi). Players distribute their Passenger Pawns on the board, as well as Bank owned Pawns and Police/Highway Patrol Cars.

The object is to pick up as many of the other players’ pawns as possible and deliver them to their destination (as determined by the draw from the card deck). Taxi drivers collect $1/space driven from the owning player of the pawn, but the route must be direct because cheating gets you a $20.00 fine and a trip back to the garage. The Bank pays for Bank Pawns. Whenever a Passenger Pawn is picked up, a Destination Card is drawn, but beware the random Hazard Card!

Police/Highway Patrol Cars are moved by the current player who rolls either a ‘1’ or a ‘6’. The object is to “Bust” one of the other taxis caught in its jurisdiction (spaces marked yellow on the board). When a player has picked all the pawns he can, they head back to the garage to end the game. The person with the most money wins the game. Bank Pawns in possession are worth $5.00 each.

The length of the game is dependent on the amount of players. Placement of the Bank Pawns also adds to the game length, since players can choose to keep a Bank Pawn, or put it into play: more pawns in play equals a longer game.

name: The Abyss
description:
Players control a demon lord to fight for the ruler ship of the Abyss. Each player collects "essence" which can be used to build armies.

The game is sold in digital form and includes 10 Demon Lord cards, and cards and counters for 36 types of monsters.

name: Gumby and Pokey Playful Trails Game
description:
A colorful adventure for 2-4 players Ages 5 - 12 with Gumby and his pal Pokey.

Celebrate Gumby's 50th birthday with this vintage 1968 Board Game that uses two lovable TV favorites as game pieces for up to 4 players. Directions are printed inside the box cover.

Go from the stable to the corral using color coded cards, and make sure you take advantage of the slippery trails to get there faster!

Material:

Cardboard with paper cards and 4 sets of plastic playing pieces

Size:

Game board is 18" x 18" when open, box is 18" x 9"
categories: American West, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Nin-Gonost Campaign Book
description:
An expansion to Nin-Gonost provides new options, new rules, background and fiction as well as the new Campaigns. The many scenarios in the Campaigns are linked in such a way that player actions in one scenario may affect conditions in a later scenario, adding a new strategic level of play.

Expands:

Nin-Gonost
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Maze, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Multiple Mutations
description:
The Mutiple Mutations Game is a board game where players enter the game as MEN markers and try to grow powerful mutations by landing on like-colored radioactive spaces. The game is for ages 8 to adult and is for 2 players. It is very strategic to play. Players' creatures can attack each other with roll-offs, some creatures have the advantage.

Try to be the player who scores the most mutation points by getting your mutation safely into your-colored pit and also kill off the enemy mutations to win.

Contains: Color gameboard, 20 game pieces, 2 dice, 1 starter scoreboard, complete rules
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Alpha Gamma 5
description:
Alpha Gamma 5 is a boardgame for 2 players Ages 8 and up. Both players command armies of ships and make "moves" to deploy the ships to attack the other player's ships. The player with the sole surviving ships in both galaxies, wins the game. Ships are powered with shield power, electra-volt (universal power) and phaser power which is used in the game. Also special weapons are also used such as extended firing range, photon torpedoes and nuclear bombs.

Contains: Color gameboard, 16 game pieces, 2 dice, scoreboard, and complete rules
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Monsters
description:
The Monsters Game is a boardgame for 2-4 players Ages 8 and up. Be the first mad doctor to create a Frankenstein Monster in his lab and then have this monster (represented by a marker) round the town and jump into the radioactive pit first to destroy the world and all the other players except you and your monster - to win the game.Or be the sole surviving Mad Doctor to win.

Game involves collecting and assembling monster parts in your lab to create a Frankenstein Monster.

Contains: Color gameboard, 8 Game Pieces, 2 dice, 32 Monster Parts, with complete rules
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Delta Pi 7
description:
Delta Pi 7 is a space-age chess two-player boardgame. The game is for 2 players ages 8 to adult. This is a new chess variant with space ships as the pieces with new rules. Players fire phasers at the enemy space ships given each's firing strength, and the defending ship can choose to defend some of the blasts or none of them or all of the blasts of the attacking vessel with shield power.

To win the game destroy the other player's Home Planet. Pieces move and fire very similar to chess pieces. However, multiple attacks can occur on enemy ships at the same time and you may destroy more than one ship per "move".

Contains: Color gameboard, 32 space ship markers, rules.

name: Fishing Tournament
description:
The Fishing Tournament Game is for 2-4 players Ages 8 and up and. The game consists of 9 turns by each player where the players "fish" for fish by selecting the bait, and the exact location of the cast on a river or lake. Roll dice-see what fish comes up then roll again with dice and see chart to see if you caught the fish, lost the fish or have to roll again to keep fighting the fish in.

To win the game win the most awards (points) for catching the fish. If no one catches a fish in 9 turns you may continue game until first fish caught- that player being the winner of the fishing tournament.

Contains: color gameboard, 3 dice, 4 fisherman markers, 5 bait markers, 3 scoreboard sheets and complete rules

name: Flashball
description:
A simulation of baseball to help children learn simple math.

It includes: ballpark game layout, player tokens, and over 120 basic arithmetic (addition and subtraction) questions.

name: Knockout
description:
Knockout is a board game for two players, ages 8 to adult. Players try to KNOCK off the other players pieces following kinetic reaction rules. The player to knock off the most pieces of the other player wins the game.

Contains: color gameboard, 24 colored chips, rules

name: The Incredibles
description:
This is a game included with the interactive play-a-sound children's book of The Incredibles.

You are trying to defeat Syndrome (aka "Buddy"). To do so you basically push the "i"-incredible button and then push the button that corresponds to the number of sounds played. It sort of likes Simon meets dice. If you land on a Velocipod, you get pushed back. If you land on Super Burst! you go that many forward. It's cute in that it uses sound integrated with an electronic random number generator.

name: Rude Gestures
description:
From the box:

"RUDE GESTURES is the rib-tickling adult game of naughty charades. Played in teams, the first to complete a circuit of the board is the winner. You have only one minute to "perform" your naughty charade to your team. There are three naughty "tongue in cheek" categories to mime - Film Titles, Song titles and Places.

Could you act out "In Bed with Madonna", "Great Balls of Fire" or "Seven Mile Bottom"! RUDE GSTURES will provide hours of riotous red face fun. Ordinary charades will never be the same after you have played RUDE GESTURES !!!"

name: Afro-American History Mystery I
description:
"This black-oriented game uses black history as a theme. Correct answers to quiz-card questions regarding contributions of blacks to American history and culture earn players the chance to fit pieces into one of four picture puzzles of famous Afro-American men. Game II will include the historical contributions of black women, overlooked in Game I." Mentioned in article "Games with Soul" published in Newsweek magazine 10/9/72.

Players place shuffled history cards face down near the board. Each player picks a puzzle and removes all the pieces. Players then spin the spinner and try to fit the number of puzzle pieces matching the spinner in their board in 60 seconds. If they fail, they must return all unused pieces back. If the spinner points to a question mark, the player can answer an African American history question and receive the number of puzzle pieces on the card.

The player who finishes their puzzle first, wins.
mechanics: Action Timer, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game
publishers: Soular Systems Inc, Theme Productions, Inc.

name: Colony, American History Games Series
description:
"Players examine trade relations between American colonies and Britain before the Revolutionary War. The basic conflict between England and the colonies revolves around economic rule of the colonists. Players, in the roles of British government officials, bankers, and colonial merchants, engage in legal trade and smuggling. Merchants seek to maximize profits and the British government tries to balance revenues with expenditures."

Materials: Instructor's manual, players' manuals, game board, chips, chance cards, spirit masters.
publishers: Abt Associates, Inc., Science Research Associates, Inc.

name: Arithmetic Tic-Tac-Toe
description:
"The object of play is to win at Tic-Tac-Toe and to earn points by declaring true statements as required at intersections occupied by discs. Sets build skills in addition and subtraction, multiplication and division."

Materials: Game board, playing pieces, transparent overlay piece, instructions.

name: Bankplan
description:
"Teams [1-4 players each] representing the management of six competing banks allocate their resources in four sectors: savings, accounts, trust management, general current account services, and loans, in accordance with the opportunities and problems in the specific area described in each scenario. The policy objectives of each bank are defined in such a way as to obtain the greatest share of new business."

Materials: Instructor's manual, players' scenarios, circular game board, chance cards, chips.

name: Basis
description:
Basis' is a strategy game similar to the games in the WFF'N Proof series. It was made in 1969 and was created by Robert W. Allen.

"A strategy game in which players try to form three-digit or longer numerals in different number bases while trying to prevent their opponents from doing the same. Players quickly learn the importance of place value."
publishers: Holt Rinehart Winston, International Learning Corporation

name: Block'n Score
description:
"In a strategy game built around the binary number system, players try to outscore each other by judicious and intelligent use of fifteen allotted plusses and zeros. To score, a player must get at least four marks in a row with the score depending on the placement of the zeros and plusses."

Materials: Game board, chips.
mechanics: Connections, Grid Coverage, Pattern Building, Square Grid

name: Bushman Exploring and Gathering
description:
"A two-phase board game designed to teach the concept of cultural adaptation to a harsh environment. It illustrates the subsistence economy of bushmen hunters in the Kalahari Desert of Southwest Africa. Players assume the roles of explorer groups and then the roles of heads of small bushmen families."

Included in the developmental versions of Man: A Course of Study curriculum and game series.
publishers: Abt Associates, Inc., Education Development Center, Inc.

name: Caribou Hunting: The Bow and Arrow Game
description:
"The Bow and Arrow game is a simplified model of one aspect of Eskimo life which allows players to experiment with different strategies for solving the problem of the hunter providing food and clothing for his family. The Caribou player moves a herd of 40 Caribou; each Eskimo player may hunt independently or cooperatively, killing caribou until the herd moves into one of the lakes or off the game board. The game contrasts with the more productive and cooperative technique of hunting from kayaks in The Crossing Place Hunting Game."

From Man: A Course of Study, Unit 6, for 5th grade elementary students.
publishers: Abt Associates, Inc., Curriculum Development Associates, Inc.

name: Caribou Hunting: The Crossing Place Hunting Game
description:
"The Crossing Place Hunting Game models the cooperative technique of hunting caribou on land and from kayaks as the migrating herds swim across a narrow body of water on the Simpson Peninsula in Pelly Bay. The Caribou player moves a herd of 40 caribou on the game map; each Eskimo player moves two hunters, a kayaker and a beater. The Eskimo players may cooperate in their strategy to kill caribou before the herd reaches the other side of the crossing place or moves off the board and ends the game. This game contrasts with the less productive and more individualistic technique of hunting with the bow and arrow. See Caribou Hunting: The Bow and Arrow Game."

From Man: A Course of Study, Unit 6, for 5th grade elementary students.
publishers: Abt Associates, Inc., Curriculum Development Associates, Inc.

name: The Seal Hunting Game
description:
"Players, in a team of five Eskimo hunters (and a referee), hunt seals on a board representing the ice of Pelly Bay, experimenting with hunting and sharing strategies to solve the problems of an unpredictable supply of sustenance . . . The game also dramatizes the importance of sealing in Netsilik society and illustrates the relationship of the seal to mythology and kinship."

From Man: A Course of Study, Unit 6, for 5th grade elementary students.
publishers: Abt Associates, Inc., Curriculum Development Associates, Inc., Education Development Center, Inc.

name: Chemandments
description:
"Chemical fundamentals are presented as game action introduces names of the elements, their chemical symbols, correct formulas, combinability, atomic numbers and weights. No previous chemistry background is needed to participate."

Materials: Game board, player's manual, play money, atom replicas and accessory pieces.

name: The College Game
description:
"Players simulate the experience of one freshman for three weeks of college. Each of the three players [or teams] is given the assignment of attempting to allocate time for one aspect (academic, social or personal) of the simulate student's personality or motivations. They make their decisions independently and then share them on a common game board. The conflicts are worked out through a bargaining process."

Materials: Instructor's manual, players' manuals, game board, dice, playing sheets and student profile.

name: Come Out Even
description:
"To play this game of mathematical rummy, pupils add simple fractions and find common denominators. Shadings and markings on cards help in recognizing equivalent fractions."

Materials: two decks of cards.

An educational mathematics game for elementary students.

name: Community Disaster
description:
"Each player assumes a role in a community hit by a disaster, such as a large fire, explosion, hurricane, tornado, flood, or earthquake . . . During the disaster, each participant has two concerns: to make sure his family members are safe, and to help the community."

For high school through adult. Revised 1970.

Materials: Administrator's manual, players' manuals, game board and accessories.

name: Community Game of Southeast Asia
description:
"Players view a large map of a typical village with its rice paddies, local temple, and other landmarks. Each draws a number of picture cards depicting rice, schools, wells, roads, and hospitals. They take turns trying to 'build' what their village needs most, discovering opportunities for cooperation and dangers of poor planning."

For high school through adult.

Materials: Instructor's manual, map, picture cards.

name: Comput-a-tutor
description:
"The flow chart is one of the principle components of computer technology, a graphic representation of a sequence of operations in a computer program. To familiarize laymen with computer programming, the game's central focus is the construction of a flow chart by arranging the playing pieces in a sequence that gives the highest score. A basic version and an advanced two-stage version may be played."

For ages from junior high school to adult.

name: PerSiVic
description: PerSiVic is a abstract strategy game that is played between 2 players in a square board. Each cell of the square can be empty or have a number of stones. Can be played with different configurations but the standard board is size 9x9. Each player have 3 stones of their own in each cell of their first row. In each turn, the stones of each player move a distance (graph-distance) equal to the number of stones in that cell.

name: Consonant Lotto
description:
"Players match pictures while gaining skills in recognizing initial consonants of words."

An educational game for 1st grade elementary students.

name: Consumer
description:
"Consumer simulates the economics of installment buying and will interest groups studying problems of consumer education, home economics, mathematics, citizenship and democracy. The structure of the game encourages the consumers to weight the added cost of financing a purchase against the additional value of having the item immediately; to determine whether their purchases are yielding the greatest utility for their money; and to guard against unanticipated events not generally covered by insurance."

For players from junior high school through adult.

Materials: Instructor's manual, players' manuals, profile folders, display boards, dice, chance and purchase cards, play money, various business forms and score sheets.

name: Destination
description: "[Two] teams randomly select a foreign country and plan a trip from there to a United Nations General Assembly meeting in New York, to arrive at a prescribed date without spending more than the allotted sum of money. Players learn basic geographical concepts and develop skills in solving travel problems as they use maps, time tables, rate schedules, foreign currencies and conversion tables to solve four phases of increasingly complex travel situations." For junior high school students.

name: Disaster
description:
"An allotted supply of vital resources are expended during play until the player can no longer supply food, water, or air for his increasing population. He suffers Disaster and retires from the game. The last survivor is the winner."

A game of natural resources, pollution, and population control for 5th or 6th grades.

Materials: Game peg board, people peg board, color coded pegs representing air, food and water resources, option and research cards, dice.

name: Empire
description:
"Empire was designed to demonstrate the place of the American colonists in the British Empire, and how their membership in it affected the way they made their living. Teams representing London merchants, New England merchants, colonial farmers, European merchants, southern planters, and British West Indian planters compete for profits from trade in the 18th-century Empire. In dealing with mercantilism and trade regulations players experience London monopoly, arbitrary trade laws, risks of smuggling and piracy, protection and enforcement threats of the Royal Navy."

Age or grade: 8th grade, junior high school, high school.

Materials: Instructor's manual, team manuals, map board, playing pieces, cards.

Part of the From Subject to Citizen curriculum game series, Unit 3, "The Emergence of the American."

The teams are the six groups listed above plus a team representing the Royal Navy. Each team has goods available to sell or trade and a set of goods they wish to acquire. They negotiate sales and barters and then have to ship the goods to the receivers. Only a few teams have ships, the other teams must arrange to rent or buy them from the owners.

Many possible trades are illegal according to British law of the time. The Royal Navy team can board ships for inspection and seize illegal goods.

The object is to acquire the greatest percentage of your team's desired goods.
publishers: Education Development Center, Inc., KDI Instructional Systems

name: The Fate Of Our Food
description:
"On the game board, players follow three swallows of food (boluses) through the simulated digestive system and become familiar with the muscles, organs, and fluids involved in the process."

Age or grade: elementary - junior high school.

Materials: Instructor's manual, players' manuals, cards, game board.

name: Futurity
description:
"Students face problems of the growing world population, and the need for adequate food supply, water, and shelter. Each round of play represents 20 years elapsed time with the resultant population growth, need for resources and necessity for problem solving." Intended for high school use.

Materials (for each team): Game board and three plastic maps, representing resources of a nation underground, above-ground and in space; data sheets of each round; technology sheets; markers.

name: Generation Gap
description:
"Generation Gap simulates the interaction between a parent and an adolescent son or daughter with respect to certain issues on which they may have opposing attitudes. Conflict is presented within a context of rules which reflect the structure of power and interdependence in the family. The purpose is to generate some understanding of this structure and to shape effective strategies for handling the conflict. Parents compete against parents and teenagers against teenagers for scores. Formerly called Parent-Child."

Materials: Instructor's manual, playing boards, issue cards and covers, satisfaction cards, alphabetical letters, score sheets.

name: Invincible Armada
description:
"Players plan the strategy for both sides of the simulated confrontation between the English and Spanish fleets in 1588, based on information on the geography of the theater of battle, and the leadership and weaponry of the adversaries."

Age or grade: 8th grade, junior high school, high school.

Materials: Instructor's manual, players' manuals, game board, map sheets.

Part of the From Subject to Citizen curriculum game series, Unit 1, "Queen Elizabeth: Conflict and Compromise."
publishers: Education Development Center, Inc., KDI Instructional Systems

name: Getset
description:
Games for beginning readers (preschool). "A series of reading readiness games through the pre-primer reading level acquaints children with basic language skills."

The games in the set are Silly Sentences, Stop Dot, Animal Race, Dominoes, Pickafit, Broken Letters, Picture Words and Sentence Train.

name: Group Sounding Game
description:
"Players work to win and gain word recognition skill by covering the words on their playing cards, as the words are read aloud."

Age or grade: 2nd grade, elementary

Materials: Instructor's manual, bingo cards, playing pieces, word list.

name: Gusher
description:
"Players bid for leases, stake drilling locations and make quarterly decisions on all exploration in the form of shallow or deep wells. Player coalitions may be formed to more advantageously exploit the field."

Age or grade: College, adult.

Materials: Instructor's manual, game board.

name: Happy Bears
description: "Players match pictures on cards by learning distinguishing words." For kindergarten and 1st grade students.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Word Game

name: The High School Game
description:
"The High School Game is a social simulation which reflects some of the structural and processual phenomena that characterize the social system of the high school . . . Players assume specific student profiles in a hypothetical high school . . . Achievement brings esteem points from parents, peers and self, in accordance with the value placed on the activity by each group."

Age or grade: Junior high school, high school, college.

Materials: Game board, student profiles, achievement chips.

name: In Force
description: "A criminal justice simulation covering law, crime, police, courts, corrections and prevention. A full-scale version of the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act in action." For 9th to 12th grade students.

name: Innocent Until...
description:
"This role-play exercise simulates the courtroom drama of trial by jury. The case is one of a manslaughter charge against an allegedly drunken driver on the way home with his wife from a 'night on the town' -- the victim a star high school athlete. The defendant, his wife, the lawyers, policemen, and various other witnesses appear before the court as the jury deliberates the case."

Act or grade: Junior high school or high school.

The game was designed by uncredited employees of Abt Associates.

name: Hang-Up
description:
"Players act out 'hang-ups' to develop sensitivity to racial attitudes and the tendency to think in terms of racial stereotypes. As stressful situations are encountered on the game board, players pantomime the 'hang-ups' for other players to identify . . . Based on the premise in The Nature of Prejudice, by Gordon W. Allport."

Age or grade: High school to adult.

Materials: Instructor's manual, players' manuals, game board, three sets of cards, clue lists, playing tokens.

The game was designed by uncredited employees of Synectics Education Systems.

name: Commercial Breaks
description:
COMMERCIAL BREAKS - The game Full of TV Ad Teasers.

From the box:

"Test your knowledge of (UK) TV ads with 1000 crazy crazy questions featuring commercials both old and new - love 'em or hate 'em but can you remember them? You'll have great fun finding out.

Collect 'category cards' by racing around the board, answering the teasing, quirky questions from five categories including - classics, jingles, trivia, slogans and stars.

You might have to name the actor who always managed to soak Joan Collins, or describe what happens when for a refreshing change the dog sniffs around a lamp post in a cider commercial. Would you know which singer gets the fish jumping for Russ Abbott?

Have the ads worked on you? Time to find out when you play COMMERCIAL BREAKS."

name: Digital Empires
description:
An ambitious project, Digital Empires attempted to cover rules for all miniatures periods and scales: skirmish to large armies, caveman wars to science fiction battles of the future. It was only available as a pay-per-PDF file from the publisher, and was over 50 pages long. It covered everything in miniatures combat: movement, morale, ranged weapons, melee, terrain, etc.

Later expanded into:
All-purpose Miniatures Rules

All-purpose Miniatures Rules
categories: Ancient, Fantasy, Medieval, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War I, World War II

name: Maid of Orleans
description:
Maid of Orleans is a miniatures combat game set in the era of Joan of Arc (the Hundred Years War, early 15th century). Specifically, it is set in the siege and relief of Orleans, the battle that made Joan famous. Over half the book (35 of 50 pages) is devoted to creating the fortress, pier, gatehouse, river, bridge, other terrain, cannons, boats and painting the models!

The rules themselves cover movement, missile fire, cannons, melee, morale, wounds, and special rules for Joan, ladders, rocks and unit organization.

name: Besetzt
description:
Essentially a Skittles/Devil amongst the Tinkers variant with event cards and cardboard houses rather than a wooden board to manuever through. Printed in an edition of 500 copies; I could not find an author credited, but there are many, many pages of text, only a few of which seem to make up the rules. The idea behind the game is credited to a Mrs. F. Haag. The rules also include a detailed accounting of the finances of the company:

- 27% printing & material expenses
- 31% salaried work of the principals (10 Swiss Francs/hour)
- 2% author royalties
- 2% postcards
- 6% chaos
- 32% store margins

name: Die Herren aller Länder
description:
Who is President Bush? Too easy? Then try to guess who Jan-Peter Balkenende or Gloria Arroyo is. Whoever can guess the politicians the best is the winner.

It's an easy game, and as with Anno Domini, guessing is more important than knowing.

name: TechnoTycoon
description:
Monopoly with computer properties. However, there are a good number of differences. Board has a path across the center that you move on if you roll either even or odd. Also upgrades to your software come in the form of computer magazine awards which you receive from drawing cards (ie chance and community chest cards)

Also it isn't just "pass go collect $200" the more programs you own the more you collect, also you collect payments from the bank when competitors land on your space.

One other interesting feature is that you can stage a hostile takeover and claim a piece of software from someone if you draw the right card.

Game ends when someone gets to 1 billion dollars cash.

The company's one, and as far as I can tell only, press release:
SEATTLE--(BUSINESS WIRE)--Sept. 25, 1995--Yes! Your Expression Solution !nc. proudly announces the release of TechnoTycoon(TM), the fun and exciting board game where the object is to become a BILLionaire(TM).

In the last decade the software industry has created more millionaires and billionaires than any other industry. Microsoft alone has created the world's richest individual as well as a few other billionaires and several thousand millionaires. Now, with TechnoTycoon it's your turn....

You begin with $50 million. As you play, you acquire various software products by paying their development cost, hoping the return in sales amasses you a fortune of over a billion dollars. TechnoTycoon's software products are parodies of best-selling software and include familiar names like WinDoze, Fun-2-3, WordPurrrrfect, Cyberpunk-In-A-Box, HardWork Graphics and 30 others....

As the players move around the board, they receive sales when other players land on their software. If your software wins awards from computer magazines such as PC Geek, MacAbuser, WinDoze Magazine...sales skyrocket. And if you're fortunate enough to own a software suite, sales are more lucrative for each suite member.

You can cruise the Information Super Highway to faster upgrades and a better chance at becoming a BILLionaire. But watch out for hostile takeovers, the Justice Department, and greedy lawyers. Advertising, taxes and new versions are costs which should be avoided. TechnoTycoon is a game that will be enjoyed by nerds and non-nerds alike.

The price of TechnoTycoon is $29.95 (Washington residents add sales tax of $2.46). TechnoTycoon is only available directly from YES! Your Expression Solution. To order, call 800/U-BUY-FUN (800/828-9386) or send check or money order to YES!, P.O. Box 5753, Kent, WA 98064-5753.

CONTACT: YES! Your Expression Solution !nc.

Brad Stowell or Ted Crane, 206/439-7581

name: Significa & Trivia
description: Popular American author Samuel L. Clemens (Mark Twain) patented this board game in 1893. It sold few copies because it was too complicated.
publishers: Charles L. Webster & Co., Geo. S. Parker

name: War Gaming
description: Introduces the hobby of war games, describing the different kinds and suggesting how to build, paint, and organize miniatures and battlefields and how to make rules for original games.

name: Quantum Traders
description:
The collapse of the Galactic Empire sparked a Dark Age stretching centuries. Many of the colonies on the edge of galactic space were doomed, but a few survived. The Strong. The Resourceful. The Ruthless.

In Quantum Traders, take command of a trade ship of one of four factions. The Galactic Dark Age is ending and a new age of commerce begins. Travel the known galaxy, trading resources for profit. Fulfill contracts to gain prestige. Choose to spend hard earned credits to buy political influence, or upgrade your ship. Complete contracts, provide logistics support of military actions, or transport influential diplomats in exchange for future favors. Who will gather enough clout to become the galaxy's next Merchant Prince?
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Skate Pro
description: Players must roll dice and move, from square to square, through a town collecting skateboard equipment. The player that lands exactly in the winner's circle with all of the store item cards wins the game.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Word of Mouth
description:
Shake the letter dice inside the false teeth and toss them out and form words. But, hurry to form as many as you can before the sand runs through the timer!

Contents:

12 dice
"teeth" dice shaker
60-second sand timer


Word of Mouth is a word dice game.
publishers: International Playthings, Inc., Paul Lamond Games Ltd

name: Curious George Nutrition Game
description: Young Curious George fans will delight in identifying the food cards and matching them to the pictures on the game boards. Sorting and organizing skills are developed as players learn to classify the objects they see, and visual discrimination and fine motor skills are enhanced as they play. Best of all, as the game is played, knowledge of the basic food group units is acquired, reinforcing the importance of good nutritional habits.

name: Mystic Adventures, City
description:
Mystic Adventure, City, takes one of the most important places in the Mystic Adventures game, the city of Mordenhelm, and expands upon what you can do there. No longer is it just a small region among many, but now a place all to itself. Enter the walls of this great city and you can find all you might need in your quest to become the ruler of the lands about you. Wealth, power, lore and danger all wait for those that brave the many city streets and back allies of this great metropolis.

Expands:

Mystic Adventures
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Mystic Adventures, Battles
description: Mystic Adventures, Battles, takes the existing battle system for the Mystic Adventures game system, and expands upon it, adding several new and exciting rules and strategies. Players will find that their Mystic Adventures games beginning to take on more and more exciting conflicts as players try to out maneuver, and out think, their opponents.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Medieval, Travel, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Mystic Adventures, Outer Planes
description:
Mystic Adventures, Outer Planes is the latest expansion in the Mystic Adventures game system. Take your quest into the outer reaches of reality, explore the lower planes of the damned and then move on to the halls of the gods. The elemental planes call to you, and if you answer, you can command their powers. This expansion will offer players a whole new realm of adventure, one that is dangerous, but whose rewards are great.

Expands:

Mystic Adventures
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Wynn's Safari: The Game
description:
The Wynn's Safari “The Game” is based on the annual Sydney to Darwin marathon. Players Drive their off road vehicles from Sydney to Darwin stopping at check points and tacking short cuts along the way.
Really a glorifying snakes and ladders used as a promotional product for Wynn's fuel additives.
No copyright or publisher shown on box, board or rules.

name: Friendo
description:
FRIENDO™ is a game that challenges your ability to guess how others will react in a given situation.

For every sitting of a game, one story, along with 5 related questions, is used. This item is known as a "Case 'N Questions™".

Total Score = Points x Friendo Chips.

The objective of FRIENDO™ is to maximize Total Score. To do that, you must be able to 1)correctly guess how others answer their questions AND 2)partner-up with somebody and correctly guess each other's answers.

If you stay single, (i.e. without a partner), you get no Friendo Chip, and thus, will always have a Total Score of zero.

Game is over when either 1)all the answers (20 if there are 4 players) have been guessed or recalled or 2)when, as a result of players going bankrupt of Points, only 3 players are left on the board. There must be at least 4 players for a game to continue. Then, whoever has the most Total Score wins.

Free online multi player game available at www.friendo.com. Click "Play Online".
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move, Storytelling

name: 25 Super Cool Math Board Games
description: A book which lets kids play game of multiplication, division, fractions, probability, estimation, mental math, and more.

name: 25 Instant & Irresistible Math Board Games (Grades 2-4)
description: A book which lets kids play games which teach: addition, subtraction, multiplication, division, time, money, fractions, geometry, and more.

name: Charlotte Square
description:
From the box:
'The board is a bird's eye view of George Street, Charlotte Square and St. Andrews Square in the New Town of Edinburgh.'
'Players must first park their car and then visit up to eight shops or businesses in the area. However, many hazards await them - Parking Meters, Traffic Wardens, Endless delays and Diversions'
The idea is to
1) park your car and put money in the meter. This determines how many turns you have before you must return to your car.
2) visit the shops as determined by a random card allocation
3) return to your card before your money runs out (or the Traffic Warden gets you!)
4) Repeat until all your errands are finished and you drive away.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Mission 'N' Possible
description:
A Mystery Theme Party for 6 to 20 Players.

Get Ready for an evening of fun, laughter and suspense as you and your guests race to save the world.

This game includes both an adult and child version of the game.

Great for Family Get Togethers, Neighborhood Fun, Birthday Parties, etc.

The only thing that's "impossible" is not having fun!

Dr. Jones has stolen top-secret information, which he plans to publish on the Internet. Your mission, should you decide to accept it, is to travel as teams to five foreign countries and decode the secret information in each one. Teams follow a travel map to different country locations. As always, should any of your team be caught, the host will disavow any knowledge of this mission.

name: Card Games For Two
description:
From the book cover:
"Card Games For Two offers a feast of card games with something suitable for all the family. From children's favorites such as Old Maid, through classic games like Whist and Rummy, to the exotically named Julepe and Klob, or the fiendishly competitive Bezique or Spite and Malice, this book has something for everyone. There are more than 100 games (including variations), fully described and graded for difficulty. Neither you nor your friends will want to be without a deck of cards again!"

name: Try Time: New Zealand's Rugby Trivia Game
description:
From the box:

"Try Time is the exciting new rugby trivia game for rugby enthusiasts. So you think you know your rugby? .... Try time will give you and your friends hours of fun and rugby banter - play the game 2 ways - collect categories, with the winner being the first to collect them all or set a time limit and accumulate points through tries, conversions and the occasional drop kick. Either way, a feast of fun awaits as you attempt to step your way to the line on New Zealand's foremost rugby trivia game."

name: Somewhere in the Honduras
description:
From the publisher:

We are local business partners collecting various goods from the countryside and delivering them to Coastal Export Warehouses, Inc. CEW pays us in Lempira for everything we bring in plus bonuses for completing certain contracts. The pay is poor and the dangers many. If we are not avoiding snakes, chagas, flash floods and the like, we are watching out for robbers. So, why bother, you ask? It's a living and a lot of rural workers depend on us. If you lack the necessary pride, wisdom and courage, don't join us, join the banditos.

name: Net Ball
description:
A board game simulation of the popular Net Ball game.

Described on the box as: "A fast moving game of skill and accuracy"

name: StapleWars
description:
From the designer:

"The StapleWars board game is a game which combines action games, which involve moving parts (along the lines of Mousetrap or Weapons of War) and strategy games, which involve building and conquering, (like Risk or Axis and Allies) in one. All units and structures are made out of HEAVY DUTY staples, which can be found at any hardware store. Staplewars plays like a strategy game... until it is time to attack. Ammunition staples are flicked at units and structures, and if the units or structures are knocked down, they are destroyed! The purpose of this page is to encourage people to play this exciting game, to give people instructions for their own StapleWars arenas and sets, and to clarify information about this exciting new game. Give it a try, it is a lot of fun!"

name: Land Rover
description:
A children's game which is effectively a promotional item for Land Rover cars. The game is a simple roll and move game similar to Snakes and Ladders. It comes with a laminated board, a set of rules, and a cut-out spinner and pieces.

The winner is the first player to reach the finish on an off road track, but you have to beware of hazards along the way, such as broken fan belts, mud, etc.

name: Twin Treasures
description:
From the back of the box:

There's a bounty of learning contained in this high seas memory game where children match objects hidden in an adventurous tropical environment.

name: Grafolampo
description:
From the rules:

Grafolampo is a new, enthralling and instructive amusement, which has been invented for intelligent boys and for adults who are keen on puzzles.

Grafolampo is a competing cross-word, which leaves no ground to fortune but assigns victory to the promptest and shrewdest player.

The box includes:
4 game boards
300 letter cards
1 card distributor

name: Donald Duck Flips His Lid
description: Using two Donald Ducks, you flip cone shaped pieces to score on a numbered board... Think Tiddly Winks meets Disney marketing.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
publishers: Gardner & Co., International Games, Walt Disney Productions (Disney)

name: Rodeo, The Wild West Game
description: Rodeo is a family game where players participate in up to five different rodeo events (bulldogging, calf roping, bull riding, etc.). Action is controlled with a spinner, so luck is usually the governor of outcome. But so is the selection of a bull when you're riding. A fun game for the family.

name: The White Wine Game
description:
From the publisher:

The WHITE WINE GAME is an adult board game that combines wine, food and strategy to produce fun. You provide a bottle of any white table wine, your choice of four food items and 2 to 6 adults. The WHITE WINE GAME provides the strategy and the fun.


Why you will enjoy the WHITE WINE GAME Have fun and experience a stimulating strategic challenge while enjoying your favorite wine.



No prior knowledge of wine is necessary to play.



Wine enthusiasts and beginners can play the game together without either person having a major advantage.



Learn more regarding wine and great food and wine pairings.



Make the game a unique experience each time you play by varying the wines and food items.



A great way for wine enthusiasts to share their passion in a way that is fun and educational for everyone.


Game includes 40-page booklet, Tips For Enjoying Wine And This Game...Recipes For Complementing Wine And This Game with suggestions for selecting and serving wine, descriptions of 30 types of white wine and recipes for 45 food items.

From the publisher's website:
"Players begin by viewing, smelling and tasting the wine to record the colors, aromas and flavors they observe. Points are earned as players move around the game board and land on spaces corresponding to the wine characteristics identified by the most players. Most enjoyable, players visit Food Match spaces where they sample the wine in combination with a food item. In the Complete Version of the game, players gain and lose sets of Recipe cards that add to their point totals. At the end of the game, players total their points to determine a winner and discuss their observations regarding the wine and food."

name: Guru
description:
Guru is the love generation's remodeling of Go, for four swingers (players).

For two players, each player has ten pegs. Play on board to form a line of 5 to win. After 10 pegs have been played then a player moves a peg.

name: Thimk
description: Thimk looks much like an abacus and could probably be played with one. In Thimk you take turns sliding beads along any of the rows. the object is to leave your opponent with the last move.

name: Armchair Racing
description: The "sport of kings" is portable. Make bets on which horse you think will win. Vary the tote to increase or decrease odds, and have fun.

name: Go! Hound Go!
description:
One player is selected to "sit out" and direct the other players in their search. This player hides a spring-loaded bone under one of the item squares on the board. Each of these squares has a small 'keyhole'.

The active players search for the bone using their dog pieces. Clues are given by the person who hid the bone throughout the game. When a player thinks they know which item the bone is hidden beneath they can opt to use the key and open the compartment. If they have guessed correctly the bone springs out and that person wins the game; if they are incorrect they must take no further part in that round.

name: Fantasy Football Board Game
description:
From the publisher:

Contents:
20"x30" Board
Rules
40 Pick Pile Cards
200 Player Cards With Stats
Roster
122 Punch Out Tokens
6 Double Sided Score Cards

You begin by drafting your team, then you roll dice to advance around the board. Each time around the board equals one week in the season. There are 200 player cards with stats on the back broken down into 17 weeks. The stats are their actual performance last year, with a column for their fantasy points each week. There are also 16 rookie cards with newly drafted rookies and their projected stats for 2005. At the end of each week, you add up the points for the players on your team and compete against a different player each time around the board.

Several things can happen while playing the game as you advance around the board. You can be forced to trade with another person, you can pick up free agents, your players can get injured or suspended,you can get plus or minus points for the week,etc.

You accumulate season points, as well as wins and losses. The 2 or 4 teams with the most wins advance to a playoff round, and a champion is determined.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading

name: Complete Whodunit Mystery Night
description:
Ten different plots so you can play again and again - a whole evening's chilling entertainment in one box!

Can you work out whodunit? Dastardly crimes have been committed and it's up to you and your guests to work out which of the players is the culprit!

The Complete Whodunit Mystery Night contains everything you need for night after night of grisly murder and sensational sleuthing.

Contents:
· Host's guide booklet
· A newsreel audio CD to set the scene and provide vital clues to solving the crime
· Character scripts for your guests containing all the details you need to uncover the murderer among you
· Costume suggestions for each character
· Stylish invitations to witness the crime of the century
· Easy-to-follow recipes for crime-free cooking
· 10 "Guilty"/"Innocent" cards
· Room plan
· Family tree
· Name stickers
· Introduction sheet
categories: Adventure, Bluffing, Deduction, Murder/Mystery, Party Game, Puzzle, Real-time
mechanics: Acting, Cooperative Game, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Shuttle Challenge
description: Fly your Space Shuttle thoughout the solar system and return safely to Earth. Die rolls and successfully answering questions are key to advancement along the way.

name: Blow Out
description:
"Be an oil magnate!" Players take turns inflating a balloon inside a plastic oil well. Successful pumps of the well translate into barrels of oil for a player, but causing the well to break apart (whether the balloon pops or not) translates into disaster.

Perhaps anticipating that balloons were likely to be inflated to the bursting point, Ideal supplied this game with a number of replacements.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Industry / Manufacturing

name: Bionic Bullfrog
description:
"Leaps and bounds of fun for all!" Race around the board, using bonus cards to help you on your way.

Despite the curious name, there is no connection to the TV series The Six Million Dollar Man, The Bionic Woman, or any games in that vein.

name: Cybernetic Overkill
description: This microgame appeared in the magazine, Fractal Spectrum (FS), issue #18. It's an arena combat between two cyborgs. The rules, character sheets, and hex map are provided - players must provide 3d8 and counters with a recognizable front, as facing is important. Cyborgs are designed with five attributes: Aim, Melee, Dodge, Maneuver, and Skill. The map shows some obstacles characters can maneuver around. Survivor wins.

name: Beat the Devil
description:
Object of the game: Be the first player to reach the Glory Land space.
Players spin and move along the track. You start with 5 "Beat the Devil" cards in your hand. These include either or both counter cards or "Bad" cards. You play a "Bad" card on the player to your left which is used to slow your opponent down either by losing a turn, moving to a "Troubled Space" or waiting until the appropriate counter card is drawn or played. Counter cards include Faith, Healing, Praise, Armour, Word, Repentance and Jesus, which get you out of "Bad" cards played against you or "Troubled spaces" such as doubt and Disbelief, Devil, Sin, Sickness and Disease and Financial Disaster.

name: Pit Bissed
description:
An adult oriented drinking game with cards.

Pit Bissed takes a few favorite parlor games, blends them with traditional drinking rules and shakes them up with some riotous new cards to create the ultimate party game.

Pit Bissed is a great way to get to know your friends better, and an even greater way to quickly make new ones. The more times you play, the greater the game becomes, especially with the input and influences of new players.

You can play Pit Bissed with friends all night long or just a couple of hands to warm up before other activities. Tell your friends to bring a few jokes and tricks so you are all ready to party!

name: 2012 Overture
description:
From the publisher's website:

A war game for 2 or 3 players featuring plastic jets, tanks, hovercraft, helicopters and missile launchers.

After decades of failed economic reform the republics of the former Soviet Union still lie weak and impotent.
With the ultimately successful, but costly, war on terror behind it the United States is consumed in a wave of isolationism. In a series of daring diplomatic maneuvers and blitzkrieg military offensives the whole of Central Europe is swallowed in a French anschluss. (ANNEXATION OF CENTRAL EUROPE BY FRANCE)

Britain, its economy wrecked by French trade sanctions, stands alone amidst a conquered continent. The Mediterranean Sea is closed to British commerce. With the Atlantic sea lanes in danger, arrangements are made to build bases on Madeira and the Canary Islands to supplement the British presence in the Azores.
