Certain squares on the board require the drawing of a Chance card which normally result in income being received from or paid to the bank.

The “New Share Quotations” square results in the changing of share prices for some of the blocks of companies. This will result in players losing or gaining money on the shares that they own. It also requires players to put up one of their shares for auction thereby permitting players to trade in shares.

The game can be ended in three ways, which should be decided before the game starts:
- After a set time.
- When the first player becomes bankrupt.
- When all but one player has gone bankrupt.

At the end of the game the money is counted and shares are valued at whatever is the then current rate. The player with the greatest assets is declared the winner.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Floaties & Sinkies!
description:
This expansion for the first edition of the 25mm miniatures game, Pirates! Miniature Battles on the High Seas, provides new ships, new ordnance, new races (dark dwarves, dark elves, reptilians, and halflings), and creature creation rules. Rules for dirigibles and submarines have also been included.

Pirates! 2nd & 3rd editions contain all the F&S! content within the main rulebook.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Nautical, Pirates, Wargame

name: The Gloucester Game
description:
THE GLOUCESTER GAME is one of a series of Monopoly style board game developed by local YMCAs in the UK to generate funds for their activities. The games in the series are essentially the same, but as in the different versions of Monopoly, the board and the businesses are specifically themed to the town or city represented in the title - in this case the City of GLOUCESTER in the West of England. Gloucester is one of Britains famous Roman ports and is also near the Cotswolds and the Forest of Dean.

Players progress around the board as a result of the roll of 2D6. When landing on a Company square a player may purchase a share in that company (there are two shares available in each company), if he wishes. If not he may put the share up for auction, with any excess over the sale price being retained by that player as his fee for being the auctioneer.

Players landing on companies that are already owned must pay to visit, with the payment due being based on how many shares are owned in that particular company and in the other two companies in the same colour series. Since shares can be owned by two different players both may demand payment from a visitor.

Certain squares on the board require the drawing of a Chance card which normally result in income being received from or paid to the bank.

The “New Share Quotations” square results in the changing of share prices for some of the blocks of companies. This will result in players losing or gaining money on the shares that they own. It also requires players to put up one of their shares for auction thereby permitting players to trade in shares.

The game can be ended in three ways, which should be decided before the game starts:
- After a set time.
- When the first player becomes bankrupt.
- When all but one player has gone bankrupt.

At the end of the game the money is counted and shares are valued at whatever is the then current rate. The player with the greatest assets is declared the winner.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: La Taverne du Dragon
description:
Third installation of the series "La Taverne de" after "Taverne de la Licorne" and "Taverne de la Crypte", this game can be combined with the other two, and is in the same style of cartoon medieval fantasy humor.

This is a game designed to simulate a tavern brawl.
Each player receives 3 characters with different powers, a little money, 30 hit points and the 9 weapon cards.
Before the first turn, each player chooses one of his characters, that will be played until the character has lost all hit points. Then, he'll take any of the lasting twos until the same arrives, upon which he'll take his last character.

The turn is divided in 4 segments. All player undertake a segment before any begins the following segment.

The 4 segments are:
- "Dépensez vos butins" (expense your loot) where you can buy some of the "big" weapons cards and add them to your hand (the small ones are ALWAYS in your hand)
- "Préparez vos esquives" (prepare your dodges) where you put on your character, face up, any of the weapons you bought, up to the prestige (fame) value of your character
- "Attaquez" (attack) where each player chooses a weapon in hand and say who he attacks (players at his side for contact weapons, other players with ranged weapons)
- "Videz vos querelles" (end your quarrels) where attacks are resolved. An attack is dodged if the defensive player has correctly found the value of the attack coming. A successful attack make the defensive character lose some of his HP, and the attacking character win prestige or loot.

In plus of the weapons card, there are other cards that players can use to affect the game.

If a player arrives at 5 in prestige, he can call the militia that will end the game. If a character becomes KO by losing all his Hit Points, its player takes his next character.

A player can come in the game, or leave, at any moment. The game is conceived for that.
mechanics: Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Yeo Valley Challenge
description:
YEO VALLEY CHALLENGE is one of a series of Monopoly style board game developed by local YMCAs in the UK to generate funds for their activities. The games in the series are essentially the same, but as in the different versions of Monopoly, the board and the businesses are specifically themed to the town or city represented in the title - in this case the town of Clevedon in the West of England.

Players progress around the board as a result of the roll of 2D6. When landing on a Company square a player may purchase a share in that company (there are two shares available in each company), if he wishes. If not he may put the share up for auction, with any excess over the sale price being retained by that player as his fee for being the auctioneer.

Players landing on companies that are already owned must pay to visit, with the payment due being based on how many shares are owned in that particular company and in the other two companies in the same colour series. Since shares can be owned by two different players both may demand payment from a visitor.

Certain squares on the board require the drawing of a Chance card which normally result in income being received from or paid to the bank.

The “New Share Quotations” square results in the changing of share prices for some of the blocks of companies. This will result in players losing or gaining money on the shares that they own. It also requires players to put up one of their shares for auction thereby permitting players to trade in shares.

The game can be ended in three ways, which should be decided before the game starts:
- After a set time.
- When the first player becomes bankrupt.
- When all but one player has gone bankrupt.

At the end of the game the money is counted and shares are valued at whatever is the then current rate. The player with the greatest assets is declared the winner.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: The Wimbledon Challenge
description:
THE WIMBLEDON CHALLENGE is a monopoly style stock-market board game developed by the WIMBLEDON (UK) YMCA to generate funds for its activities. Wimbledon is situated in the south of London and is famous for holding the World Famous Lawn Tennis championships and has been for 125 years.

Players progress around the board as a result of the roll of 2D6. When landing on a Company square a player may purchase a share in that company
(there are two shares available in each company), if he wishes. If not he may put the share up for auction, with any excess over the sale price being
retained by that player as his fee for being the auctioneer.

Players landing on companies that are already owned must pay to visit, with the payment due being based on how many shares are owned in that particular
company and in the other two companies in the same colour series. Since shares can be owned by two different players both may demand payment from a visitor.

Certain squares on the board require the drawing of a Chance card which normally result in income being received from or paid to the bank.

The “New Share Quotations” square results in the changing of share prices for some of the blocks of companies.
This will result in players losing or gaining money on the shares that they own. It also requires players to put up one of their shares for auction thereby permitting players to trade in shares.

The game can be ended in three ways, which should be decided before the game starts:

After a set time
When the first player becomes bankrupt
When all but one player has gone bankrupt

At the end of the game the money is counted and shares are valued at whatever is the then current rate. The player with the greatest assets is declared the winner.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Oval 2001
description: Simple roll-and-move racing game intended for children. A quick-playing game suitable for season play. Includes oversize plastic track for use with 1/64 scale race cars. Race cars are not included. This game is the subject of US Patent 6,464,223.

name: Count Chocula: Who Did It?
description: Follow the trail of green goo through the castle. Which of our spooky friends has caused the Big Green Bang? The first person to lay down all the cards in their hand, find the key and enter the right laboratory wins the game!

name: Bellum Numerorum
description: Bellum Numerorum is a abstract tactical boardgame for 2 players. It has simple rules, but is very tactical. Players move numbered pieces on a square grid and attempt to capture the opponent's pieces.

name: Pay The Cashier
description:
Money is given to each player. There is enough money for four players. For each game, one player is the Cashier and the other players are Customers. The spinner is used to decide who is the first Cashier. Each player chooses the name of a store and then the spinner tells which one is chosen. The Cashier shuffles the cards and deals them face down into six piles,one for each store.Cashier spins the spinner to tell the first player to his left which store he'll be going too. The player picks up the top card of that store pile, turns it over, and reads aloud what it says. He then pays the Cashier for his purchases as shown on the card. The Cashier must check the payment and also any change that is given. The Cashier spins the spinner to see which store the next player will go to, and so on. Play continues until some player cannot "Pay the Cashier" because he dose not have the money. Then the other players count their money and the winner is the player with the most money left.
The game teaches the different coins and bills up to $10. The game teaches the adding bills and coins to make the amount of a purchase, just as a customer does in the store.

name: Energy Baron
description:
From the game box: "The object of ENERGY BARON is to become the wealthiest player through purchase, sale, and development of oil and natural gas leases. The player with the most cash at the end of the game is the winner. ENERGY BARON is most enjoyable when players form partnerships and make deals. The game was designed for imaginative people who enjoy the risks and benefits of any business."

This game was distributed "Compliments of Mark West."

Contents:

Large mounted playing board: world map with 17 oil/gas property sites
Rules
8 bags of different colored property markers (at least 17 per bag)
1 bag of dry well markers (white)
1 bag of successful well markers (black)
4 Property Summary sheets
7 stacks of money in various denominations
1 stack of Condition cards
1 six-sided die

name: The Cosmos
description: The Cosmos contains a star-shaped foldout board, a quantity of plastic stars in various sizes, a deck of Moon Probe cards, a somewhat unusual set of five plastic planets (Earth, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus) and 5 people figures in matching colors. Unfortunately, the one copy I have seen lacked instructions. So while it is possible to deduce the object of the game (acquire three "galaxies"), and while one can even tell how to acquire a "galaxy" (acquire stars for 5 constellations), there is no clue as to when or how to move the people and planets around the board.

name: FIRE The Exciting Game of Firefighting
description:
FIRE puts one or more players in the role of a city fire department chief or battalion chief in a department.

The mounted board is an 18 x 15 inch representation of an urban environment including streets and alleys, business and residential districts, industry and fire stations. Structures are color-keyed green for low buildings and blue for multistory.

The playing pieces are squares and rectangles of 3/8" plexiglass. Self-adhesive colored stickers are applied producing lime-green miniature fire command vehicles, rescue ambulances, fire engines and ladder trucks.

The standard game is 24 turns long, represent a 24-hour shift. Each turn, a die roll determines whether zero, one, or two alarms are received. Each building on the map is marked with a street address. Every time an alarm is received, a label corresponding to a board location is drawn randomly, indicating the site of the alarm.

An alarm may be indicated as a "medical emergency, a "call" (corresponding to a "local alarm" in many fire departments) or a "1st Alarm" (potentially, a more serious situation).

The controlling Player determines which assets to dispatch to the scene depending on nature of incident and location. Responses range from a single rescue ambulance for a medical emergency up to a multi-station response for a multistory structure, row house with multiple exposures or industrial complex.

Each game-turn is broken down into three impulses. Each impulse, emergency vehicles may move up to eight squares toward a scene. Physical space limitations often play a role, since alleys are only one square wide. Pumpers take up two squares, ladder trucks three, making traffic control important when placing apparatus (particularly ladder trucks, which must be within reach of the structure in question).

Beginning in the second impulse, as long as at least one unit has arrived the controlling player may attempt to resolve the incident. Resolution may determine that the call is a false alarm, that the fire has been extinguished, or that it continues to burn or intensifies. At the player's discretion, he may wait until the third impulse before resolving the situation, in order to allow more assets to arrive.

Each unit type has a points value representing its firefighting capabilities. Certain combinations of units--such as two engine companies, a truck company, and a chief officer--have a higher value than the face value of the units present, representing the fire ground tactics such combinations make possible--primary and secondary search, fire suppression, water supply, ventilation, exposure protection, fire ground command, etc.

The point total of firefighting assets present is cross-indexed to a die roll on the "Results Table" and an outcome determined. Fires not extinguished at the end of the game-turn intensify one level (defined in the game as "1st Alarm, 2nd Alarm," etc. through "5th Alarm"). Fires of 2nd Alarm intensity or greater spread to adjacent spaces, either to a neighboring building or to additional spaces within a single large structure. Poorly placed fire apparatus may also be destroyed by expanding fires.

Each new game-turn the alarm determination process is followed, meaning that new incidents may be generated. It is important to hold some department assets in reserve to allow for responses to additional incidents. The entire department numbers one "Marshal" (Chief of Department), three Battalion Chiefs, twelve Engine Companies, five Ladder Companies and six Rescue Ambulances distributed in six stations of various sizes. Relocation of uncommitted assets is sometimes necessary to maintain adequate fire protection during major fires.

Rules cover wind direction, firefighter injuries, apparatus breakdown or other loss while responding, and, optionally, water supply.

The goal of FIRE is to maintain public safety at the lowest possible level of asset activity. At the end of each turn, points are assessed for each unit out of quarters, whether fighting a fire or returning from a call. The object is to achieve the lowest possible score while efficiently handling emergencies--a balancing act between dispatching sufficient assets and using assets efficiently.

name: Warriors in Antiquity
description:
"Hail, dear warriors and women warriors! Let me welcome you just before you make your final step into the gate of breathtaking world of Ancient battlefields. I believe you didn't open this document by a mere coincidence. I suppose everybody of us, at least once upon a time, wants to become someone else, famous commander, unbeatable conqueror in command of victorious army, like Alexander the Great or Gaius Iulius Caesar. In bolder dreams we could imagine ourselves changing the history and saving the entire nations by glorious skills and correct tactical decisions."

Warriors in Antiquity is a strategic game designed for two players yet more players may participate during play. In our historical scenarios players become sovereign generals of mighty armies that fought many centuries ago on battlefields of the ancient world. The result of the game, whether the history would repeat or change, depends entirely on the players.

Historical scenarios:
- Heraclea 280 B. C.

http://games.mantikora.com/games/strategy.php4
http://games.mantikora.com/games/warriorsinantiquity/brules....

name: Katmandou
description:
In the 19th century, excavation sites in Kathmandu uncover spectacular testimonials of earlier civilizations. With your team of archaeologists, you take part in the adventure.

This game was later simplified, redesigned and released as Pandémonium. The rules are exactly the same.

Katmandou won an award at the "Concours International Des Créateurs de Jeux de Société" in 2004.

See "Web Links" section below for location of archived files allowing PnP in French.

name: The Rats of Rottenberg
description:
Overview: Castle Rottenberg is infested with rats! King Alfred has hired the best rat trappers in his kingdom to rid his castle of the lowly vermin before his Queen returns. The problem? The Queen will arrive in only six hours! The rats have to be taken care of...and soon! With a little bit of the Wizard’s magical help and your own wits, you attempt to impress the King with your abilities. But the Wizard also has an interest in what you trap. Will you be able to match wits with your competition and secure the rights of trap master in this land? Can you catch the vilest and most numerous of rats and secure your position as a member of the King’s loyal staff?

Goal of the game:
The players will move from room to room trying to trap as many of the rats as they can, by using magic items and outmaneuvering their opponents.
The rats have three point values depending on their degree of nastiness:
1: plain old rat
2: aggressive rat
3: diseased rat
The rats also come in four colours:
black, white, grey, and brown.
Most of the valuable rats are of black colour, followed by brown, grey, and white. This may lead some players to choose to pursue only black or brown rats in their quest. However, the Wizard is a strange sort and wants to use the rats of all colours for his potions and magic. He rewards players handsomely for having rats of each colour. Keeping in mind that the white rats are the least common, and the black rats are most numerous, it is the rat trapper who can balance the best of both strategies who will ultimately win the game.
This game features a very innovative game board design: a northern cross section of the castle is one one side of the board, and the southern cross section of the castle is on the other side of the board, in such a way that the roofs are almost touching. Each room presented on the cross sections have doors leading east/west/both, but also have a door set into their back wall of the room which leads to the other side of the board and the other cross section.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Le cercueil de Dracula
description:
By the designer of Saboteur and Gouda! Gouda!

This was published as a magazine game in issue 12 of Tangente Jeux & Stratégie.

A fantasy horror game. The title roughly translates as The Coffin of Dracula. Players move around Dracula's castle. There are supplements on the magazine's website.

name: Spelen met vormen
description:
A funny and educational game for little children.
Both player get some cards and a sac filled with different shapes. Every card has a piece missing, try to get the right shape out of the bag for the first card, if it is the right one you can move on and try to find the right shape for the next card, otherwise you'll have to try again...

name: FrenchTots
description:
FrenchTots
very first French words through songs and games

FrenchTots has been compiled by Teresa Scibor, a leading expert in teaching languages to young children.
She runs the very popular French clubs, Le Club Tricolore and Tricolore Tots, on the principle that children learn languages best when they are having fun.

Teresa Scibor has drawn on her experience in creating FrenchTots. It introduces new words at just the right pace
and the cassette tape uses songs, games, sound effects and a touch of humor to making learning fun. Your child will enjoy listening to it again and again, at home or in the car, which ensures they'll build plenty of confidence with their first French words.

name: Quaspi
description:
Abstract tile-laying maze game where players try to be the first to get 4 pawns to the opposite end of the board by placing "walled" corridor tiles across and empty grid. Movement across tiles of your own colour is easy, but there are special rules for crossing other players' corridors or dealing with situations where pawns find themselves blocked by other pawns.

Players start with 60 tiles each, equally split between the 3 different types of corridor. The backside of the tiles show 3 dice results that come into play when players attempt cross other people's corridors. Players pick the tile of their choice, add it to the board, then move one of their pawns as far as they are allowed. The next player does likewise. This continuous until someone succesfully crossed the 10 square gap to the other side of the board with all their pawns.

This Austrian game was self-published and appeared in a large, lavish, tailormade plastic wallet that offered space for the folded cardboard board and had a seperate compartment to hold the wooden pawns, the tiles and the tiny die. The designer later founded his own imprint, Leobener Spiele.

name: Fools Play Rasslin' League Battling Card Game
description: From the Publisher: Now you can re-create the fun and excitement of an FRPL event right in the comfort of your own home, without risking bodily injury! With the FPRL Battling Card Game, you can take on the persona of your favorite FPRL Superstar and do battle with an opponent!

name: Sneak
description:
Sneak is a commissioned game from Kira Snyder for the game design textbook "Rules of Play", by Katie Salen and Eric Zimmerman.

Sneak is a party game for 3 or more players. Each player is secretly assigned a role, either a Spork, a Foon, or the Sneak. Only one player is the Sneak, the others are evenly divided between Sporks and Foons. The goal is to figure out who is the Sneak.

The players perform a series of challenges. Some of the challenges are private (written on a note card) and some are public. The challenges typically direct Sporks and Foons to do different things (for example, draw a train vs draw a plane), and the Sneak gets to choose which one to do, except for certain challenges which tell the Sneak what to do.

Each player starts the game with four counters, and they can use these counters to buy information. For one counter, a player can require another player to show the entire group one of their written note cards. For two counters, a player can purchase a private look at another player's note card.

Players can call for a vote at anytime, and each player writes down who they think the Sneak is. Sporks and Foons get points for guessing correctly, or lose points for guessing wrong. The Sneak gets points when other players guess incorrectly, and loses points when other players guess right.

name: Foul Play
description:
FOUL PLAY - The Cunning Brass Band Card Game

Each card depicts either the conductor or player within a brass band, with each card having a scoring value of between 1 and 7

Starting with a hand of 7 cards players try to build a band by drawing form a deck, the discard pile or requesting cards from the player immediately on their left - and then discarding. Obtaining cards from another player involves requesting cards by the colour of the jacket the player wears, though the player is not obliged to declare any musicians of that type should he choose not to do so.

The object of the game is to get a full band - that is one card for each section in the band: cornets / horns / trombones / euphoniums / basses / percussion / conductor.

When a player is confident that he has a winning hand then he can "declare" by placing his hand face down on the table. Play continues among the other players until a second player declares. At this point the players with complete bands then score their hands with the highest total winning. In the event of a tie the winner is the player with the highest number of cards with players in the same colour jacket.

name: Elephant Challenge
description:
ELEPHANT CHALLENGE is a memory game that can be played with individuals or teams.

The game comes with two sets of components each comprising 16 cards (numbered 1 to 16), 4 dice in different colours, 4 counters in different colours, and an elephant.

The first player takes one bag of components and, after shuffling the cards places them in 4 rows of 4 in any order. He then places the 4 dice, 4 counters and elephant on any 9 of the cards.

On completion of this the timer (one minute) is turned over and the second player has until the time runs out to memorize the exact location of the cards, dice (colour and number), counters and elephant.

A cover is then placed over the puzzle, hiding it from view and the second player must reproduce it in every detail using the second bag of components. He scores 1 point for every correct card, dice, counter and elephant.

The object of the game is to beat your opponent's score but ultimately to remember all 25 items correctly.

name: Atomic Circus
description:
"A funny card game to play on a playing board.
Our 4 artists are in search of their stage clothes. to realize their number, they exchange prop cards. Which of them will collect the 6 cards first to produce his/her show?"

Contents: 1 game board 15 x 19 inches 4 notebooks, 4 3-D checkers, 24 cards, a wooden dice.

Ages 4+
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Dice, Educational

name: Mitchell: The Card Game
description:
The adventures of a boozy, puffy-faced detective...

Your hearts will pound and your veins will clog when you and your friends play Mitchell: The Card Game! It's fun, easy to learn and as fast-paced as Joe Don Baker himself. Each player becomes one of Mitchell's suspects and tries to keep Mitchell the hell away. Will Mitchell's tireless technique and bottomless hunger find you guilty? Or will you be fortunate enough to fly under his immense, sloppy radar? Only clever card play and a sense of humor will keep you safe... from Mitchell.

Mitchell: The Card Game features full color cards with images and quotes taken directly from the "Mitchell" episode of Mystery Science Theater 3000. A complete set consists of 118 cards, although many are duplicated.

name: Radio Questionaire
description:
"Label Registered U.S. Patent Off - Patent Applied For Copyright 1928 - Radio Questionaire Corp"

"A Mystifying - Educational Game"

Flashes the answer
-BY WIRELESS-
To Thousands of Questions

Players must answer questions given by cards placed in the box. By arranging the metal indicators, the correct answer can be determined by a small light lighting up when the answer has been chosen correctly.

What is most interesting is not that the device actually flashes the answer "by wireless", as displayed prominently in the name of the game and on the cover, but rather does so by simple electrical connections that are "hidden" underneath the platform that holds the dials.
categories: Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Kurier
description:
Each player is a special courier. While delivering the post to various locations by moving through the spaces on the gameboard, must also develop a modern communication system. The goal of the couriers is to fulfill orders quickly while using opportunities to better connect the modern world.

(attempt at translation from the rules)
Actually produced by ASSPromotions
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Swarm
description: Swarm, a game loosely based on the hierarchy of bees, is a simple yet very deep abstract strategy game for two players. The game play is somewhat like a cross between Go, Chess and Backgammon. Players may make multiple moves per turn (up to 12 when using dice). There are two ways to win the game. Players may move their opponent's pieces as well as their own. Players can re-claim captured pieces (when playing with dice). The game can also be played without dice as a pure abstract strategy game - suited to advanced players who are interested in a deeper more serious game. The depth in the game is partly due to the multiple move paradigm which means that the first players first turn has more than 10 million possibilities. See http://www.swarmboardgame.com for further details.

name: Schwarzwald Wanderung
description:
Who knows the Black Forest?
Move around the board visiting cloisters.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Pyramid Chess
description: This is a Chess variant that is played on a 3-dimensional board where each of the 4 levels decreases in size forming the shape of a pyramid.

name: KLM Cargo Game
description:
In July of 1985, KLM Cargo wrote a letter to prospective contestants for a promotional effort to identify their most valuable employee. This letter launched the first installment of the KLM Cargo Game. It was KLM's stated intent to provide a total of four installments of the game. Each installment would add pieces and a new line-up card. At the end of the promotion, the players would use the four "line-ups of suspects" to identify their favorite employee.

Regrettably, the one copy that I have seen contains only the materials from the first installment of the game. that installment contained the following components:


Game box and insert
Game board
Cover letter
KLM Cargo 'How to "Collar" a Suspect' guide (with the first 5 "suspects")
A sealed stack of play money
A sealed bag with 6 pawns and 1 die
A sealed stack of Chance cards
A sealed stack of Departure/Clearance cards


At the end of the promotion, the players were supposed to use the four "line-ups of suspects" (one per installment) to identify their favorite employee.

name: Chewzacookie
description:
"Chewzacookie" is a game that appeared as a two page magazine insert for McCalls magazine in September, 1964. Players draw punch-out cardboard chits (substituting for a 1-5 die roll), move their tokens around the board, and chow down on Nabisco cookies. The first player who reaches the end space by exact count gets the bank of five cookies -- one of each type shown in the game.

Some of the cookies featured may have undergone name changes and variant expansions, but they all remain in the Nabisco line: Vanilla Wafers, Nabisco Chocolate Chip Cookies, Fig Newtons, Oreos, and Lorna Doones.

There is no explicit rule declaring a winner. Presumably the winner is the player with the most cookies in hand (or consumed), but one might also assume that Nabisco wanted all the players to feel like winners for getting to eat their cookies. (Of course, the ultimate loser is the person who had to furnish all the cookies for the game!)

name: Mawari Shogi
description: This is a traditional Japanese children's game, played using the pieces and board from an ordinary Shogi set. It is a simple race game with each player taking a pawn and starting in the corner of the board. Pieces travel only on the outermost squares of the Shogi board in an anti-clockwise direction. Each time they pass their start corner, they can be promoted to the next higher piece. The first player to get promoted to King wins. An unusual feature is that the 'dice' are actually the four Gold General pieces. A player casts the four Gold Generals and moves according to how the pieces fall. If the piece falls with the calligraphy facing up, that counts as 1 square. If the piece lands on it's edge, that counts as 5 squares.

name: Force Intriguing Games
description:
This is a made-in-China variant of ludo in which players get 3 pieces and have to get them from their base to the central spot.
The number of spaces to move is much less than in ludo and there are spaces that might move the player's pieces forwards or backwards. Fairly nasty is the space on the home stretch that forces the piece to move backwards into the path of other pieces.
The game has a military theme and pieces are toy soldiers in different colours. I would guess that while each colour has 3 soldiers, the poses you get might vary from box to box.

name: Lernen Sie Die A-Klasse Kennen
description:
Not an easy solo game! The point is that a team of 4 members has to build the A-Class in exactly 60 time units. 6 components (the puzzle pieces) have to be brought from “B” to “A”. The team members need different lengths of time from “A” to “B”: 25, 20, 10 and 5 time units. The journey back from “A” to “B” takes the same amount of time. Two team members always have to go from “A” to “B” together. This costs the higher of the two time units. Each member is allowed to take one component with them. One of the two has to go back to “B”. The task is solved if all 6 components are brought from “B” to “A” in exactly 60 time units in this way. To measure time, use the timeline on the game board with the staff as a timer. Since the task is not easy to solve, there are two tips under the cardboard insert and - if these are still not enough - a complete solution.

A challenging puzzle for one person that is sure to cause some headaches if you can resist the temptation to read the tips and solution. A very attractive advertising game that is sure to enrich the collection of any lover of brain teasers!
mechanics: Solo / Solitaire Game, Stacking and Balancing
publishers: Mercedes Benz GmbH, Otto Maier Verlag

name: Kleiner Eisbär, auf in die Sonne!
description:
It's summer on the North Pole, and Lars and his friends are anjoying the sun. It gets rather crowded on the icebergs. Quite fast, some of the icebear friends glide down to the the water. But, with some skill you can help the friends get the best spot in the sun. This requires a steady hand, to place your cards firmly on the ice berg.

The game consists of a deck of cards, some counters and two icebergs (three dimensional cardboard stands). At the beginning of each game, each player receives a number of cards, of which three are face up. Each turn a player tries to get rid of one of his face up cards. This is done by placing the cards on one of the icebergs. How exactly the card is to be placed is determined by the animal depicted on the card. Some cards need to be placed against a side of the iceberg, others need to be on top, etc. In some cases, it is not the card that needs to be placed, but a cardboard counter (using the card as a tool).

If a player succeeds in placing his card, he draws a new card from his pile and puts it next to his other face up cards. However, if one or more cards fall down while he tries to place his cards, half of the cards that have fallen down are shuffled and put on his draw pile (the others are discarded).

The first player to get rid of all his cards wins the game.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Sensuous Exciting Experiences
description:
From the back of the box:

"SENSUOUS EXCITING EXPERIENCES is a board game unlike any game you have ever played. Spinning the spinner and rolling the die, both of you will engage in a broad range of loving and romantic activities as well as communicating with each other and sharing yourself with your partner. As you engage in each activity you will earn points towards the `Gift of Time.'"

Games are played to a time limit or point limit. Components include a large board, 2 pawns, a spinner, a die, and rules. The rules recommend a pencil & paper for keeping score, although you could probably make do with a permanent marker & an expanse of bare skin. Presumably you will also want a timer, as AP is likely to be a serious problem when your opponent gets a result such as "Wild time: Relax and enjoy anything your lover wants to do with you, for you, or to you for the next (number) minutes."

name: I'm Telling!
description:
Teams are made up of two children per team. One player is asked to write down one’s response to a question. The other player has the guess the first player’s response. Matching responses score. The team with the highest score after four questions plays the Pick-a-prize arcade round. In this round one teammate has to guess which five out of the ten prizes the other would like. Matching responses once again score.

The game is played again and the team with the highest score is the winner.

I’m Telling is a faithful translation of a short-lived television series.
categories: Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Future Tycoon
description:
How successful will you be in building your empire? The aim of Future Tycoon is to build a more valuable empire than your opponents. A player builds his or her empire by tabling cards, with the value of a player's empire being dependent on the number and layout of cards that player tables during the game. To maximise your empire you must use your investment chips to maximum effect.

Cards have region and industry types, cards must be linked to either the same region (vertically) or the same industry (horizontally). The more cards in a chain the higher the value.

A final element to the game are the Investment Chips. Each player has the same number of chips, each chip can either double one or more of your chains or halve the value of one or more of an opponents chains.

The winner is the person with the highest value totalling all region chains and industry chains.

name: Weltenbummler
description: Weltenbummler (World Travelers) is also a story-telling card game. A group of adventurers is headed on a trip around the world. But the interests of the various individuals are different. One wants to play sports, another the cultural sights, another just wants to lie in the sun while yet another wants to party. Occasionally, the group decides where to go next. And whoever sees everything first wins.

name: Campaign for Election
description: This is another roll-and-move election game. Components include cards for Votes, Contributions and Expenditures as well as cash (Campaign Checks) and a pair of +/- dice (3+ and 3- on each). Players start with 200 votes and $1,000 cash and roll for move order. First mover is the incumbent and rolls the +/- dice, winning or losing 100 votes. Players move around the track, getting or receiving money and winning, losing or breaking even on votes. The spaces that grant votes are sometimes optional usually require rolling the +/- dice to bet against the house or another player, with 2+ being a win, 2- a loss and 1/1 breaking even. Winner is the player to accumulate the most votes.

name: Master of Wars
description:
Players operate as two teams. Each team chooses one player to be the Master. There are three decks of playing cards: Land, Sea and Air. Each Master deals the opponents twenty cards from these decks. Each player arranges one’s own hand to one’s liking.

A player rolls the dice and moves one’s pawn to the space that will dictate one’s options for the turn. Whenever one is forced to battle, each player involved must reveal the top card of one’s battle deck and the player who shows the higher valued number is the winner.

The game continues one team’s marker flags control six of the eleven city/states on the world map.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: Manche mögen's heiß
description: In english : "Some like it hot"

name: FoodSmarts
description: FoodSmarts offers food lovers a fun, engaging way to learn about tasty items that appear on even the most complicated restaurant menus. This box of one hundred question and answer cards and FoodTips guide, cooks up useful, fun and interesting facts about food, from popcorn to pot au feu, helping you to stare down the most snooty waiter or unusual vegetable in the market. FoodSmarts can be played as a social dinner party game, or can be used alone as an adult version of flashcards

name: People Are Funny
description:
Players form teams of any number of players. One member of the team takes one card from each of four decks to determine the situation to performed before and guessed by the teammates. An example of a situation is “I am a brave – dentist – and I eat spaghetti – like a left-handed motorcycle cop.” If the teammates can guess the situation within a two-minute time limit the team scores the value of cards drawn.

The team with the most points after a number of rounds wins.

The game is loosely based on the long-running radio and television series.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Studs
description:
Based on the short-lived syndicated 1991-93 dating/game show hosted by Mark DeCarlo of the same name, ideally played with three females and two males (all of whom have dated each other) and an emcee. The host asks the female players intimate questions about relationships away from the males, who must guess the responses later. The male who scores the most points after three rounds of play, kept track of by heart-shaped stickers, is declared the winner.

Studs had the honor of being a (very brief) target during Johnny Carson's final monologue, which he did in 1993 during a Bob Hope birthday celebration while discussing the evolution of television. In 2006, when Game Show Network aired its series of the 50 Greatest Game Shows, the inclusion of Studs as #47 (despite not showing any footage) led to flabbergasted game show fans calling it Freaking Studs and wondering how it could have possibly ranked higher than Blockbusters and Treasure Hunt; while far from the only shocker of that series, it's the only one relevant to this entry.
categories: Humor, Mature / Adult, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Tunisie, la belle
description: A Rummy-like game where one collects sets or runs of cards depicting the various administrative units of Tunesia. The winner is the one with the least points, points being awarded for cards left in your hand when one player goes out.

name: Qualifying for the World
description: Player must qualify four horses by winning all six ribbons at the qualifying horse shows. Players move horses around the board by the roll of the dice winning ribbons by passing squares of that ribbon. Before starting, players must color their horses with the colored pencils supplied with the game.

name: Pyradrafts
description:
An abstract strategy game.

The players take it in turns to place their 7 marbles onto the board. The object of the game is to either take all their marbles by jumping them (as in draughts or checkers) or by making a line (of your own marbles) which is either 4 marbles across the base of the triangle, 5 marbles from the apex of the triangle to its base, or 6 marbles across the middle of the board.

The box claims this is "An Exciting Alternative To Drafts", presumably this is a misspelling of draughts.

name: Murder Mystery Party: Intrigue At Sparkling Water
description: In this entry to the Murder Mystery Party series the player/detectives try to solve the murder of Jacob Hart. The rich industrialist and water baron was found dead slumping in his office chair. He was apparently murdered with his own rifle. Why was he shot? Everyone loved old Jake...or did they?

name: Wild Wild West
description:
Very rare game based on the 1960's television series.

The game had a mechanic similar to pool to simulate a shootout, where one would attempt to shoot a marble through a gate. Players have a limited supply of "bullets" and targets are chosen by rolling a die.
categories: American West, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Ahriman
description:
A game between dreams and reality

The King of the Darkness, Ariman, reigns with dark power over a mysterious fairyland. Who can free this enslaved country?

Four heroes are ready for the adventure, but they must first grow to master the difficult task. They travel to the Fire Spirits, Nixies, Elves and Dwarfs. After telepathic tests, they will become master of the four elements. Armed with this magic, they will enter the realm of darkness, to defeat Ahriman.

However, before they come that far, they need to defend themselves against many unknown dangers and to respond to unexpected calls for help. In the meantime, Ahrimans powers will dwindle. Only with harmonic cooperation can the players succeed in defeating Ahriman.

name: Die Wendeltreppe
description:
A self-experience game for children and adults with tarot and oracle elements

This game is a travel through the inner self. In this game, you are made aware of your experiences by means of the symbolicism of a fairy tale. The inner spaces of the conscious and unconscious self are represented as different storeys in a big house. The levels, from the deepest cellar to the attic symbolise the different levels of consciousness.

On the way up, a players will encounter different archetypical persons, who represent different sides from his personality. Those are the fairy-tale characters who live in the house. Connected to these characters - Dwarf. Witch, Prince, Princess, Giant, Queen and King - are different feelings. The persons will ask questions connected to such feelings.

Interaction between players occurs when the answer a player gives is not the answer others think he ought to give - in other words, when someone perceives himself different from how others perceive him. This should lead to a discussion to find the true answer (and the true personality).

Allthough the actual game is a race to the attic, this interaction between players is the most important part of the game. Discovery of self and development of social actions is the main goal of the game.

name: Love U
description:
This is one of three games in Kosmos new “Freche Madchen – freche Spiele” (Sassy Girls – Sassy Games) line, based on line of successful books called ‘Sassy girls – Sassy Books’ of which more than 50 titles have already been released.

Love U is a fast-paced search game based on text messages.

name: Liebe, Jungs & Mädchenträume
description:
This is one of three games in Kosmos new “Freche Madchen – freche Spiele” (Sassy Girls – Sassy Games) line, based on line of successful books called ‘Sassy girls – Sassy Books’ of which more than 50 titles have already been released.

Liebe, Jungs & Madchentraume (Love, Boys and Girls’ Dreams) is a party game.

name: Explore India
description:
From Rules:
For the Parent/Teacher
Explore India is a challenging and enjoyable game that rouses and develops the exploratory instincts inherent in every child. While the child plays the game, he/she explores India as well as her neighbourhood. He learns the basics of Geography. He also learns the basic skills that are needed to read and understand any map. This action-oriented game makes the child realize that exploring India can be a rewarding as well as a pleasant experience.

name: Geocards
description:
A geography card game which allows a world map to be built in hundreds of different way.
Each player adds a card from his hand to the map on the board. If a player cannot add to the map he draws a card. Game ends when one player runs out of cards.

name: The Game of Karate
description: Each player draws two cards at a time from the deck. If they match his suit, he may place them on the board. If they do not match his suit, he discards them. He continues his turn until he cannot play a card to the board. If a Dragon card is drawn, he may continue his turn, even if the dragon is not in his suit. If he draws a Karate card, he can place it on his Karate spot or call 'Karate,' and place it on another player's cards, and force that person to discard all his cards from the board. First player to fill his cards on the board wins.

name: Social Disorder
description:
From the West End Games online catalog.

Social Disorder a fast-paced card game designed for three to six players, simulates the uncertain world of high-school social groups. Each card represents a student in a clique, such as the Lunch-Stealer Bully, the Goth Burn-Out, and the Gamer Geek. Social Disorder combines the trick-based play of classic games such as Spades and Hearts with a twist: Each player has a hidden rule, which can affect all other players. Is the suit order reversed for this hand? Can the same player not win two tricks in a row? Can you force two players to swap hands? Only you know what your rule is, and you can choose whether or not to enforce it. And, just like high school, no one knows all the rules.

Designed by three-time Origins-Award-winner Steven Marsh, Social Disorder takes about an hour to play per game. It comes with everything you need except friends ... just like high school.

name: Train Raider: Europe Expansion
description:
An expansion that can be played using components of the base game (Train Raider). The expansion includes a map of Europe, 36 Event Cards, 34 Mission Cards, and 40 Train Cards.

Expands:

Train Raider
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Trains, Transportation
mechanics: Crayon Rail System, Pick-up and Deliver

name: 40 Master Composers
description:
This game contains cards for 40 composers from Bach to Weber. Each card has a picture of the composer and 5 questions relating to their life and work.

Each player is dealt 4 cards and the rest are left aside. Next, players get a 2 minute study period to look over their cards. When the two minutes is up, the dealer calls out "Pass." Each player passes their cards to the right. After the pass, the dealer asks the player on their left any question from any of the cards in their hand. If the player answers correctly, they are given the card, which they place face up in front of them (scoring it). If the answer is wrong, the dealer scores the card by placing it face up. Then, the player to the left of the dealer asks a question of the player to their left and so on around the table.

After all players have a chance to ask and answer a question, scores are tallied. The cards in play are then shuffled and placed on the bottom of the deck and 4 new cards are dealt to each player.

The player with the highest score at the end of all of the deals wins.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Memory, Music, Trivia

name: Dice Time!
description: A variation of "BUNCO!", but more intended for a larger crowd, with this! There are to be '3' sets of 4-Players per 'Table' of which there are 3-kinds of these: "Low"; "Medium"; and "High", with the people sitting opposite from each other as 'Partners'. Following the more traditional 'scoring' and "round robin" procedures for "BUNCO!", while this uses '3'-Dice(d6) per 'Table'. Here's what you get for components: the "Bell"; '9'-Dice(d6) of 3-Sets of various colors; a pouch to hold the DICE; a 'Scoring' pad; the "Rules"; and the BOX for them all.

name: Culture Crash
description:
From the box:

What happens when a couple of unrelated things slam into each other? You chuckle out loud...but not 'til after you figure out what brought them together in the first place! It's always a race against time in this hysterical game where pop culture collides with silliness! Put on your helmet and buckle up - Culture Crash is a wild ride!

An example of one of the clues and answer from the box:

clue: A button beside a house entrance...meets...flared pants...

answer: Door BELL Bottoms

name: Alfons Åberg Lotto
description:
Alfons Åberg Lotto are two games.
One is a game where you get a tile with Alfons Åberg figures, and you should match the tiles you turn up on the table with your tile. The first to complete the tile is the winner.

The other game is more a memory game where you should try to collect the figures that is on your tile. A mix game between memory and bingo. The one who has completed the tile first is the winner.

name: Jestedibles
description:
JestEdibles: A fun game to test your knowledge of nutrition!Ages 12 and Up
For 2 to 12 Players

Contents: 1 game board, 4 game pieces, 1 dice, 62 playing cards, 1 instruction sheet and 1 study guide.
Approximate playing time 20-30 minutes.

name: Number Quest
description:
"The Ultimate Number Game"

Number Quest plays sort of like Boggle crossed with Othello/Reversi; this game is essentially a number version of its cousin, Overturn. The playing board is a plastic tray into which nine tiles (from a set of eighteen) are placed in a random order. Each tile has four raised pegs on it, each with a different digit (from 0-9) printed on it. On their turn, each player must construct an equation by selecting at least three adjacent digits (digits may be adjacent both orthogonally and diagonally) that form a valid equation when the proper operational symbols are added (i.e. 347 becomes 3+4=7, 9752149 becomes 97+52=149, 678234444 becomes 678-234=444, etc.) Only addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division are allowed. No fractions or decimals are permitted. Equations must follow normal sequence (i.e. 97+52=149 is valid; 149=97+52 isn't)and may not contain more than one operation (i.e. 4-1-2=2 is not valid.) A given digit may not be used more than once in the same equation, and equations must make use of the digits on at least two separate tiles. 0 may never appear by itself in an equation (i.e. 4+0=4 and 5-5=0 are invalid.) The equation is claimed by placing plastic rings of the player's chosen color (either green or gold) around the pegs of the digits forming the equation. After the first player's first turn, all subsequent turns must use at least one previously used number. If necessary, the player forming the equation flips over the ring so used (rings are gold on one side and green on the other), a la Othello/Reversi. The game ends when all 36 rings have been used, or when no more equations are possible. Players then score one point for each ring of their color. Player with the most points is the winner. Although Number Quest is essentially a two player game, more can be accommodated by forming teams.

name: Phoenix Scene
description:
A Monopoly-like game set in Phoeniz, Arizona. From the instructions:

The excitement of business wheelings and dealings in a fast rising metropolitan area, a thrilling tour of the local night spots, romps in the great outdoors, and desert beauty- all part of the Phoenix Scene.

Have you ever wanted to own and run American Express, the Arizona Biltmore, or run Greyhound Bus Lines? Now is your chance by playing Phoenix Scene

- You will buy and sell your favorite local properties
- You will become either the Republic & Gazette Publisher, a Civic leader, an influential politician or attorney
- Bargain with the other players to receive a "Connection Card" which will permit you to develop your properties and thereby collected increased rent.

The object is to accumulate the most wealth
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Travelon: The Unique Game of Canadian Travel & Trivia
description:
From rules:
Beginning in a city of your choice, you will visit each of ten cities across the country and return home. The winner will be that player (or team) who arrives back home first. Shrewd choices as to your mode of travel (subject to weather of course) as well as the number of questions you will purchase are essential as you must return home with enough cash to buy your game winning question.

name: Samurai Wars
description: Heroic Skirmish Combat in the age of the Shoguns. Contains rules for Samurai Heroes, Ronin, Ashigaru, Peasants and even the Portugese. A Listing of personalities to populate games, clan leaders, Ikko-Ikki warrior monks, female Samurai, even Jesuits and the captain of the Black Ship.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Tank War: Expansion A
description:
An expansion for Tank War containing 52 data cards.This set contains information on most American vehicles and different types of infantry that were involved in World War II.

Expands:

Tank War
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Planetarium
description: A wooden board represents the solar system; a series of shallow indentations is used to indicate the path of each planet. Some of these spaces are also used for the path of a dangerous comet. Each player is dealt three cards, each listing a different planet. This determines which pieces that player is allowed to move. On each turn, the current player moves one planet (represented by a magnetic marble) one space, then rolls an eight-sided die and moves the comet (represented by a ball bearing) that number of spaces. If magnetism causes two planets to collide, both are destroyed; if the comet hits a planet, the planet is destroyed but the comet remains. When a planet completes its orbit unscathed, its controller gets to draw a new card. At the end of the game, when all planets are orbited or destroyed, the player who successfully completed the most orbits wins.

name: Roller Derby
description:
From the rules:
'Roller Derby takes on all the excitement of the real sport. Each manager has a team forming a "Pack". This team has four players and one "Jammer".

All players on a team wear the same colour.

The game board contains a unique mechanism that causes the skaters to move side to side in a realistic way. Once the board has started to rotate, the action becomes hectic, with each player trying to get his "Jammer" through the "Pack".

The "Jammer" is a single man with a magnet in the colored base. This man is controlled by a "Jammer Stick" of the same color. The "Jammer Stick" is held under the skating surface and engages the same color "Jammer" above. By skilfully using the "Jammer Stick", that player can be guided through the moving "Pack". The "Jammer Stick" will not control the opponent's color "Jammer".'

Object is to be the first to guide the "Jammer" through the "Pack" to score the most points.
1. 25 points or more in one game
2. A match of five games (each consisting of 25 points).

name: College-opoly
description: COLLEGE-OPOLY, all the fun of a traditional property trading game – with some MAJOR twists! Get it…MAJOR? Is this thing on? In COLLEGE-OPOLY players encounter college life scenarios such as increased tuition, bad dates, crazy prof’s, and FLUNKING OUT! It’s just like college – it just doesn’t take as long to finish! Players collect student stereotypes, earn credit hours and trade them in for diplomas. In College-opoly, the students earn more money when they have a diploma-just like the real world, right? So roll the dice and get your game on! You might become Homecoming queen…or you may end up guzzling caffeine as you pull an all-nighter! Experience college life at its craziest! The Five custom pewter player’s tokens include a Slice of Pizza, Gym Shoe, Graduation Cap, Bicycle, and a Can of Soda. For 2-5 players, ages 8 and up.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: UConnopoly
description:
The Game Includes:

Tokens:
Gym Shoe, Graduation Cap, Alarm Clock, #2 Pencil, Bicycle

Board Spaces:
Arjona Building, Gampel Pavilion, The Rock, Jonathan

Cards:
All Campus Party! All tokens advance to Gilbert Road.

20 degrees below zero in Storrs, CT! The token of your choice is frozen for two turns.

Uconn vs Yale! Advance to Memorial Stadium. Go Huskies!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: AlgarveOpoly
description:
ALGARVEOPOLY is concerned with business trade in the Algarve. The object of the game is to accumulate as much wealth as possible through the purchase, trade and development of businesses - the businesses themselves representing actual firms on the Island or town.

It has the following features:

- Businesses to buy, trade and sell.
- A £500 ‘Loan Card’ for each player, ‘Get Out of Jail’ in another game.
- The ability (once you own all the key businesses in a color group) to expand by building shops and superstores. Though you wouldn’t guess that from the counters!
- Castelo de Silves - a place where you get sent when you have failed to pay your bills - though you are able to visit if you happen to pass by.
- The BUPA International Square, where you gain £200 by passing through. Not in the usual position of one of the corner squares, but two squares after the Start.
- 21"Take A Break" and 21"Good News/ Bad News" cards.
- Mortgages
- Gritter Golf Sponsored Free Parking.

- ... and many more.

Box Description : Watercolor Algarve houses "Albufeira" Ken Mosley
Board Description : Beach watercolor "Ferragudo" Ken Mosley
Year of Manufacture : 1998
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding, Trading

- Survival Zone Sponsored Free Parking.

- ... and many more.

Box Description : Sketch of Pirate ship off Gibraltar
Board Description : Crude Painting of Gibraltar Harbour and Rock.
Year of Manufacture : 1996
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding, Trading

name: This Is Your Lucky Day
description: A game based loosely on the Candybar Game. In this game the players have cards in their hands and are trying to be the last player to hold the card titled "This is your Lucky day!" Cards allow you to view a player's hand, take, or trade cards. Don't get stuck with the cards titles "This is not your Lucky day."
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Memory, Party Game

name: TorbayOpoly
description:
TORBAYOPOLY is concerned with business trade in Torbay, Brixhan, Paignton. The object of the game is to accumulate as much wealth as possible through the purchase, trade and development of businesses - the businesses themselves representing actual firms on the Island or town.

It has the following features:

- Businesses to buy, trade and sell.
- A £500 ‘Loan Card’ for each player, ‘Get Out of Jail’ in another game.

- 21"Take A Break" and 21"Go for the Gamble" cards.

- ... and many more.

Box Description : Harbour painting showing trams on Torbay harbour
Board Description : Torbay harbour
Year of Manufacture : 1997
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Auction
description: Not to be confused with the 3M/AH game "Auction". Cheap looking, low budget bookshelf game of bidding and buying (as it says on the box). Very similar in mechanic and feel to 3M's Auction, though I'm not sure which came first.

name: Max Steel
description: A boardgame based on the Max Steel property. Released only in Latin America.

name: The Champagne Game
description:
A Game of LIFE, LOVE, ROMANCE and CHAMPAGNE!!!

A romantic game for two, where you learn more about your partner... and even more about your self!

The board is 48 pieces which when put together form the shape of a champagne bottle. "Champagne" pieces run down the centre and each time you remove on of these, you drink champagne! But pieces to the left and right must first be removed to release the "Champagne" tiles and these can only be removed by players appropriate responses to the instructions on the cards. On the basis of TRUTH, CORRECTNESS and SATISFACTION. Your responses will be assessed by your partner. Play continues from the "cork" to the "bottle".

Players may be asked to:

Answer questions,
Give an opinion,
Discuss their inner feelings,
Perform small acts of love,
Examine their likes and dislikes,
Drink Champagne
and more....

This game is a powerful recipe for a romantic makeover, guaranteed to keep that spark glowing bright....

name: Blow Your Nose
description: "Instant fun game which can be played at home, in the bar, in the office - anywhere" This addictive, cult game, originally designed for children but quickly hi-jacked by adult game fanatics as a table-top, bar and party game, is now available with DRINKING RULES. The game is simply played by blowing your 'noses' through a series of numbered hoops, the rules being similar to the game of croquet, but it is not as easy as it seems.

name: Wine Knot
description:
A very old nautical drinking game, playable in 8 x variations. The games in 'Wine Knot' are variations of old nautical drinking games, believed to have been originated by Portuguese sailors involved in the notorious 'triangular trade' of the 18th century where wine and textiles were shipped to Africa, traded for slaves who were then shipped to the Americas, the ships returning to Europe with cargoes of molasses and tobacco. Long periods at sea and wine in abundance, diversions were created using the materials at hand; wood, canvas and rope.

There are eight games to be played, which will provide interesting, unusual and amusing entertainment for up 8 players for as many hours as you wish.
Port wine was originally used but because of its strength an ordinary (or extraordinary) bottle of red or white wine will ensure that the game does not finish too early.

name: Postmans' Promise
description:
"A very sexy party game for 4 - 24 players"Fate decides WHO does WHAT, WHERE and with WHOM. A sexy game of chance, based loosely on the old favorite Postman's Knock. You may have to "squeeze and kiss passionately" for "2 minutes" in the "bathroom, in the shower (water optional) - lights off" with mystery person "number 9".

This game is not "X" rated but should only be played by broad minded people as a degree of intimacy is required.

name: Tarts 'N' Vicars
description: As well as being a fun game and a sexy game this is also a drinking game. The object of the game is simply to get to Heaven (when the required numbers of Halos have been acquired.) You must avoid the Deadly sins and other temptations along the way, and in particular, avoid going to jail and/ or taking the Slippery Slope to Hell.

name: The Big Breakfast Game
description:
THE BIG BREAKFAST GAME is a 60 or 90 minute (dependant on the number of players) themed on the UK Channel 4 TV Series The Big Breakfast.

The board is divided into 8 areas which are visited by the players based on spinning the spinner. On arriving at the designated area players have to complete an activity in a manner similar to the items featured on the TV show:

SNAP CACKLE POP - A memory game in which players have 30 seconds to memorise 14 items on a list and a further 30 seconds to recall them.

WHOSE WASHING LINE - The player has to guess the identity of someone from clues read from a card.

ON THE BED - A player must convey the identity of someone to the other players without using any of the words written on the card.

ONE LUMP OR TWO - A drawing game in which players try to reproduce the picture on a card with their eyes shut.

THE CRUNCH - Players perform silly actions as described on a card.

DOWN YOUR DOORSTEP - Players must guess where they are from the description on the card.

EGG ON YOUR FACE - Players must mime or impersonate the individual on the card for 30 seconds.

INVENTION CORNER - Players must attempt to answer general knowledge questions.

Points, in the form of breakfast items (sausage, tea, marmalade, egg, toast ...) are awarded for succesful completion of activities. After a predetermined time (60 minutes for 4 or less players, 90 for 5 or 6 players) the game ends. The winner is the player with the biggest breakfast (i.e. the one with the greatest number of points).
categories: Action / Dexterity, Humor, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Memory, Paper-and-Pencil, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Ferienspiel Jungfrauregion
description:
FERIENSPIEL JUNGFRAUREGION is a Swiss game that has more than a little of Monopoly about it.

Players progress around the board according to die rolls. When landing on property squares players hae the option of electing to purchase them from the bank, though larger properties cannot be purchased until the three smaller properties in the same set (of four) have been sold. As in Monopoly other players landing on property that you own have to pay a charge.

Random elements are thrown in through squirrel and clover cards which are generally of the go to..., pay the bank..., get from the bank... type.

2,000 Fr are received for passing through square 70 (not START), but the principle is the same.

There are no houses or hotels to buy, but fimilair rules for mortgages, credit and bankrupcy apply.

The winner is the player, who after two hours (or other pre-determined limit) has the most money (cash and property less bank loans).
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Justice League Unlimited Champion Checkers
description:
This is the game of checkers with superheroic powers. Each side has 7 superheroes among their checkers: Superman, Wonder Woman, Batman, Hawkgirl, Green Lantern, Martian Manhunter, and The Flash.

There are 3 variants descibing how to use these powers: one has them activating powers once they are kinged, another has the superheroes open to both players, and the last has all the checkers shielded, like in Stratego so you don't know which of your opponents' checkers is which.

name: Zebra Zucht
description:
Zebrazucht.

Northern Germany

The year is 2119. Global warming has pushed northern Europe’s yearly average temperature to 27.7 C. The sale and breeding of exotic animals is one of the fastest growing businesses in the world. Breeding in captivity has become a necessity for the survival of most of the species existing 30 degrees longitude north and south of the equator. This massive area is so hot and dry that the remaining animals are simply fighting for survival and have no energy left for breeding. A massive movement to save these animals from extinction and the preservation of a living gene pool for genetic engineering has become the focus of many different organizations around the world.

Schleswig Holstein is the world leader in the art of genetically engineering exotic animals. They are highlighting and creating new traits in animals. Zebrazucht is a clinical experiment by two of the leading companies in the field of Genetics. One company genetically stripped male Zebras of most white coloration. The second company was able to genetically create female Zebras to be void of most of their black pigmentation. This six-year-old project is now in its final stages and the animals are being brought together for the first time in the height of mating season. A special breeding facility was created to accommodate the project.

Players take on the role of scientists from both companies trying to bring as many pairs together as possible. The calculated end result should produce offspring Zebras that revert back to a more brilliantly stripped black and white color. If things go wrong the offspring might be hard to distinguish if placed amongst Holstein cows.

In this two-player game players move two workers towards each other and place a fence of their colour in that space.
Once a player has four fences of his color surrounding a corral that player places his Zebra in the space.The person opening the most corrals to unite black & white Zebras wins.
mechanics: Enclosure, Pattern Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Tile Placement

name: The Bill
description:
THE BILL - A game to beat all others is described as "an exciting chase game where you start as a humble Bobby onthe Beat and compete with the other players to become Superintendent."

The game is loosely based on the Thames Television (UK) police series, but is different from the other game on the database of the same name which is also based on the same TV series.

Players take it in turns to roll a die and move their police car marker round the board. The square landed on will be of three types:

"Incident" - follow the instructions on the square.

"Hello, hello, hello" - draw a card from the appropriate deck. These are general knowledge questions on various criminal and legal subjects as well as general police procedures. Successfully answering of the question will allow for advancement or the avoidance of a penalty.

"In Court" - draw a from the appropriate deck. These will involve certain skills (observation, memory, impersonation etc.) and will usually result in moving forwards, backwards or missing a turn.

At various places on the board there is the opportunity for promotion (and also demotion). The winner is the first person to do their time by passing the golden handcuffs square on the inner ring twice, to become the all powerful Superintendent.

name: Nebula Raiders
description: This low-complexity science fiction simulation game was distributed online in printable electronic format. Players move their spacecraft around on a hex grid representing an unstable region of space. Their objective is to collect a full cargo load of valuable "pseudo plasma" and return home. This is complicated by two factors: everyone is armed with blasters, and the turbulent nebula causes random movement and damage to ships. In addition to using counters to represent ships and potential hotspots on the mapboard, each player also has a status card where additional counters track ship system condition and repair status. Optional rules are included for sensor probes, ship enhancement, team play and a few other add-ons.

name: Q.A.X.
description:
Interesting stock-market & trading game for 2-4 players. Make the most profits by buying, selling and clever, tactical moving and trading!

Each player tries to earn the most money by moving his pieces around the board, buying shares and attacking other players (to get shares of stock from him.) After each move, players can trade shares of stock to earn money. The first player to gain a certain amount of money (based on the number of players) wins.

http://www.printgames.net/english/detail_e/qax.htm

name: Chipco Chess
description:
Chipco Chess takes the basic movement rules of chess and adds wargame-style combat rules.

Outcomes are no longer certain because of the use of a d10. Chipco Chess is not solve-able, in the sense of standard chess, since thinking ahead is not possible. Players of all abilities have a more equal chance of winning the game.

Chipco Chess is played using a standard board with either chess pieces or wargame bases.

Variants are included that tailor the game to certain periods:

Ancient/Fantasy
Crusades/Medieval
Samurai
American Civil War
categories: American Civil War, Ancient, Fantasy, Medieval

name: Treasure Trail
description: Race for riches in this gold gathering game! The object if the game is to be the first player to collect 4 different types of treasure n their chest and take it back to the boat.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Jasper Memo
description: This is one of three children’s games featuring the friendly penguin Jasper, that every child knows from the german TV program “Sendung mit der Maus”. The little penguin is always curious and discovers our world.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: DRG: Das Spiel – Ausgabe Innere Medizin 2005
description:
DRG - Das Spiel - Ausgabe Innere Medizin 2005 (DRG - The Game - 2005 Internal Medicine Edition) by Jurgen Junghandel is a bluffing card game about the new accounting methods used in German hospitals (DRG stands for Die Riesige Gemeinheit, or The Huge Injustice). The game was released last year in a Neurology edition, but was completely reworked for this year. What’s it all about?

The game casts players as doctors doing their bookkeeping. They have to make sure that the numbers work out as much in their favour as possible – they can leave the cases that will incur huge costs to their colleagues. Cases are laid out – a primary diagnosis and a face-down ‘waiting’ card which eventually becomes a secondary diagnosis. Depending on the difficulty level of the secondary diagnoses, a table defines the value that the primary diagnosis will have in this case. This value can be changed by other players by playing out ‘on call’ cards. The next player tries to capture the trick by playing out a case with a higher value. When scoring, the ‘waiting’ card for each case is turned over separately and the value adjusted for a long or short waiting time. The costs are tabulated and the gains recorded. Over the course of the game, ‘after months’ cards can also be played that can ruin the best cases.

name: Chester County Game
description: This Monopoly clone features locations in Chester County, Pennsylvania. Property cards are printed with advertisements by local businesses and organizations. The game features an equine theme -- all playing pieces are colored horses, and wooden "stalls" and "stables" take the place of houses and hotels. The game also adds a trivia element -- the ARC and United Ways cards (which replace Chance and Community Chest) feature trivia questions in addition to the usual instructions. Players may choose to ask these questions of their opponents -- if anyone answers correctly, they win $50 from the bank; otherwise, the player asking the question wins the money. Apart from these and a few other minor differences, the game plays like its more famous inspiration.
publishers: Association for Retarded Citizens, Chester County Chapter

name: Battle Cells Game Cards
description:
A strategy game on immunology and microbiology, the game includes two decks of 40 cards each. One is the pathogen deck and the other is the immunity system deck. Players can choose to attack or defend, and the first player whose deck is exhausted or who runs out of immunity points loses the game.

Called Battle Cells Game Cards, the cards do not involve mystical beings or suits like diamonds and spades.
.Instead, they are adorned with pictures of viruses, pathogens and pills, along with facts and the classification of the each organism.
