An elements of tactics is introduced with the experiment cards which can either boost your own experiments or interfere with those of other players. Play of one of these experiment cards is the mechanic that causes the game to end.

name: Grid Master
description: Grid Master is played with a 1d30 on two separate boards. Players monitor the control of territory on the first gameboard and monitor the influence on territory on the second gameboard. The first player to position an army in five consecutive territories in a straight line wins the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Melt Some Plastic
description:
A tactical waragame using plastic toy soldiers and some home-made maps.

Rules available at:

http://www.freewebs.com/xxkalciferxx/wargamerules.htm
categories: Modern Warfare, Wargame, World War II

name: Musical Assassins
description:
A party game for large groups.

Players stand together. Each player secretly chooses someone to be his Bodyguard and a different player to be his Assassin. When the moderator starts playing music, each player moves and jostles about in an attempt to keep his Bodyguard positioned between he and his Assassin. When the moderator stops the music, everyone freezes. If a given player's Assassin can see the player without interference, the Assassin shoots him.

Inspired by a popular improv activity.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Humor, Murder/Mystery, Music, Party Game, Spies/Secret Agents

name: Explore-A-Saur
description:
From the publisher:

EXPLORE-A-SAUR Game and Book Set
Thinking & Problem Solving, Social & Emotional

It's a totally prehistoric experience! Read the book to learn fascinating dinosaur facts, then answer questions about dinos on the quiz cards. Realistically detailed dinosaur figures - each identified on its base - are great for creating scenarios or playing the enclosed game. Game board is 16" x 16" (28cm x 28cm) Includes 16 plastic dinosaur figures, 36 quiz cards and 4 game pieces.

From 6 years & up

name: Let's Go Apple Picking Math
description:
A game to help children get an introduction to math.

Each player has an apple collecting basket and a tree shaped game card. Each game card starts with 10 apple chips on the tree.

Players each roll the three dice. The two red dice are standard D6 dice. The green die indicated a "+" or "-" symbol. The player who rolled the dice must answer the math problem provided by the symbols showing. If they answer the math problem correctly, he/she takes one apple from their game card and places it in their basket. If they answer the math problem incorrectly he/she must take an apple out of the basket .

Turns continue until a player picks all their apples from their tree to win the game.

name: Mein Hühnerhof
description: Up to 4 players run a chicken farm - breeding, feeding, growing - players try to simulate a good working farm.

name: Yarbles
description: This is a 3 player game with a variant for 2 players. The object of the game is to move your fighters and messengers around their designated routes to "home". The player to get all of his Yarbles men in home first is the winner.

name: The Safety Card Game
description: Couldn't tell too much from the box - appears to be a memory/trivia game that helps kids learn about important safety facts like poisons and crossing the street. Geared (per the box) at kids age 3 to 9.

name: Be an Angel
description: This game is a religious take on Old Maid where the player with the last card is an Angel. The game comes with a unique 31 card deck where the cards represent things from well-known Bible stories.

name: Cartel: A Game for Real Estate Tycoons
description:
Yet another game named "Cartel". Cartel is extremely similar to Monopoly in that you spin a spinner to move one to six spaces, visiting different countries (Australia, Belgium, Canada, Denmark, England, France, Germany, Holland, Italy, U.S.A.) on the board. You may purchase properties in the different countries. If you land on a country with an opponent's properties, you must pay rent to that player. Some facets of Cartel that contrast it from Monopoly are as follows:


Each player may have houses in no more than five countries.
There are no blocks of properties: Each country has one space on the board.
Once you land on a country space, you spin a spinner to determine whether you may build a house, may not build a house, or may build a house for free.
If you land on Try Your Luck, you spin the Lucky Spin spinner, and win money from the bank or lose money to the pool. If your spin showed LUCKY POOL, you get the money in the pool.

name: Wiglin'
description: You attempt to repeat what is shown on cards; these are intended to be funny movements. Essentially the game was designed to be an ice breaker and not as contorting (is that a word?) as something like Twister, Very silly graphics...

name: Dix Petits Indiens
description:
DIX PETITS INDIENS is a French game based on the murder mystery novel by Agatha Christie in which ten people on an island get murdered by 10 different methods.

The game board represents the island with the locations of where the 10 bodies can be found. The 10 characters are represented on 10 red cards and the 10 methods of death by
10 blue cards. These are shuffled and placed face down on the 10 red and blue spaces on the outside of the board.

When it is his turn a player can (and must) carry out one of the following three actions:

1. Simultaneously turn over one red and one blue card. Look at their contents (in secret) and then return them face down to the spaces from which they came.

2. Move his playing piece along one yellow line to a neighboring black or red space.

3. Write down on a record sheet any information concerning the cards turned over in previous rounds.

The idea of the game is for players to work out where the matching red and blue cads are located and then move their playing piece to the appropriate location on the board to 'discover the body' (by turning over the two matching cards). Successfully doing this earns the player one of 10 "little Indians". Making a mistake means the player loses his next two turns.

The game ends when all 10 bodies have been discovered, with the winner being the player that discovered the majority of them.

name: Democracy
description:
Democracy: The Working of the Legislative Process

Democracy is actually three games in one. The game is ment to be played in a classroom environment. The first game is the Legislative Session, where players get to act roles and votes in the legislative process. Game two is "Citizen's Action Meeting" where the players take roles of citizens and their actions towards compelling the representatives. The third game is "Representative Democracy" which covers the voting and representative system.

The game contains many worksheets, petitions, cards and player aids.
publishers: Academic Games Associates, Western Publishing Company

name: Montecassino
description:
ARGENTINIAN MADE AND DESIGNED BOARD GAME.
a miniatures war world two board game recreating the battle of MONTECASSINO (near Rome, Italy) between the Germans and Americans. 24 soldiers for each player..and a CANNON in bronze which adds special power to each player..
a strategic tactical game for 2 - 4 wargamers
categories: Action / Dexterity, Miniatures, World War II
publishers: V & V ingenio en juegos- argentina

name: Spots
description:
Simple memory-based game variant. Cardboard discs ('spots'), each with a certain word printed on one side, are placed face down on the gameboard. Each spot has a matching card which forms a pair; these cards are shuffled and form the draw pile for gameplay.

A turn consists of drawing a card and finding the matching spot on the gameboard. Unmatched cards are placed face up in front of the drawer until the appropriate match is made. Cards may be taken either from the draw pile, from in front of an opponent or from in front of the drawing player. The player with the most matching pairs when all spots have been removed from the board is the winner.

The game has a garage theme tacked on rather loosely - the 'spots' are representative of spots found on a garage floor and many of the words on the discs relate to this theme - dirty spot, wet spot, danger spot, grease spot etc. The gameboard is the garage floor.
publishers: John Sands Pty Ltd, Milton Bradley

name: Combinatorix
description:
Features 17 multi-player games. Four years in development, this set is also a resource for tessellations and explorations of geometric plane tiling.

Contains 512 wood tiles: Squares, equilateral triangles, hexagons, and isosceles right triangles have 1" unit sides, are 1/4" thick, and in four colors. Includes three large vinyl game grids and 3 books for competitive, solo and cooperative activities. Comes in a wood chest, 26" x 14" x 3".

For 1 to 27 players, ages 6 to adult.
mechanics: Enclosure, Modular Board, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Autoweek Trivia Game
description: Automotive world trivia game. Roll and move around a short race track, answering questions about Races and Drivers, Automart, New and Used cars, and Autoerotica.

name: Oh-No-Ah
description: Noah and his three sons are assigned two pairs of animals each and are attempting to securely bring them back to the ark. The flooding is in full force and it is a race against time to complete the loading of the arc with the help of rafts and smart moves on land.
categories: Animals, Dice, Educational, Maze, Miniatures, Nautical, Religious, Transportation

name: Good-bye to Dengue
description:
Good-bye to Dengue is an educational board game designed by health specialist Dr. Jeffrey Lennon, currently at Foundation University, Dumaguete City in the Philippines. The game is intended to instruct children on the environmental conditions and health practices conducive to the spread and prevention of dengue hemorrhagic fever.

Good-bye to Dengue combines traditional roll-and-move mechanics with question answering in the style of Trivial Pursuit. Board spaces represent practices (e.g., covering water containers), symptoms (e.g., a rash), and stages of the mosquito life cycle (egg, larva, pupa, adult). Players gain extra turns for answering questions correctly (for example, "are the mosquitoes that transmit dengue and malaria the same?"

Good-bye to Dengue originally appeared in an unpublished 1996 manuscript written by Lennon and titled, "Health education and control of dengue hemorrhagic fever for schools and communities." The game was later reprinted as appendices K through N of Lennon's 2001 doctoral dissertation (Univ. Alabama at Birmingham) titled The Utility of a Board Game for Dengue Hemorrhagic Fever Health Education. The dissertation is available through UMI Microform (number 3040921).

name: Kotu Elima
description:
Kotu Elima originates from Sri Lanka and is (in similar versions) also played in India and Indonesia. The "Leopard Game" is a so called South Asian Siege Game. 2 leopards attack 24 cows. For this reason it is well-known also under the name of "Cows and Leopards".

2 strategy games on one board:

Kotu Elima: Each player has 24 marbles. Goal is it to strike the opposing stones by jumping over them.

Leopard Game: First the marbles are set, then alternating one player pulls. The cows win, if the leopards cannot pull any longer, the leopards win, if they struck 8 cows.

name: Asiphile
description: Created by a South African Playwright to teach children about the dangers of AIDS. The title of the game means "Let Us Live"

name: Holidaze
description:
This game simulates the nightmarish rush to successfully complete one's shopping in the thick of the traffic surrounding the Xmas season. The objective is to be the first player to successfully complete your shopping and work your way through the traffic to the finish line. Along the way, you have the chance to increase your Xmas "Joy" and add to your opponents woes through by drawing and playing "Joy" and "Bah Humbug" cards, among others.

This game is a sister game to "Orange Barrels." If interested in learning more, you can inquire at the designer's site:
http://www.orangebarrelsthegame.com/
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Gold Rush
description: Players recreate the California Gold Rush of 1848-1849, exploring the Sierra Nevada Mountains, staking claims and panning for gold. The winner is the player who can extract the most gold in excess of his expenditures to obtain it. Players must be careful, as they can even be killed in their efforts.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting

name: Wall Street Up/Down
description:
From the publisher's website: Like Monopoly, a toss of the dice moves your game piece along the board’s squares. That same toss sends stock and bond prices up or down, sometimes soaring, sometimes plummeting; always seemingly predictable, but therein —like the real stock markets—lies its drama.

The square where your game piece lands determines your play-opportunities. The headlines of the game’s mini-newspaper—the “Wall Street News”—sets that round’s “general” direction of stock prices, up or down —but (like the real markets) when stock prices climb, bond prices are more apt to fall.

Like a surfer reads the waves, you win at this game of daring, intuitiveness and strategy, by reading the market’s clues and riding the crests of the market’s seven moods.

name: Hau-Hau koiravisa
description: A trivia game about dogs.

name: Fingerprint Expert
description: Players roll and move around the board, trying to collect a set of ten cards representing matching right and left hand fingerprints. The cards for each hand must represent the proper fingers and have matching print pattern styles. There are wild cards to aid in building each hand.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Inter
description: 1 board with 196 squares representing the world with continents in 7 different colors, 1 set of fortune cards, money, 1 die, playing pieces in 8 different colors each having: 1 president, 2 diplomats and 6 bases. Every player starts in a different continent. The aim of the game is to get as much influence in the world as possible. The player who erects bases in the 6 other continents wins the game.

name: Correspo!
description:
Correspo! is a game for young children. In the box you’ll find 54 large square colorful, lavishly hand-illustrated picture cards , plus 54 large number cards. The number cards are for more advanced games school-age children can play.
Each Correspo! box contains not one, but five games! Five games for five different age groups from 18 months to 7 years old. Numerous variations make it possible for parents to modify the five basic games for more players, for a child to play alone, for parent/child or child/child games, etc.

Some are memory games, while others of an educational nature exercise the player’s knowledge of words and numbers. Another game is built around children’s lively imaginations, while the last one simply requires luck and quick reactions.

name: Geography Lotto
description: This educational game uses six small individual cards, each depicting 8 states. Players match up smaller state cards, with information about each state on the back, to their boards.

name: Fluttery Butterflies
description: This is one of the games in the Tiny Tins line of games by Patch Products. Players take turns drawing a card from a central deck. If this card is a butterfly, you take the matching butterfly and place it on your plower. If the card is a caterpillar, you do nothing. If you draw the moth card, you take the moth (even from another player) and place it on your flower. The winner is the first player to have five butterflies on their flower and not have the moth.

name: Go Speed Go!
description:
This is one of the games in the Tiny Tins series by Patch Products.

Each players takes a race car that they are trying to move around the track. The winner is the first person across the finish line. Movement is determined from marbles dropped into the pole position construct, which is a lot like a dice tower.

name: Frontline
description:
(From publisher's website:) Frontline is a dynamic wargame for 2 players. During WW2, five soldiers are on a reconnaissance mission near a newly discovered enemy base, as they stumble upon a small squad of enemy soldiers..

Supply your team of 5 soldiers with weapons and tools and send them into battle. Try to use the dynamic landscape to ambush your opponent, or use hit and run tactics to weaken the other squad, before going in to deliver the final blow..

name: Combinatorix Jr
description:
Mandala style, with ever changing patterns.
A gracefully proportioned subset of Combinatorix, this group of squares, equilateral triangles, hexagons, and isosceles right triangles has its own 40-page booklet of explorations, designs and games.

Approximately 55 wood tiles have 1" unit sides, are 1/4" thick for easy handling, and mix four colors in all-different assortments within the 11" rounded triangular tray. No two sets are exactly alike. Display stand included. For 1 to 3 players, ages 6 to adult.

For 1 to 3 players, ages 6 to adult.
mechanics: Enclosure, Modular Board, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Fuzzy Puppy
description:
This is one of the games in the Tiny Tins series by Patch Products.

Two players (or two teams) take turns spinning and then moving their puppy around the circle. If you land on the other puppy, you collect one of the four items you need to win the game. The winner is the first player to collect a bone, bowl, bed, and ball.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Go Tell It on the Mountain
description:
This is part of the Big Deal series of card games by Patch Products.

Players attempt to collect sets of cards representing various well-known stories from the Bible.

From the Publisher's web site:

Deal the cards, make a mountain and look for matches! Have fun finding matches of classic Bible Stories like: Joseph and His Coat, David and Goliath and The Good Samaritan. In this game that plays like the long-time favorite Go Fish, you'll have fun telling your friends to Go Tell it on the Mountain!

name: Forty Niners
description:
From the box:

The 49ers - An Exciting Game of Risk and Rescue

Interesting game with very spotty rules. A single player takes the role of Blackjack the stagecoach driver who scores points by visiting settlements. The other players take on roles that attempt to thwart his efforts (bandits) or aid him (the sheriff). Once Blackjack has completed the stagecoach circuit, he tallies up points. The board is then rotated 90 degrees and each player takes on a different role. Play continues in such manner until all players have had a chance to play the role of Blackjack at which time the game truly ends and scores are compared. The highest Blackjack score wins.

Their are 4 players. BLACKJACK (Stagecoach Driver),ROARING RED (bandit), BLUEBEARD (bandit) and SHERIFF WHITE

Players play 4 rounds with each player playing a different character in each round. Roaring Red and Bluebeards' objective is to stop the stage coach by using a trail to get in front of the stage. If that happens the stage must turn around and use another trail.

The sheriffs job is to overtake the bandits, he tries to protect the coach and catch the bandits.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: Dunkerque
description:
Dunkerque is a totally new game design, based on Dana Lombardy's original 1972 Dunkerque: 1940 game, which featured big hexes, large counters with no combat factors and hidden movement, and a unit comparison table instead of dice for combat resolution. This division-level game explores possibilities in the 1940 campaign in France, including: Could German panzers cut off and destroy the British Expeditionary Force? Were the extended panzer columns vulnerable to an Allied counter stroke?

While the game’s core content is strongly derived from Dunkerque 1940, the game system and visual approach are totally new. This new graphic approach ties in with 3D components and revised game mechanics to provide a robust, realistic, yet streamlined game.

Dunkerque’s primary new design features:


Block system hidden movement
Color codes for unit quality and movement
Combat resolution using custom six-sided dice
Actual terrain map
Cards in place of air and naval units
Cards to help determine attacks, defense, random events, etc.


With the demise of Last Stand Games, it is unclear when the game would be released and under which publisher.

name: Basketball
description: This early game from Warren Built-Rite Games is numbered 883. Use cards to move your players up and down the court to score. Game is for age 8 and up. It comes with 2 Markers, Game Court, Cardboard Clock to keep track of time during the game and a Cardboard Basketball to keep track of where the ball is located on the court.

name: Allaboutfootball
description:
ALLABOUTFOOTBALL is a Trivia type board game dedicated to English football. There is a general English version, and bespoke versions for Chelsea, Arsenal, Manchester United, Liverpool, Tottenham Hotspur, Glasgow Rangers and Glasgow Celtic.

Game play design incorporates strategic decision making with a football trivia knowledge.
Contents: game board, one special die & one standard die, 18 x substitution cards, 6 x player tokens, 300 x trivia question cards

name: Les Voyages d'Astérix
description: The game is played by acquiring counters and goods in the cities of the Roman Empire. The counters and goods can be sold between players and sold to the bank. The rich players will be able to increase their profits by paying for the services of a robber who will ransom his adversaries. The winner will be the one who has eliminated the other players and increased their capital, their goods and their counters.

name: A Bit O' Blarney
description:
Fitting the mold of 1980's vintage trivia games of the, "A Bit O' Blarney" challenges its players with the literature, geography, history, legends, and other cultural aspects of Ireland. Players draw a card for their question number, choose a category, try to answer the matching question in the book, and -- if successful -- roll the die, advance, and repeat the procedure. A wrong answer ends the player's turn. Some spaces on the board force a player to answer from a specific category, though the player is limited to this constraint for only three unsuccessful turns.

The winner is the first to arrive at Blarney, "and his prize is the life-long gift of eloquence."

Ideally the game is for two to six players, though its inventor notes that the game may be played solo. Six cardboard "elves" are provided, but the inventor add that it may also be played by more than six people by adding "shirt buttons or pennies" for the other players to move with.

Finally, the game contains an optional 1-hour tape of Irish music and dance, recorded live during a summer ethnic festival in Baltimore.

name: Väripeli
description: An educational game to teach colors and train memorizing skills for small children. There 5 cards of each of 5 colors and a color die included.

name: Win-A-Word
description:
From the description: "The object of this game is to win points by building words, both on a Playing Field and in a separate Word List. Points are determined by successful completion of play, length of words, and various bonus plays. The first player to score 500 points is the winner."

Rules for five additional word-forming games are included, as are four letter racks and the playing field.

name: Foto-Religie
description:
From the publisher:

More and more people are taking an interest in each other's faith. This game makes religion accessible to everyone. Knowledge leads to understanding and understanding leads to tolerance. And it's fun too! Foto-Religie: the big photo question game about the 5 major world religions: Islam, Christianity, Buddhism, Judaism and Hinduism. A stunning design with 100 photos and 600 questions and explanations.

name: Trick & Trap
description: Trick & Trap is a strategic power game of contemporary Washington politics involving Senators, Congressmen and House Leaders. It is about their political maneuvering for power. It is an abstract game of strategy requiring logic, planning and skill.

name: Il Gioco dei Minerali
description:
Educational game (the title means "The Minerals' Game") made by the Science Museum of Sulmona for its young visitors.
The players can move in any direction: every space on the path allows a kind of action. They must collect metal counters from the table (where they are scattered face down), they can have a look at them and they can trade them. With two different metals, they can build an object. The aim of the game is to build all the five possible objects.

The game is reminescent of "Plasticopoli":
http://www.boardgamegeek.com/game/32700
mechanics: Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Comunità Montana Peligna, Museo di Storia Naturale: Sulmona

name: I.Q. Games: Dinosaurs and Prehistoric Life
description: One player reads from a list of numbered clues on the back of a card while the player on their left tries to guess the correct answer. Answering correctly from the first clue is scored highest and while answering correctly from last clue is scored lowest. Players continue taking turns until all cards have been read. Score is kept on included scorekeeper. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

name: Rugrats Backyard Toy Hunt Game
description: Spike is like any family dog: loyal, loving, and a very determined digger. This time he's taken the Rugrats' toys and buried them around the backyard. Take turns revealing toys, trying to find the three that match the color of your wagon. First player to find their three toys wins.
categories: Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Broken English
description:
Broken English is a word/card game; you start with 8 cards and try to form words. Picking up a card from the draw stack and discarding one. Once you can play all your cards as a set of words, you declare you are going out. Others then play their words and then attempt to play off the declarer's cards to form words. The cards are worth points and the more points you get, the higher the score.

Very groovy 70's color scheme.

name: Salmon Run Game
description: It's hard work being a Pacific salmon. In this game players start out with a population of 30,000 salmon eggs. By rolling the die and following the instructions on the cards, players "live" the journey of their salmon population as they develop in a stream, make their way along the Snake or Columbia rivers to the ocean, then return to the stream to mate before dying of sheer exhaustion. Along the way the salmon encounter many hazards such as predators and dams that diminish their numbers. The winner is the player who returns to the spawning site with the most adult salmon. Excellent life cycle teaching aid. Grades 7+.Developed by Steve Parker.

name: Trivia Toss
description: Trivia Toss tests your knowledge skills with 300 questions ranging from history, science, math, pop culture and more. Just toss the ball and Trivia Toss automatically asks a random question once the ball is caught. Choose your multiple choice answer by pressing one of 3 light-up buttons. Trivia Toss uses a ball constructed of soft foam for indoor or outdoor use.

name: The Pothole Game
description: Steer your van through a moving field of potholes (on a looping, motorized belt) to win the race. Hitting a pothole causes your van to lose a steel bearing.

name: Overlords: Monsters Packs
description: These eight booster packs each add new Monsters to the Overlords game, including Triple Letter Monsters and Monsters with powers of healing and berserking. The boosters are as follows: AAA, BBB, CCC, DDD, Healers and Berserkers AA, Healers and Berserkers BB, Healers and Berserkers CC, and Healers and Berserkers DD. Each booster comes with 5 Overlord cards and 21 plastic token units.

name: Darling Key Line Spin Trip
description:
Darling Keyline Spintrip

Game made by Darling Freight Company of Grand Rapids, Michigan during the mid 1950's.

This is a very simple advertising game made to make you aware of the Darling Freight Company.

There is a game board, a spinner and 4 pawns.

The object of the game is to complete the trip from the starting point of Grand Rapids, MI, around the course, back to Grand Rapids. The usual pitfalls of a simple roll and move game occur in this game.

The person completing the trip first wins!

name: Vitamins
description:
The purpose of this game is to teach the role that vitamins play in human health.

"The game includes vitamin, source, function, and disorder cards and a spinner which players use to try to match the vitamin cards with the related source, function, and disorder." (This description appeared in the journal Simulation and Games, volume VI, number 3, September 1975, pages 332-333).

name: Paying Your Way
description:
"Paying Your Way is a board game where each player is 'employed' in a position from one of twelve different occupational areas when he or she randomly selects a career card. These cards also include descriptions of each career area and a hierarchy of jobs in each area to which they may seek promotion. The board represents various incomes and expenses associated with 'making it' in the real world. Players advance markers around the board according to the throw of one die. Each player keeps track of his or her own financial records and calculates his or her own net pay. The first player who buys all items on an established shopping list is the winner."

(This game description appeared in the "Newly Available Simulations" column of the journal Simulation and Games, volume VII, number 3, September 1976, pages 339-340).

name: Golfee
description: 2 to 4 player golf game. Includes 9 full color 11x17 inch golf holes. Role the dice and drive you ball down the fairway. Try and avoid the water and sand to make it to the green. Then get out your putting dice. Game includes 4 golf club shaped pawns and 7 custom dice.

name: Aerostarz
description: A throwing game from the makers of Magz. The game includes 36 specially designed game pieces with magnetic centers, in 6 different colors. Test your skill and accuracy attempting to land your Aerostarz on those of another player. But be careful to get the magnetic polarity correct otherwise they will repel. Combine multiple sets and play with more players.

name: Tri-King
description:
The first profound expansion of chess in 45 centuries.

Chess and Checkers for 2,3 or 4 Players. Designed and Published by World Famous Artist and Inventor Yun Gee.

The Board has a patented Diamond Bridge connecting the 4 playing areas, allowing standard chess moves and strategy. A special detour piece is used when playing chess, allowing the diamond bridge to be crossed in a single move. The purpose of the detour is to line up all opposing Queens and Kings.

Game includes both chess and checkers pieces in 4 colors, rules, strategy hints, and a book of press clippings about Tri-King from major US newspapers including the New York Times and the Chicago Sun Times.

name: Ebono
description:
An African American game where Ebonic words and slang expressions are either drawn or acted out.

Imagine a cross between Charades, Pictionary,and Ebonics and you have Ebono.

The game includes 300 cards each with an Ebonic word or slang expression.

It's the party game with tude(ebonic slang for attitude). So call your Ace(best friend) and tell him to put on his slides(shoes) and come over to play Ebono.

name: Safariseikkailu
description: A Finnish bank's promotional item for approaching kids. The players are simply rolling die and going forward. There are some squares that demand the player to do something if he lands on those.

name: Cia. de Teatro
description: This is a party game in which you have to direct scenes, small parts, mimics, critics, art directing ...

name: Foot-Boom
description:
Football (soccer) game based in the World Cup 1986 in Mexico with real players and real game results.
The game is played with cards using the "Rami" (card game) playing system. You have three missions on the game: Make the selection on the top eleven, make the symbols of the results (1-home victory; h-tie; 2-visiting victory) and finally make two ads with ten words each. The winner is the player who can first accomplish two of these goals.

name: Global Watch
description: The colorful squares are divided into Earth-Friendly and Anti-Earth squares. Green Warriors join you freely on the Earth-Friendly squares, but you must defend them against powerful forces on the Anti-Earth squares. Use your knowledge of our environment to defeat the Anti-Earth forces and protect our Earth and all living creatures.

name: Canada First Quiz
description:
Distributed by Petro-Canada in the Spring of 1984, this simple trivia game contains questions about Canada in four categories. Green is general knowledge, yellow is geography, red is history, and blue is sports.

The box contains 192 cards (48 in each category), and a spinner.

Questions and answers have been written and revised by John Rbert Colombo, a well-known Canadian writer, who has dabbled in amateur history, poetry, fiction and the study of Canadian science fiction. He is also the writer a several quiz books on Canadiana.

name: Impeached
description:
From the publisher's site:

"A Hilarious, yet Serious, game that challenges your ability to create "deeds" as dastardly as those concocted by Bush and his band of Criminals. The Pursuit of Oil will force you to Lie, Cheat, and Steal.

You'll soon find that it isn't easy being a Crook, as Federal Prison looms ever near. You might even find yourself being sent to the Iraq War or better yet, IMPEACHED!"

Game comes in a pizza box ("They're slicing up American one piece at a time!") with 7 plastic pawns, game board, and cards in several categories ("Special Favor", "Oh Boy", and "Presidential Pardon").

name: The Maryland Game
description: Described as an "educational adventure". Allows players to explore the attractions and history of Maryland. Appears to be promotional in nature. Most likely linked to the tourism industry.

name: Cabbage Patch Kids Matching Game
description: The object of the game is to match the newborn Cabbage Patch Kids with their birth certificates. Game includes a 3-D game board and 14 kids with 14 matching certificates.

name: Il mio Business
description: Il mio Business ("My Business") is an economical boardgame about starting a little group of enterprises. It has been created for the project Urban 2 that is giving new impulse at the Mirafiori Nord quarter of Turin, Italy. Besides the boardgame, the box contains a manual about starting real enterprises aimed especially to young would-be businessmen.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Simulation, Trading

name: Tiger Hunt
description: A basic roll-and-move (actually accomplished with a spinner) in which players attempt to be the first to complete their hunt for a tiger. Events along the way that can delay completion include a hippo capsizing the player's canoe and an elephant stampede.

name: 3D Pool
description:
A member of the billiards family, 3D Pool utilizes three vertically-stacked "tables", with tubes connecting the corners of the adjacent tables. The four object balls and cue ball of each player (or team) start out on the top table, and players compete to get their object balls to the bottom table first. (The goal is a little different from that in each of the three suggested variants.)

The tubes between the tables not only allow the balls to descend, but also to ascend. One of the suggested variants mandates use of this ability by requiring the player not only to get her object balls to the bottom table, but then also to get her cue ball back to the top table, in order to win.

Like Crokinole and Carrom, 3D Pool is a table-top game.

name: Elastico
description: Using posts, pegs, and elastic bands (rubber bands); you attempt to surround posts with your color. this allows you to replace opponents' colors with yours. you continue until the last peg is played; this ends the game. You then lift the board, some of the posts will fall through and the ones that have the most fall through will win.

name: Los Angeles Scene
description:
Another in the grouping of SCENE games (see New York, San Francisco etc.). A Monopoly-like game set in Los Angeles, CAL. From the instructions:

The excitement of business wheelings and dealings in a fast rising metropolitan area, a thrilling tour of the local night spots, romps in the great outdoors, and desert beauty- all part of the Los Angeles Scene.

Bargain with the other players to receive a "Connection Card" which will permit you to develop your properties and thereby collected increased rent.

The object is to accumulate the most wealth.
publishers: Groovy Games, John N. Hansen Co., Inc.

name: Eurogate
description: An economic game who's goal is to get as rich as possible and learn about Euros and European Union.

name: Marble Mountain
description:
Marble Mountain is a children's dexterity game. Elements of the game are:


A large number of marbles in solid colors including red, blue, yellow, green and purple.
A yellow plastic "mountain" in a volcano shape with a small rim at the bottom to catch fallen marbles.
A matching plastic cone that marbles are poured into and that the mountain is then fitted into. The combination is inverted so that the mountain then rests on its base and the plastic cone is carefully lifted off, leaving the mountain evenly covered with a variety of solid colored marbles.
A set (I think there were 6 of these but am not positive; it might have been 4) of black cardboard playing fields cut into the profile of a mountain. Approximately a dozen circular depressions are cut into each playing field, and these have a random distribution of colors matching the marble colors painted on them.
Several sets of oversized, blue plastic tweezers with blunt tips.


The object of the game is to be the player who fills the most circles on his playing field by picking the appropriate color marbles off of the plastic mountain with the tweezers and setting them into the matching circles on his board, without causing an avalanche of marbles to cascade down the sides of the plastic mountain, and also without knocking any marbles out of their depressions on his playing field. The first child to cause an avalanche or knock over her marbles loses. In the event that none of the players create an avalanche or knock off marbles, then the first player to fill up all of the circles on her board wins.

Players must start at the base of their own mountain playing field and fill in the entire bottom row with marbles before ascending to the next row up. Since each playing field has a unique distribution of colors, players will need different colors of marbles at different points in the game. This means a layer of strategy can be added by trying to remove not only the color of marble you need next, but by selecting a specific marble of that color from the marble mountain that leaves your opponent with more difficult and avalanche-prone choices.

name: Sigmund and the Sea Monsters
description: This game is based upon the 1970's television show of the same name. A children's game (ages 7-12), it is a simple track game with dice rolling. "Object: Be first to get Sigmund back to the Shack."
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Leudalspel
description: A Dutch Rotary Club made this environmental game based on Monopoly. The region where the club is based is used in this game and the usual Monopoly elements are replaced by typical nature and buildings for the region (Limburg, Leudal). The money earned with the sales of the game (1000 copies) were used to renovate the club's monumental building.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Shocke
description:
Lovers of chess and other games based on strategy and tactics will find Shocke a new, exciting challenge as the rules of chess are modified and expanded upon – creating an entirely
new and yet familiar game.

name: Blibber Blabber
description:
Bibber Blabber: "Where Blinglish is a Second Language"

Blibber Blabber is another family word game from Patch Products.

Players take turns replacing the first sounds of all the words you want to say with a specific letter sound and see if your team can guess the Blibber you are blabbing. It's a tongue-twisting game of funny sounds and phrases.

On each turn, spin to find out which letter sound will be used to describe the words on the Blibber chip you have drawn. For example, if your Blibber is "Penguin," and you spin "B," you must begin all your words with the "B" sound. You might want to say, "This animal lives in the Arctic," but instead would have to say, "Bis Banimal Bivs Bin Be Barctic." If you spin the letter combination "SH," it would be, "Shis Shanimal Shivs Shin She Sharctic."

You can pass if your team gets stuck, but then you risk losing the Blibber chip to your opponents. Also, if you blab using an incorrect sound, the other team gets your chip. Continue collecting Blibber chips and describing words to your teammates until the 60-second timer runs out. The team with the most Blibber chips at the end of the game wins.

name: Contraception: The Board Game
description:
As players move around the board they come into contact with statements and questions which stimulate discussion and reinforce or elicit teacher input.

Playing CONTRACEPTION® highlights areas where understanding may be lacking.

*The game looks at the mechanics of contraception through questions and true / false statements.

*Through these statements clear distinction is made between safe and risky sexual behavior.

*Advancing around the board brings players into contact with various advice centers and resources where contraceptive and sexual health services can be accessed: e.g. Young Persons Sexual Health Services, pharmacy, condom machines, GP's, Family Planning Clinics and Accident and Emergency Units.

Players are also directed at various intervals during the game to make an assertive statement which strengthens their ability to express their own needs and decline unwanted pressure.

Peer education is a key feature of the game. At certain stages a question card will present two options, for example (1) Using the condom demonstrator (included in the game) show the group how to put on a condom. OR (2) Answer a question. The game therefore offers the group peer education opportunities in a safe environment, practicing use of language relating to safe sex, whilst building confidence.

name: Renaissance I
description:
Players draw up to 7 cards each turn, then "publish" as many works as they can. Publishing is accomplished by holding a "work" which is attributed to a specific city and the city card in question.
The game is over when the deck is exhausted. The winner is the player who has the most published works.
The game is based in California.

name: Idols Tähtipeli
description: This game was published in Finland to promote the TV-show "Idols". Now it's up to the players to decide who will be the new Idol-superstar. You'll have to be able to recognize pieces of music, sing along and continue singing after the music has stopped so make sure you know the music well. In order to play players need a stereo and their own CDs or some other way to get all the pop music glory onto air.

name: American Trivia Challenge Texas Style
description: A player or team answers questions about Texas in six categories to collect bars for their flag. The categories are: Americana, Arts & Sciences, Business, Et Cetera, Fun & Games, Government & History, and People, Places & Things. Once their flag is full, they must then answer a question in the category of their opponents' choice to seal the win.

name: The Earth Dinner
description:
The Earth Dinner is an animated theme dinner party for all ages, connecting people to their food and the earth -- and each other.

The Earth Dinner uses cards to provoke discussion of our food, where it comes from, and how we experience it.

(Adapted from introduction in game rules.)

name: Vinspillet
description: The Idea with "Vinspillet" is that the players in a fun and entertaining way get knowledge about French wine. Players role a die and move on a map of France. The players can buy chateaus when landing on one, if you land on another players chateau you have to pay him/her money buying a cask of wine. Players may trade with each other during the game. At some spots you have to pick up a special event card and do as the card tells you. If you land on a a spot with a question mark you get a question form the pile of question marked cards. If your answer is right you win a number of casks equal to a die roll. The game ends when all chateaus are sold. The winner is the one who has the most capital when having counted money and the value of his/her properties.

name: Dick Tracy Detective Game
description:
A simple children's race game which takes place on a colorful map of the northeast U.S. The board and its spaces are illustrated with characters from the Dick Tracy comic strip.

Components include a game board, four markers, and spinner. Rules are printed inside the box lid.

name: Temporal Trade
description: In Temporal Trade, with one of eight scenario's to choose from, the game is begun in the past time frame and players may elect to purchase businesses and improve upon their business with the purchase of business facilities or stores in the past. However when one player lands upon a "Pier" space and meets the conditions required on the pier space, the player may enter in to a path of contiguous spaces leading into the interior of the game board which intersect at a central space entitled the "Temporal Time Ship Space" or time portal wherein the entire game, if that player so chooses, is transported into the future and all costs and expenses automatically change for all players. Of course, a second player, upon arriving at the "Temporal Trade Time Ship Space", may elect to transport the game values back into the past phase tense. The goal is to avoid bankruptcy where in you would be eliminated from the game, but to become the richest or last player who has accumulated the greatest wealth, including the value of businesses, property, and cash on hand over the game playing period.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Alexander's Triumph
description: A game detailing Alexander's brilliant siege of Tyre in 332 B.C., using the old-school grid movement system. Includes all relevant land, naval, and siege units, as well as pieces to build Alexander's mole out to the city.

name: Presidents Rummy
description:
Packed with information, Presidents Rummy teaches children about US Presidents and the eras in which they served. A rummy game is supplemented by numerous variations.

Game includes 50 playing cards (includes 2 blank cards for future Presidents which is handy as the last one is Bill Clinton), 2 directions cards, and 2 additional information cards

name: NATO Vs. Warsaw Pact: 1989
description: This is a 'what-if' variant on Axis & Allies set in 1989 during the outbreak of a global conflict between NATO and the Warsaw Pact countries. Player nations include the USSR and China on one side and the USA and NATO on the other, with plenty of neutral countries which may join one side or the other during the course of the game. Maps, charts, and rules are all provided but you must provide your own playing pieces.

name: Flight Path
description:
Billed as "the exciting flying race", this game presents a race competition between up to six glider pilots.

From the box: "Your objective, having been launched to 10,000 feet in your glider, is to race across the countryside avoiding all manner of obstacles, hoping not to crash land before you get to the finish."

"Stretching your flying skills to the limit as your competitors place tactical problems in your path, you are forced to search the sky for those much needed thermals to gain valuable height in order to clear the mountain tops and reach the final winning runway."

name: Clout: Marvel
description:
An expansion to Clout Fantasy set in the Marvel Universe.

As of early 2007, this game's release is on indefinite hold.

The Clout range seems to have been discontinued.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip
publishers: (Looking for a publisher), Hidden City Games

name: Old Dinosaur
description:
(from the web site)

WATCH OUT FOR T-REX! Discover the world of dinosaurs as you play three favorite card games: "Old Maid," "Go Fish," and "Concentration."

Discover:

- Which flesh-eating dinosaur was even bigger than T-Rex?
- Which dinosaurs had feathers but could not fly?
- Who was a "missing link" between dinosaurs and birds?

Learn a little French as you play different card games. The cards have dinosaur descriptions in both English and French. They also give each dinosaur's Latin name and how to pronounce it, and show you how big each dinosaur was.

47 playing cards and a dinosaur guide come in a fun tin box. Ages 5 and up.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Memory

name: Sackers
description:
From the Publisher's web site:

Addictive game combining horseshoes and shuffleboard. Great for the beach, picnics, tailgate parties or even your own backyard.

Aim for year-round fun with our indoor/outdoor action game. Earn points when beanbags go through the hole or remain on the board at the end of your turn. But watch out… your opponents’ beanbags may knock yours off the board! Sackers combines the fun of horseshoes and shuffleboard in a game that’s safe, portable and addictively fun!

For 2 Players or Teams

No. 8000
Ages 8 & Up

name: Mad Scientist University Course Packet: Anthropology
description:
Course Packs add 50 new cards from a specific discipline to the Mad Scientist University core game.

From the publisher:

ANTHROPOLOGY: The excavation has taken months, but it's been worth it. Brushing away the ancient dust, you find an excellent collection of stone-age pottery shards with terrible lizards carved in them. They all laughed in school, but you always knew you'd find the missing link between cavemen and dinosaurs!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Science Fiction

name: Mad Scientist University Course Packet: Dorm Life
description:
Course Packs add 50 new cards from a specific discipline to the Mad Scientist University core game.

From the publisher:

DORM LIFE: Overpriced living. Cramped quarters. Unsanitary conditions. Strange roommates. All this can be yours, at Mad Scientist University's on-campus living! We have: Communal showers, to bring the community together. A meal plan, because we know mad scientists forget to eat. Plenty of spare vermin, in case you need cheap experiment subjects or just forgot to feed your snake. Sign up for your cell today!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Science Fiction

name: Mad Scientist University Course Packet: Physics
description:
Course Packs add 50 new cards from a specific discipline to the Mad Scientist University core game.

From the publisher:

PHYSICS: Your current assignment is to become incorporeal. The Physics department is doing experiments on how to walk through walls and survive impacts. With enough depleted uranium, you would have no problem making someone incorporeal, but you haven't quite figured out how to keep your test subjects alive...

Expands:

Mad Scientist University
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Science Fiction

name: A Taste of Transylville Terror
description:
Our story revolves around the recent murder of Transylville's local beauty queen - Virgina Vestalata. Her killer sits amongst a group of unusual friends gathered together for an anniversary celebration, but that person has every reason to keep their involvement a secret.

If those present are able to deduce the murderer correctly, the guilty party will receive their just desserts, and Virginia's soul will be able to rest in peace.

However, if the group fails, the killer will escape prosecution, and Virginia's soul will spend an eternity in torment, endlessly searching for justice whilst trapped in the barren "Netherworld" -- The Land of Lost Souls -- a desolate place between this world and the next.

name: Speakeasy Street
description: The Mayor of Chicago is hosting the event of the year at the Hard Knock Café. Everyone who is anyone will be there and you don't want to miss out. The year is 1926 and the times are roaring! It is not unusual that crime runs rapid in this section of the city, but with all the big names attending, security is bound to be very tight. You decide this is as good a time as any to check out the infamous Hard Knock Café. However, be prepared to experience all that there is to be had in the dark underworld of Speakeasy Street , including a murder!

name: Stranded
description: Stranded brings together an unlikely cast of characters who find themselves trapped between fate and chance. An eccentric family becomes the only hope for rescue for a bus load of weary travelers. But when a murder takes place and with the killer still among you, panic and accusations abound. You must now sift through the clues and a web of lies and deception to solve the mystery of Stranded.

name: Power, Plots and Pistols
description:
Our story revolves around the horrific murder of Lord Henry Blacksnake, whose body has been found lying next to his severed head, on the floor of the Great Hall of Buckingham Castle.

As confusion reigns in the darkness, the Night Watch immediately seals off all castle exits and ensures that no one leaves. A fretful night of fear ensues, but fortunately, dawn sees the coincidental arrival of self appointed Witchfinder General Matthew Hopkins, who immediately assumes control of the situation, and, suspecting foul play, calls for an Inquisition of those characters found within the castle walls.

For those involved, the stakes could not be higher, as Hopkins decrees that the person selected by the others as being the likely murderer, will be immediately taken to the dungeons for a period of relentless torture at the master inquisitor's hands, until they are ready to admit to their guilt.
Hopkins is confident the guilty party will be found, as his tried and tested methods have yet to fail!

name: Räuber und Gendarm
description:
The thrilling detective game - who will catch the robber? The stocky robber hides in a house, up a tree, under a bush or in a rainwater butt. The detective is close on his heels.
The hunt grows more exciting every minute. Luck and a clever combination of clues will help to catch the thief.

Two players lay out the robber's trail with colored chips on the board, taking care not to let the other player see the secret track. Then both turn detective, trying by careful search of the colored drawings to find the trail laid by the other player. Winner is the one to spot the villain first.

3 variants are explained on the rules sheet.

name: USA Any Way
description: This is similar to tic-tac-toe and played on the 3x3 grid. The big difference is that each player has only three tiles: U, S, and A. Players take turns placing their letters onto the tic-tac-toe board, IN ORDER (U, S, then A). After all 6 letters have been played. Players take turns moving their letters IN ORDER. When a player gets their three tiles in a row, in order (backwards is okay, ASU) that player wins.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Pattern Building, Square Grid

name: Big Deal: Noah's Ark Card Game
description:
Another in the "Big Deal" series of card games from Patch Products...

From the Publisher:

How good is your memory? Play Noah’s Ark and get your mind working! Take turns finding pairs of animals that Noah took along on the Ark. You’ll want to keep playing over and over… for 40 days and 40 nights!

Instructions in English and Spanish.

No. 6619
Ages 4 & Up
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Memory, Religious

name: Big Deal: Stuff the Stockings! Card Game
description:
Another in the "Big Deal" card game series from Patch Products...

From the Publisher's web site:

Holiday card game fun!

Deal the cards, look for matches and don’t be left with the LUMP OF COAL!Look for pairs of toys and goodies! Stuff the Stockings plays like a long-time favorite, so you’ll have sleigh-loads of fun trying to find the most pairs and leaving your friends with the LUMP OF COAL!

For 2 to 4 Players

No. 6615
Ages 5 and up

name: Cross Country Race by Land, Air and Sea
description:
The game is a race from Kansas City to New York. It is a spin and move game from 1911.

Planes and Cars start the race in Kansas City and Boats are placed initially in Chicago. All Aeroplanes (sic) must always move using Black Lines, Automobiles using Green Lines and Boats using Red Lines. You can change modes of travel at any common station as long as there is a conveyance that is available and not in use by someone else. Changing from one mode of transportation to another uses up your turn. Lots of things can happen to you on your way across the country. (well half a country)(see some of the pictures for examples)

All pictures of the game come from DAN also known as(treasuresof-yesterday)an EBAY seller who had the game for sale. I saw the game and wrote him asking for permission to use his photos and he kindly game that permission to me.

name: Duell der Elemente
description:
Two players measure in a Magicians duel. The cards used are open on the table and form a player's hand of spells. By skillful play the players try to score victory points for fire, water or air and develop their supremacy.

3rd Place 2006 Hippodice Spieleautorenwettbewerb.

name: Whirligig
description:
As described by the publisher:

Whirligig, The Musical Chairs Game inspired by Art Linkletter on his famous "House Party" program . . .

The twelve bears sit in the inner "tubs" as the Whirligig turns. When it stops, players scramble to put the twelve bears into the 11 outer "tubs". Each new "whirl" - there is one bear less, until there is only one - the winner!"

The whirligig is lazy-susan type object with small cups or "tubs" to hold small plastic bears. Players take turns rotating the whirligig, which makes music as it turns. Players are encouraged to sing a song while rotating the whirligig.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music, Party Game, Racing

name: Mysticards: Deck of Ancients
description: The first expansion to Mysticards: Deck of Dragons. The deck is a stand-alone game containing 60 all-new cards with the same rules as the Deck of Dragons. It also contains rules on switching cards between the decks to create new decks. With one copy of Deck of Dragons and one copy of Deck of Ancients it will be possible to create 16 unique decks.

name: Archäo
description: Players are archaeologists trying to find valuable objects on different continents. In this game from Bernd Eisensteiner it's not only trying to find desired coins or amphorae, but also about sabotaging other players sites.

name: Grand Slam
description:
Elaborate late sixties design consisting of a large plastic play mat about 40" square suspended off the ground using metal rods and wooden posts. There is a centrally located raised plastic bowl type structure used for scoring.

Players have 3 thick plastic pucks which they place on the plastic play surface in designated positions. Players must in turn try to whack these up into the scoring bowl (2 points/5 points in the center) using the equipment provided (tiny hard paddles on long wooden sticks). Pucks that fall through certain holes in the play mat are eliminated.

The player with the highest score when all pucks are either in the scoring bowl or have been eliminated is the winner.

name: Happy Birthday Party Games: Rodeo Relay Race
description:
From the Publisher's web site:

The Galloping Game of Hats & Horses.

Saddle up and get ready to ride! Two teams race their toy horses to see who can finish first. Can you gallop from here to there with a little horse between your knees and a mini-cowboy hat on your head? Sure would be fun to try, and sure would be funny to watch! Woohoo!

Instructions in English and Spanish.

For 4 or More Players in Teams

No. 6730
Ages 4 & Up

name: Counteract
description:
"It challenges your judgment and defies your sense of balance!"

The game consists of a 20" plastic circular maze which is supported by a single central 18" rod connected to a tripod base. There are circular depressions around the circumference of the maze where steel balls are placed and thus affect the way the maze tilts.

There are nine balls in all - eight smaller steel balls and a larger 'counteract' ball which is placed in the maze. The counteract ball must be manipulated into a depression located at the center of the maze by careful placement of the steel balls around the perimeter. Players must move three steel balls per turn.

The first player who causes the counteract ball to roll into the central depression (the 'winner's circle') is the winner.

name: Strike Force: Hammer
description:
From the Publisher's web site:

Strike Force Series

Designed to introduce a novice wargamer to conflict simulation, these games rely on familiar mechanics from other games you may have played to allow players to focus on strategy instead of learning new rules.

Strike Force: Hammer

This game introduces a bit more combat, including tanks, scouts, commanders, and militia. Instead of hunting bad guys, you're trying to take control of your opponent's territory by getting your population into his city.

name: RAFFLES: The Sophisticated Game of Chance
description: In Raffles, players wager chips on the results of a throw of three 6-sided dice. Payouts vary from 180:1 for results of three of a kind, 3, or 18; to 1:1 for a throw total that within a given range, odd sum, or even sum. The goal is to accumulate the greatest value in chips. Game components include a number of small plastic chips, a cloth wagering surface on which players place their chips, three dice, and a paper dice cup. Corey Game Co. was a division of the Quality Paper Box Co. of East Boston, Massachusetts.

name: All at Sea
description:
From the Publisher's web site:

All at Sea is a murder mystery game for 16 to 33 guests and one or two hosts.

Join us in a thrilling evening of plotting, mystery and treachery. You will be in the middle of the action and it will be up to you to wheel and deal with the other guests. Can you achieve your goals, keep your secrets hidden and survive All at Sea? It's up to you.

Who killed Captain Bayard - and why? Find out in All at Sea.
It is 1914 and the First World War has just broken out. On an American cruise ship in the middle of the Atlantic Ocean, diplomats, dignitaries and the crew must grapple with not only the outbreak of war but also the murder of Captain Bayard.

All at Sea lasts for about four hours and is suited to an evening. It is often played over a meal - a finger buffet if possible to allow guests to circulate and talk in private.

The free introductory pdf file (43 KB) contains an introduction to the game, a list of all the characters, an invitation to send to your guests - plus details of how to buy the game.

name: Dragon's Loot Dueling Dice
description:
Dragon's Loot Dueling Dice

Components: 10 differently colored beads (jewels), a bag and 4D6. Each die has: Wizard, King, Dragon 1, Dragon 2, Dragon 3, Dragon 4.

All jewels start in the bag. Each player receives a die. Players roll their die at the same time. Player with the highest roll takes a jewel. If highest roll is a tie, tied players roll again until there's a highest roll. Rolling a King makes you put a jewel back in the bag (if you have any). Once all jewels are drawn, player with most jewels wins.

name: Soldiers with Repeating Cannon Game
description: Soldiers with Repeating Cannon game by J Pressman & Co., Inc. Made in U.S.A. No. 1560. This game is from the 50's. This game comes with 16 standing soldiers, made of thick cardboard, and a wooden, spring loaded, repeating firing cannon. The cannon comes with 20 wooden bullets. Turn the crank and watch the bullets project themselves into the standing soldiers. Knock them all down and you win!!!

name: The Killer Reunion
description:
From the Publisher's web site:

This murder mystery game is rated for Teen and Adult audiences. The murder does not take place at the party although there may be further murders that do. The main 12 characters are all couples very much in love. There are no affairs at all in this game. This game was created for church groups, class reunions or those looking for a VERY clean murder mystery game.

We also have a Mature rated Version. It is still relatively clean, but has more intrigue then the 'clean' version and it does have 1 past affair.

A Killer Reunion was written to be a little different than the rest of our games. First of all the main suspects are all couples very much in love. Couples will be working together at times to achieve goals. They may have some secrets from each other, but overall they will be working to protect each other. This gives the game a romantic flavor. This murder mystery game is what we would call a 'clean' game. There are no affairs & people are basically good. This game is great for church groups, high school & college reunions or others who are worried about the possibility of offending guests. It can also be used for older teen groups!

Another difference is that the murder happens before the game. Being a couples murder mystery we felt it would be too complicated to murder them both or only one. That is not to say that there won't be more murders during the evening. Those tend to happen in our games since we provide a lot of intrigue outside of the murder itself.

This is the same game as our Class of '57, but we removed all reference to year & school so that people could customize it to any year, decade or school. We have areas in the game that can be customized by you to perfectly match your event.

The 12 player version has 6 couples and we include our 2 Extra Character Packets to expand the game up to 32. The Extra Character Packets add a little quirky flavor to the party, but not all of these 20 extra characters may be suitable for conservative groups. (Remember... these are included FREE in the 12 player version, no need to purchase them!)

Home Page: http://www.dinnerandamurder.com/games/killerreunion.htm
publishers: Dinner and a Murder Mystery Games LLC

name: Fabrication
description:
From the Publisher's web site:

TEAM OBJECTIVE: Your team has 60 seconds, in a continuing story, to tell an outrageously tall tale. You, or one of your team members, must "work in" one of the Fabrication Lines selected from your game and try to stump your opponents for points. When time is up, the opposing team may now score by guessing correctly: WHO said
the line? and WHAT was the Fabrication line in your fabricated story. Some lines are real ZINGERS! Stump your opponents to earn DOUBLE POINTS with the ZINGER line. The team players with the most points are the winners, great fabricators and know Fabrication when they hear it!
Let your imagination run wild! But, in team play, if you suddenly get a "brain cramp" you may pass "Pass the Buck" at any time to another team player to pick up where you left off.
Contents: 100 Fabrication Line Cards,
100 Story Starter Help Cards, 3 Pass the
Buck Cards, 60 second sand timer,
score pad, pencil and easy instructions.
INDIVIDUAL PLAY OBJECTIVE: You have up to 60 seconds, in a continuing story, to tell an outrageously tall tale. You must "work in" the Fabrication Line selected from your game card and try to stump your opponents for points. When time is up, the opposing players may now score by guessing correctly: WHAT was the Fabrication line in your fabricated story. Some lines are real ZINGERS! Stump your opponents to earn DOUBLE POINTS with the ZINGER line. The player with the most points is the winner, a great fabricator and knows Fabrication when they hear it!

name: Strike Force: Eagles
description:
From the Publisher's web site:

Strike Force Series

Designed to introduce a novice wargamer to conflict simulation, these games rely on familiar mechanics from other games you may have played to allow players to focus on strategy instead of learning new rules.

Strike Force: Eagles

Strike Force: Eagles introduces airmobile units that speed around the battlefield in their assault helicopters. Just like the other games in the Strike Force series, this one simplifies combat to make it accessible for non-wargamers, and will be a PDF download.

name: The Battle at Durk's Well
description:
The Battle of Durk's Well is a simple asymmetric wargame. One player controls settlers (led by Anders Durk) who have settled in a valley and the miners working nearby. The other player is a nearby wizard who sends a group of Orrks and Spooks to poison the well (on which both settlers and miners depend) and burn down the settlers' houses.

According to the designer's notes, the settlers and miners are inadvertently damaging the Orrks' and Spooks' environment, so it's not a simple good-vs-evil battle (although the background doesn't affect the gameplay to any great extent).

Components consist of a 4-part paper map (with hand coloring, it appears), paper counters, and a set of rules.

name: Space War
description:
Space War is a strategic space conflict game. The 2-4 players each start with a single home planet and must accumulate resources to build ships, capture additional planets (obtaining more resources), and eventually conquer the other players' home planets.

There are three types of ships that can be built, plus immobile (but transportable) star bases. Somewhat unusually, players must keep track of each ship's fuel and weapons, and have a ship stop off for refueling when its onboard fuel supply gets too low. The deck of cards adds events and such to the long version of the game.

The components consist of a board, 4 record sheets in plastic folders, crayons for the record sheets, a reference chart, a set of rules, a deck of cards, and 4 sets of pre-cut counters.

The 1977 edition of Space War was sold in a rectangular box. The game was also published in ziplock format as Space War II. Based on the apparent similarity in the components between the two editions, it is unclear if there were any substantive revisions to the game or if the two editions simply involved a change in packaging.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Movement Points, Paper-and-Pencil, Player Elimination

name: Court in the Act
description:
From the Publisher's web site:

Court in the Act is a murder mystery game for 13 to 21 guests and a host.

Join us at the court of Queen Elizabeth I of England for an evening of revelry, intrigue and murder. You will be in the middle of the action and it will be up to you to wheel and deal with the other guests. Can you achieve your goals, keep your secrets hidden and survive Court in the Act? It's up to you.

At Court in the Act you will discover the following:


Who murdered the Archbishop of Canterbury?
Why must Queen Elizabeth never marry?
Who wrote Shakespeare's plays?
What is the secret of Dr John Dee's magical powers?
...and can England be saved from defeat by the Spanish Armada?


Find out in Court in the Act!
Court in the Act
The Court of St James's Palace, London, in the reign of Queen Elizabeth I. All present have but lately arrived from the Royal premier of Master Shakespeare's latest rib-tickling comedy, Two Ladies of Venice. Now, the Queen makes merry and entertains her courtiers, guests, would-be husbands and envoys from foreign powers with a sumptuous banquet. But while all prepare to feast and frolic, dark clouds gather, the sound of war-drums is heard in the distance - and that dear old man the Archbishop of Canterbury, who surely had never an enemy in the world, is found brutally murdered.

Court in the Act lasts for about four hours and is suited to an evening. It is often played over a meal - a finger buffet if possible to allow guests to circulate and talk in private.

The free introductory pdf file (35 KB) contains an introduction to the game, a list of all the characters, an invitation to send to your guests - plus details of how to buy the game.

name: Casino Fatale
description:
Casino Fatale is a murder mystery game for 15 to 20 guests and one or two hosts - download the free introductory pdf file (35 KB).

Join us at an exclusive Parisian casino for an evening of espionage, crime, intrigue and murder. You will be in the middle of the action and it will be up to you to wheel and deal with the other guests. Can you achieve your goals, keep your secrets hidden and survive Casino Fatale? It's up to you.

At Casino Fatale you will discover the following:


Who is the 'Black Panther'?
Why should you be very careful with your jewelery?
Who killed scientist Dr Havelott, and where are his plans for a nuclear device?
Who is the mysterious 'Mr X'?
Can Donovan Jones really write poetry?
...and is the casino really up for sale?


Find out in Casino Fatale!
On the banks of the River Seine in Paris is the Hotel D'Etoile, with a casino named the Casino Fatale. Rumor has it that the casino is connected to the mysterious underworld character 'Mr X'. No one seems to know exactly who the elusive Mr X is, or what he looks like - and there are many people who would love to know. Among those trying to find Mr X are Interpol, the local police, the local organized crime family, and the agents of several countries in which Mr X is believed to operate. Tonight, however, a charity auction is being held at Casino Fatale and it has drawn all sorts to the casino - playboys, starlets, maybe even a jewel thief… Who will you play?

Casino Fatale lasts for about four hours and is suited to an evening. It is often played over a meal - a finger buffet if possible to allow guests to circulate and talk in private.

The free introductory pdf file (35 KB) contains an introduction to the game, a list of all the characters, an invitation to send to your guests - plus details of how to buy the game.

name: Murder at the Four Deuces 2
description:
From the Publisher's web site:

This is the sequel to Murder at the Four Deuces. It is 5 years later and Don & MeMe Wannabe are hosting their annual New Years Eve Gala at their speakeasy The Four Deuces and you are invited to attend. The cream and not so cream of society will be there again.

This murder mystery game is rated for Teen and Adult audiences. The murder takes place at the party. There are references to prohibition / booze. This game has no affairs, but there are so many sub-plots going on that it has all the excitement of the first game. There is also no prostitute, madam or house of ill repute referenced in this version. They were not needed to bring the game forward 5 years. This is actually a pretty clean game that still manages to be very exciting in spite of it:-) It is filled with twists and turns.

Murder At The Four Deuces 2 is the sequel to our very popular Murder at the Four Deuces. It takes place 5 years later at a New Years Eve Party and has most of the original characters returning, along with a few new ones. You are not required to have played the original game to play this one, but I highly recommend doing so, as it does add a depth to the game. Guests who have played before will have a greater understanding of the characters, motives and backgrounds. If guests are playing the same character as previously played they will really have a blast with their matured character.

It's New Years Eve 1924 and Don & MeMe Wannabe are hosting their annual New Years Eve Bash at their speakeasy The Four Deuces and you are invited to attend. The Four Deuces is a lavish joint. The cream and not so cream of society will be here. With gangsters, hit men, politicians, opera singers, molls and many other interesting guests in attendance there are sure to be a lot of big deals being made here tonight.

Home Page: http://www.dinnerandamurder.com/games/4deuces2.htm
publishers: Dinner and a Murder Mystery Games LLC

name: The Boneyard Murder!
description:
In this game, the murder of Lord Sagen Ray takes place at the start of the party....but that doesn't mean he stays dead and buried.

Once again, the infamous celebrities of the "dark side" have gathered together for their annual secret gala and this time it is a "fete champetre" (outdoor feast)! Each year they assemble on All Hallow's Eve for a chilling celebration of sinfulness, an evening of evilness and a night chock-full of nightmares….to say the least. This year's blast will be NO exception as there is sure to be some major blood-curdling and hell-raising going on! And so on this evil evening, black silhouettes of broomstick riders can clearly be seen across the bright full moon as they head for the annual bash. The setting is perfect - a long forgotten cemetery where vampires and zombies, ghosts and ghouls, and mummies and monsters from all over the globe will party hardy ... until the sun begins to rise.

"So what happened?" Last seen, everyone was having a delightfully devilish time. The guests were feasting on a barbeque of Malaysian monkey brain medley, river rat ragout, along with bubbling cauldrons overflowing with the potent plasma of Peruvian llamas. Bone chilling music, provided by Haggy May Maudlin and the "Undertakers", echoed through the graveyard. A séance was in session and interestingly enough, the spirit of Sir Matthew Tudworthy had been conjured (executed for wizardry on October 31, 1694, Grave Harbor's only recorded execution). All in all, the boneyard bash was quite the smash! …that is until Lord Sagen Ray arrived.

"Tell us more." Suddenly the evil gaiety stilled in silence as Lord Ray and Nadia Tarot (local gypsy extraordinaire) became involved in a rather "heated" conversation. Nadia was heard to lash out, "Liar! Liar!! Lord Sagen Ray…..you are nothing but a miserable master of falsehoods, an overlord of deception and, worst yet……..a loathsome heart breaker!!!!

Nadia burst into tears and dashed toward a grove of pine. The music began once again but the party was disrupted, for the second time, when an arrow flying through the air with the force of the devil speared and lodged into Lord Sagen Ray's head. Sagen's blood covered body then fell upon the grave of Sir Matthew Tudworthy.

Now it is time to join the Bogey Mann; Count and Countess Cadaver; the Grave Harbor Butcher; the Cemetery Skreecher; Boney Baloney; Black Beauty (the Headless Horsewoman); the ghosts of Sir Matthew Tudworthy and Lord Sagen Ray and many, many other creatures of the night. So get ready for a ghoulish, ghastly evening of masquerade, mystery and, of course, MURDER!

name: Murder at Farthingay Manor
description:
From the Publisher's web site:

For 6 guests!
